description: Trying to establish why startup is slow for some folks.  Possible cause is large history, but it may be something else too.  Getting a profile for this will be a good start at identifying the problem.
my_mothod: Trying to establish why startup is slow for some folks.  Possible cause is large history, but it may be something else too.  Getting a profile for this will be a good start at identifying the problem. Establish why startup can be so slow normal Places Toolkit

description: Hello, Installer (Monzilla seamonkey) crashes at setup. After copying all the files, a  dos(sic) windows appears saying : *** Registering sidebar JS components nNCL: registering deferred (0) WEBSHELL+ = 1 and another window appears with title confirm migration When i select <OK> A Dr watson windows appears The DOS Windows says now  WEBSHELL- = 0 WEBSHELL+ = 1 WEBSHELL- = 0 I have the Drwatson.log if y need it.  Also, there's a problem at installation. At the Windows titled <Start install>  the subwindow is empty, i.e. it doesn't say default directory, etc. i choose  custom installation, but didn't add/remove anything.  I use a Windows NT SP-6a, Netscape 4.7 Regards   C. Kilitzirakis
my_mothod: Hello, Installer (Monzilla seamonkey) crashes at setup. After copying all the files, a  dos(sic) windows appears saying : *** Registering sidebar JS components nNCL: registering deferred (0) WEBSHELL+ = 1 and another window appears with title confirm migration When i select <OK> A Dr watson windows appears The DOS Windows says now  WEBSHELL- = 0 WEBSHELL+ = 1 WEBSHELL- = 0 I have the Drwatson.log if y need it.  Also, there's a problem at installation. At the Windows titled <Start install>  the subwindow is empty, i.e. it doesn't say default directory, etc. i choose  custom installation, but didn't add/remove anything.  I use a Windows NT SP-6a, Netscape 4.7 Regards   C. Kilitzirakis Mozilla crashes at startup/when run for the first time blocker DOM: UI Events & Focus Handling Core

description: A really minor aesthetic problem:  On Windows M13 (Win32 build 2000012520), when I bring up the "Search > Find on this Page" dialog, the text box mysteriously "captures" part of the underlying window; ie, the menu bar or browser window is visible underneath the text entry area in the dialog box until I type text into the "Find Text" box.  I can provide a screenshot if needed.
my_mothod: A really minor aesthetic problem:  On Windows M13 (Win32 build 2000012520), when I bring up the "Search > Find on this Page" dialog, the text box mysteriously "captures" part of the underlying window; ie, the menu bar or browser window is visible underneath the text entry area in the dialog box until I type text into the "Find Text" box.  I can provide a screenshot if needed. text entry for "Find on Page" box grabs underlying window trivial General SeaMonkey

description: Another bug-or-feature (for i'm realy not sure about this one): I'am filling this field and then i switch to another task (Alt-Tab or by mouse click) and then I come back to this browser window and continue typing but text doesn't show up because this field doesn't have the focus anymore. This is not normal behaviour (acording to Netscape 4.7). This also can be of help: if i switch to another task and back using Alt-Tab combination then main menu bar has the focus (pressing for example "T" opens "Tasks" menu). Because of the "Alt"?
my_mothod: Another bug-or-feature (for i'm realy not sure about this one): I'am filling this field and then i switch to another task (Alt-Tab or by mouse click) and then I come back to this browser window and continue typing but text doesn't show up because this field doesn't have the focus anymore. This is not normal behaviour (acording to Netscape 4.7). This also can be of help: if i switch to another task and back using Alt-Tab combination then main menu bar has the focus (pressing for example "T" opens "Tasks" menu). Because of the "Alt"? Form component focus problem minor DOM: Core & HTML Core

description: Steps to reproduce: 1. download mozilla...bin file, clean mozregistry and profiles folder 2. choose Mozilla ProfileManager or Mozilla ProfileWizard 3. Fill in data and press start 4. Seamonkey is launched-  5. Quit seamonkey 6. Choose Mozilla Select Profile or another option  Actual results: crash on exit (will get stack crawl after testing netscape...bin  file- 2nd launch shows splash screen then stops  Expected results: no crash, relaunch   build 2000020109
my_mothod: Steps to reproduce: 1. download mozilla...bin file, clean mozregistry and profiles folder 2. choose Mozilla ProfileManager or Mozilla ProfileWizard 3. Fill in data and press start 4. Seamonkey is launched-  5. Quit seamonkey 6. Choose Mozilla Select Profile or another option  Actual results: crash on exit (will get stack crawl after testing netscape...bin  file- 2nd launch shows splash screen then stops  Expected results: no crash, relaunch   build 2000020109 [PP]Cannot launch second time. blocker Build Config SeaMonkey

description: When running the table regression tests, Viewer asserts and after continuing, it  hangs. To run the regression tests on Windows, map your s drive to the  directory above mozilla, go to layout\html\tests\table\core and run "rtest  baseline". It also fails in any of sibling directories of core (e.g. bugs,  viewer_tests, marvin, dom, other).
my_mothod: When running the table regression tests, Viewer asserts and after continuing, it  hangs. To run the regression tests on Windows, map your s drive to the  directory above mozilla, go to layout\html\tests\table\core and run "rtest  baseline". It also fails in any of sibling directories of core (e.g. bugs,  viewer_tests, marvin, dom, other). [BLOCKER] Viewer asserts/hangs during regression tests blocker DOM: Navigation Core

description: If we use window.open continously to load new pages, for first 4 times its fine, but fith time it crashes application. In our automation testing we open new window for loading every new testcase, and now this is blocking automation. BUILDS: 2000-02-01-00. OS TESTED ON: Win-95, Win-98, MACOS. STEPS TO REPRODUCE: 1] Please visit above URL. 2] You'll see one parent window. This parent window will keep on opening one child window. 3] You'll see one counter on child window. When this counter reaches 4, after that 5th time, you'll see crash. OR 1] Please copy HTML codes I'm providing for parent window, as well as child window. Save those HTML files. Make chages in variabe 'url' in parent window code, according to new file locations. 2] Open parent file with above specified builds. 3] You'll see one parent window. This parent window will keep on opening one child window. 4] You'll see one counter on child window. When this counter reaches 4, after that 5th time, you'll see crash. EXPECTED RESULTS: Parent window should open child window 5 times, since we are limiting counter to 6. ACTUAL RESULTS: 5th time it crashes application. TESTCASE CODE FOR PARENT WINDOW START: Continous Window.Open() This is Parent Window which is going to open child window 5 times. TESTCASE CODE FOR PARENT WINDOW END: TESTCASE CODE FOR CHILD WINDOW START: Child window This is child window which is going to get opened by parent window 5 times. TESTCASE CODE FOR CHILD WINDOW END:
my_mothod: If we use window.open continously to load new pages, for first 4 times its fine, but fith time it crashes application. In our automation testing we open new window for loading every new testcase, and now this is blocking automation. BUILDS: 2000-02-01-00. OS TESTED ON: Win-95, Win-98, MACOS. STEPS TO REPRODUCE: 1] Please visit above URL. 2] You'll see one parent window. This parent window will keep on opening one child window. 3] You'll see one counter on child window. When this counter reaches 4, after that 5th time, you'll see crash. OR 1] Please copy HTML codes I'm providing for parent window, as well as child window. Save those HTML files. Make chages in variabe 'url' in parent window code, according to new file locations. 2] Open parent file with above specified builds. 3] You'll see one parent window. This parent window will keep on opening one child window. 4] You'll see one counter on child window. When this counter reaches 4, after that 5th time, you'll see crash. EXPECTED RESULTS: Parent window should open child window 5 times, since we are limiting counter to 6. ACTUAL RESULTS: 5th time it crashes application. TESTCASE CODE FOR PARENT WINDOW START: Continous Window.Open() This is Parent Window which is going to open child window 5 times. TESTCASE CODE FOR PARENT WINDOW END: TESTCASE CODE FOR CHILD WINDOW START: Child window This is child window which is going to get opened by parent window 5 times. TESTCASE CODE FOR CHILD WINDOW END: Continous 5 times Window.open crashing application. blocker DOM: Core & HTML Core

description: Could not open new window with window.open in script tags. If we try to open new window on certain event then it does open new window. [For  example, if we open new window on button click or something, or onLoad or any  other event then it works.] But if we try to open new window with window.open  mentioned in scrpt tags, then it does not open new window. [This bug was there  for almost two three days now]  This one is blocking our automation on Linux.  BUILDS: 2000-01-31-14.   STEPS TO REPRODUCE: 1] Please visit the URL I mentioned above.  OR  1] Please copy HTML code I'm providing. Save it as HTML file. 2] Open this HTML file with above mentioned builds.  EXPECTED RESUTS: As soon as you load the page, it should open new window adn load www.yahoo.com  in new window.  ACTUAL RESULTS: It does not open new window.  TESTCASE CODE START: <HTML> <HEAD><TITLE>Continous Window.Open()</TITLE></HEAD> <BODY> This is Parent Window which is going to open child window 5 times. <SCRIPT> <!--  url = 'http://www.yahoo.com';  testWin = window.open(url, 'testWindow');      //--> </SCRIPT> </BODY> </HTML> TESTCASE CODE END:
my_mothod: Could not open new window with window.open in script tags. If we try to open new window on certain event then it does open new window. [For  example, if we open new window on button click or something, or onLoad or any  other event then it works.] But if we try to open new window with window.open  mentioned in scrpt tags, then it does not open new window. [This bug was there  for almost two three days now]  This one is blocking our automation on Linux.  BUILDS: 2000-01-31-14.   STEPS TO REPRODUCE: 1] Please visit the URL I mentioned above.  OR  1] Please copy HTML code I'm providing. Save it as HTML file. 2] Open this HTML file with above mentioned builds.  EXPECTED RESUTS: As soon as you load the page, it should open new window adn load www.yahoo.com  in new window.  ACTUAL RESULTS: It does not open new window.  TESTCASE CODE START: <HTML> <HEAD><TITLE>Continous Window.Open()</TITLE></HEAD> <BODY> This is Parent Window which is going to open child window 5 times. <SCRIPT> <!--  url = 'http://www.yahoo.com';  testWin = window.open(url, 'testWindow');      //--> </SCRIPT> </BODY> </HTML> TESTCASE CODE END: Could not open new window with javascript on Linux. blocker DOM: Core & HTML Core

description: found this using the 2000-02-01-08 comm bits on winNT.  to repro, 1. go to above URL. 2. the AutoFill Password dialog appears. since i don't have a userid/passwd for  this site, i just keep the fields blank. 3. uncheck the "Save these values" checkbox. 4. click the Cancel button.  result: the dialog disappears briefly...then reappears (text fields are blank,  but the checkbox is selected again). doesn't go away. clicking either OK  or Cancel will just repeat this result, too. forced to shutdown the browser  (eg, close box widget). here's the console output:   *** Timing layout processes on url: 'chrome://global/content/commonDialog.xul', webshell: 02D76DD0 change lock icon to unlock - new document WEBSHELL+ = 7 Total (Layout + Page Load) Time (webshell=02DF1060): Real time 0:0:0, CP time  0. 031 WEBSHELL+ = 8 Total (Layout + Page Load) Time (webshell=02E3E870): Real time 0:0:0, CP time  0. 047 Reflow time (this=02DD5720): Real time 0:0:0, CP time 0.156 Frame construction plus style resolution time (this=02DD5720): Real time 0:0:0, CP time 0.016 Style resolution time (this=02DD5720): Real time 0:0:0, CP time 0.000 Total (Layout + Page Load) Time (webshell=02D76DD0): Real time 0:0:0, CP time  0. 203 commonDialogOnLoad WEBSHELL- = 7 WEBSHELL+ = 8 Total (Layout + Page Load) Time (webshell=02E58220): Real time 0:0:0, CP time  0. 047 Move window by 0,20 screen x 0screen y 0 ! nsSecureBrowserUIImpl found: chrome://global/content/commonDialog.xul change lock icon to unlock ?(chrome 0)  expected: not totally clear on what should happen upon cancelling (or entering  invalid info), but the dialog should go away and then allow the user to  continue using the browser.

description: Sometimes, I will see on single line text boxes the very top arrow button of a scroll bar appear along the right edge of the box. I looks like the browser is trying to draw a scroll bar on these single line boxes. You can click the button, but it doesn't do anything. Entering text into the field will usually make it go away again. I don't know what makes it happen, it just does occasionaly. I'm using M13, and I've seen it occur on both Win32 and Linux builds. I searched the bugzilla database and couldn't find a previous mention of it, but since I would think it's rather common (happens to me often), I apologize in advance if this is a duplicate bug.
my_mothod: Sometimes, I will see on single line text boxes the very top arrow button of a scroll bar appear along the right edge of the box. I looks like the browser is trying to draw a scroll bar on these single line boxes. You can click the button, but it doesn't do anything. Entering text into the field will usually make it go away again. I don't know what makes it happen, it just does occasionaly. I'm using M13, and I've seen it occur on both Win32 and Linux builds. I searched the bugzilla database and couldn't find a previous mention of it, but since I would think it's rather common (happens to me often), I apologize in advance if this is a duplicate bug. Occasional scroll bar appearance on text boxes minor DOM: Core & HTML Core

description: goto the URL above ( http://games.eesite.com/earth ). If you have an account, go ahead in log in, other wise just make up anything and click "submit". Once in, there will be a large, main frame, a top frame, and a menu frame to the left side. The words are hyperlinks, but if you right click, the menu that appears mozilla acts as if if were just regular text, i.e. no "open in new window" or "copy this link to clipboard" options.  using M13 on win98. Haven't tested on other platforms
my_mothod: goto the URL above ( http://games.eesite.com/earth ). If you have an account, go ahead in log in, other wise just make up anything and click "submit". Once in, there will be a large, main frame, a top frame, and a menu frame to the left side. The words are hyperlinks, but if you right click, the menu that appears mozilla acts as if if were just regular text, i.e. no "open in new window" or "copy this link to clipboard" options.  using M13 on win98. Haven't tested on other platforms Wrong behavior of right click of linked images minor XUL Core

description: In the README file under the installation section, you might want to point out and reference all of the dependencies that  the GD Perl module has (libgd, libpng, etc) even though they are listed in the GD Perl module readme. This will make it easier to download all of the necessary items before doing the install.
my_mothod: In the README file under the installation section, you might want to point out and reference all of the dependencies that  the GD Perl module has (libgd, libpng, etc) even though they are listed in the GD Perl module readme. This will make it easier to download all of the necessary items before doing the install. Instructions for installing the GD Perl module minor Bugzilla-General Bugzilla

description: After creating a new email account using the account wizard, the identity prefs  for the account are not displayed in the Account Manager. However, if you then  exit the Account Manager and come back, the identity prefs for the account are  correctly displayed.  Build ID 2000-01-31-11  Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch mail 2. Open Account Manager (Edit|Account Settings ...) 3. Press the "New Account" button 4. Proceed through the wizard to set up a new mail account (in this case, a POP  account) 5. Open the Account Manager. Note that at the top level for the account settings  for the new mail account, there are no identity prefs. 6. Press "OK" at the bottom of the Account Manager 7. Open the Account Manager. The identity prefs are now correctly populated in  the top level for the the account settings for the new mail account.
my_mothod: After creating a new email account using the account wizard, the identity prefs  for the account are not displayed in the Account Manager. However, if you then  exit the Account Manager and come back, the identity prefs for the account are  correctly displayed.  Build ID 2000-01-31-11  Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch mail 2. Open Account Manager (Edit|Account Settings ...) 3. Press the "New Account" button 4. Proceed through the wizard to set up a new mail account (in this case, a POP  account) 5. Open the Account Manager. Note that at the top level for the account settings  for the new mail account, there are no identity prefs. 6. Press "OK" at the bottom of the Account Manager 7. Open the Account Manager. The identity prefs are now correctly populated in  the top level for the the account settings for the new mail account. Identity Prefs not displayed in Acct. Mgr. after creating new account normal MailNews: Account Configuration SeaMonkey

description: Using 2000-02-02-08m14 commercial build on linux rh6.0  Opening a news account then getting news dialogs of any kind (alerts, download headers, etc.) will cause a hang/crash.  The dialogs come up blank and even if you can close them, app windows eventually blank out and app hangs/crashes.  1.   Launch and go to mail window (I was using a POP profile). 2.   Did not login to mail, went directly to news server, expanded it and selected a group.      Different scenarios to use here:      A. click File|Subscribe  (my subscribe dialog comes up blank, fenella's didn't      B. select a group which will give you a download headers dialog (pref set to warn you before downloading N headers  (dialog is blank in all tests so far)      C. select a group which is not really on the server, in which case a "no such group" alert dialog will pop up and is blank 3.   Dismiss/close any dialog which appears. 4.   Wait a little and notice windows going blank. Eventually hangs/crashes.  Talkback incidents: can't get to cyclone right now will update with incidents.

description: If you delete a Mail account, then add a News account, the identity preferences  specified in the Account Wizard for the News account are ignored. Instead, the  identity preferences for the deleted Mail account are inserted in the newly  created News account.  Build ID: 2000-02-01-08  Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Mail 2. Delete one of your email accounts (Edit | Account Settings; select top level  of email account, and press "Delete" button) 3. Add a news account using the Account wizard (Edit | Account Settings; hit "Ne  Account" button, proceed through wizard to create a "news" account). At the end  of the wizard, you are left in the Account Settings screen.  Actual result: No identity prefs for the news account are displayed. Expected result: The identity prefs you just entered in the Wizard for the news  account are displayed.  4. Press "OK" to exit from the "Account Settings" dialog. 5. Open Account Settings again (Edit | Account Settings) and select the newly  created news account  Actual result: Identity prefs for newly created news account contain the  identity settings for the email account you recently deleted Expected result: Identity prefs you just entered in the Wizard for the news  account should be displayed.  Note: The newly created identity *is* available in the "From" field of the Mail  Compose window.
my_mothod: If you delete a Mail account, then add a News account, the identity preferences  specified in the Account Wizard for the News account are ignored. Instead, the  identity preferences for the deleted Mail account are inserted in the newly  created News account.  Build ID: 2000-02-01-08  Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Mail 2. Delete one of your email accounts (Edit | Account Settings; select top level  of email account, and press "Delete" button) 3. Add a news account using the Account wizard (Edit | Account Settings; hit "Ne  Account" button, proceed through wizard to create a "news" account). At the end  of the wizard, you are left in the Account Settings screen.  Actual result: No identity prefs for the news account are displayed. Expected result: The identity prefs you just entered in the Wizard for the news  account are displayed.  4. Press "OK" to exit from the "Account Settings" dialog. 5. Open Account Settings again (Edit | Account Settings) and select the newly  created news account  Actual result: Identity prefs for newly created news account contain the  identity settings for the email account you recently deleted Expected result: Identity prefs you just entered in the Wizard for the news  account should be displayed.  Note: The newly created identity *is* available in the "From" field of the Mail  Compose window. Added News Account Picks up Identity Prefs from Deleted Mail Account major MailNews: Account Configuration SeaMonkey

description: Ever since Mac OS builds with an actual installer (rather than just an archive),  there's been builds listed as:  * Installer  * Install .bin   However, the "Installer" builds are actually just a decompressable archive, and  the Install .bin builds are actually builds that include a full installer.  I'd suggest consistency with other platforms listed. (e.g. "Installer" for the  MozMacInstaller build, and something like "StuffIt Archive" for the mozilla-mac- mxx builds)  CC:ing sfraser who probably knows the standard phrases for these types of  installations from his years of experience writing shareware.
my_mothod: Ever since Mac OS builds with an actual installer (rather than just an archive),  there's been builds listed as:  * Installer  * Install .bin   However, the "Installer" builds are actually just a decompressable archive, and  the Install .bin builds are actually builds that include a full installer.  I'd suggest consistency with other platforms listed. (e.g. "Installer" for the  MozMacInstaller build, and something like "StuffIt Archive" for the mozilla-mac- mxx builds)  CC:ing sfraser who probably knows the standard phrases for these types of  installations from his years of experience writing shareware. "Install" and Installer" reversed for Mac OS builds minor Miscellaneous mozilla.org

description: BugSplat doesn't seem to want to move this bug, manually copying instead... ********************************************************************************  This may not be a bug, and it may depend on some language in the specification over just what version of Unicode we claim to support.  Java is bowing to international pressure, and adding support for the 'Euro' character in the next minor release.  I think this is towards conformance with Unicode 2.1; ECMA-262 v. 1 mentions Unicode 2.0, I think.  Maybe this'll be a version 2 feature.  If we support this character, we need to make a few modifications to the table in jsstr.c; it might also be good to look at any other changes in Unicode 2.1 at that time.  Here's the letter detailing the change to Java:           Alok Rishi <alok@Eng.Sun.COM>   06/26/98 19:51  Subject: Review: Java Language Specification - Unicode 2.1/Euro support      To: java-lic@blort.Eng.Sun.COM, alok@javahome.Eng.Sun.COM  [Kindly note the change in review period end date: now July 13th]  Summary:  The European Monetary Union (EMU) is introducing a new common currency, the euro, on January 1, 1999 in eleven European countries. Licensees and developers alike have expressed a strong desire that euro support be included in the JDK as soon as possible, beginning with JDK 1.1.7. This would entail updating the Java Language Specification to reflect the Unicode 2.1 standard, along with implementing the necessary changes in JDK 1.1.7. Kindly review the proposed changes and send your feedback to javasoft-jls-comments@eng.sun.com, by July 13th.  Details:  While the euro is being added to JDK 1.2, we normally would not consider such a change in a JDK maintenance release (JDK 1.1.X). However, there are several key factors for adding the euro in JDK 1.1.7 release.  First, the euro represents a unique circumstance with a profound global impact on all companies doing business in Europe. Second, the impact is imminent; applications written for the European market must be ready to handle the euro by January 1, 1999. Third, the euro changes are based on the Unicode standard and thus, changes to the JDK will be minimal (see details below).  Finally, many of our licensees and developers have expressed a strong desire for euro support now to ensure adequate time to incorporate it into existing applications.    To reflect the Unicode 2.1 standard, the changes required in the Java Language Specification involve updates to the java.lang.Character class. (Note that in the actual implementation, it will require modifying more than just the Character class.)    The Unicode 2.1 version has a number of corrections to the character property data, including the new character for the euro.  However, only only some of these will be visible to Java programs.  The java.lang.Character API only exposes selected attributes of Unicode characters.  (For details, see ftp.unicode.org/Public/2.1-Update.) For illustrative purposes, we provide a table below that compares the visible changes from Unicode 2.0.14 (used in JDK 1.1 through 1.1.6) to Unicode 2.1.2 (latest published Unicode version) for JDK 1.1.7 as follows:   Method                  when given   under             under JDK 1.1.7, java.lang.Character.*   character:   JDK 1.1-1.1.6,    it will return                                      it will return    the value:                                      the value:       ---------------------   ----------   ----------------- ---------------- toLower                 \u018e       \u0258            \u01dd toLower                 \u019f       \u019f            \u0275 toUpper                 \u01dd       \u01dd            \u018e toTitle                 \u01dd       \u01dd            \u018e toUpper                 \u0258       \u018e            \u0258 toTitle                 \u0258       \u018e            \u0258 toLower                 \u0275       \u0275            \u019f toUpper                 \u03c2       \u03c2            \u03a3 toTitle                 \u03c2       \u03c2            \u03a3 toUpper                 \u1e9b       \u1e9b            \u1e60 toTitle                 \u1e9b       \u1e9b            \u1e60 getType                 \u20ac    UNASSIGNED(0)        CURRENCY_SYMBOL(26) isDefined               \u20ac       false             true isJavaIdentifierPart    \u20ac       false             true isJavaIdentifierStart   \u20ac       false             true getType                 \u301f START_PUNCTUATION(21)   END_PUNCTUATION(22) getType                 \ufffc    UNASSIGNED(0)        OTHER_SYMBOL(28) isDefined               \ufffc       false             true  Note:  The most important of these, is the inclusion of 20AC, the Euro character.  Although Unicode 2.1.2 is shown above, we plan to update to the latest published Unicode 2.1.x version available for the JDK 1.1.7 release. Therefore, the final diffs in the table above may undergo minor variations reflecting changes between these Unicode 2.1.x releases.  We welcome your feedback.  Please send it to javasoft-jls-comments@eng.sun.com, by July 13th.  Thanks.   ------- Additional Comments From mccabe  09/21/98 15:15 -------   I've checked the current ECMAScript v1 (edition 2) draft, and the conformance section states that characters will be interpreted in conformance with the Unicode v2.0 standard - which doesn't include the above Unicode 2.1 changes.  We might want to consider adopting Unicode 2.1 (Or higher?  Perhaps Unicode will have 3.0 by then) for ECMAScript v2, in which case we should make these changes. This will put us technically out of conformance with ECMAScript 1, but I don't think anyone will care.  ------- Additional Comments From mikeang  09/21/98 16:44 -------   The changes from Unicode 2.0 to 2.1 seem to be mostly minor corrections and  clarifications.  There are some changes to the bidirectional algorithms.  The  differences are on the unicode website at  http://www.unicode.org/unicode/reports/tr8.html I would guess that our European customers really want the Euro character, and  that the only people who get upset will be those who want conformance for its  own sake.  Maybe if we bundle this with getting rid of \u it will seem like less  of a change.  ------- Additional Comments From mccabe  09/21/98 17:05 -------   Reassigning to our i18n delegate.

Although Unicode 2.1.2 is shown above, we plan to update to the latest published Unicode 2.1.x version available for the JDK 1.1.7 release. Thanks.   ------- Additional Comments From mccabe  09/21/98 15:15 -------   I've checked the current ECMAScript v1 (edition 2) draft, and the conformance section states that characters will be interpreted in conformance with the Unicode v2.0 standard - which doesn't include the above Unicode 2.1 changes.  We might want to consider adopting Unicode 2.1 (Or higher?  Perhaps Unicode will have 3.0 by then) for ECMAScript v2, in which case we should make these changes. The  differences are on the unicode website at  http://www.unicode.org/unicode/reports/tr8.html I would guess that our European customers really want the Euro character, and  that the only people who get upset will be those who want conformance for its  own sake.  Maybe if we bundle this with getting rid of \u it will seem like less  of a change.  ------- Additional Comments From mccabe  09/21/98 17:05 -------   Reassigning to our i18n delegate. info needed for new Euro character? minor JavaScript Engine Core

description: I noticed this bug last week.  I use the Hitbox stat counter and m13 duplicates  visitors.  One visit created 9 users, this is also the amount of times that the  dos window underneath the browser window reported an error with the history  function.  I believe this is time based (the longer you stay on the site, the  more hits are rung up on the counter.

One visit created 9 users, this is also the amount of times that the  dos window underneath the browser window reported an error with the history  function. description: I've noticed that java initializes on startup, in fact all plugins do. It  appears that the plugins directory is iterated through during startup and all  the plugins are re-registered (in nsPluginHostImpl::GetPluginFactory). Since  plugins can now just be viewed as components, we should rely on the standard  component registration in xpcom to manage them. (Wasn't that the whole point of  the 4.x plugin adapters, etc.?)  nsPluginHostImpl::GetPluginFactory takes 4.07% of startup time after  eliminating idle times from Quantify, and time spent in LoadLibrary.
my_mothod: I've noticed that java initializes on startup, in fact all plugins do. It  appears that the plugins directory is iterated through during startup and all  the plugins are re-registered (in nsPluginHostImpl::GetPluginFactory). Since  plugins can now just be viewed as components, we should rely on the standard  component registration in xpcom to manage them. (Wasn't that the whole point of  the 4.x plugin adapters, etc.?)  nsPluginHostImpl::GetPluginFactory takes 4.07% of startup time after  eliminating idle times from Quantify, and time spent in LoadLibrary. java/plugins initialize at startup normal Plug-ins Core

description: The little menu hilites around the active menu item disappear if you click a menu item repeatedly.  Very minor issue.  Reproduction steps: 1.  Click the file menu to open the menu. 2.  Click the file menu again the close the menu. 3.  Click the file menu once more to open the menu - notice the lack of hilite around "file"  Actual Behaviour: There is no hilite present around the File menu item  Expected Behaviour: The third click should hilite the menu as the first one did.
my_mothod: The little menu hilites around the active menu item disappear if you click a menu item repeatedly.  Very minor issue.  Reproduction steps: 1.  Click the file menu to open the menu. 2.  Click the file menu again the close the menu. 3.  Click the file menu once more to open the menu - notice the lack of hilite around "file"  Actual Behaviour: There is no hilite present around the File menu item  Expected Behaviour: The third click should hilite the menu as the first one did. Menu hilite missing on second click minor XUL Core

description: this is new, as of using today's comm bits on linux, at least [2000-02-04-08].  to repro: 0. check the initial state of, say, the default homepage by grep'ing your prefs.js. eg, mine said    user_pref("browser.startup.homepage", "http://bugzilla.mozilla.org");  1. open Prefs, go to Navigator panel. 2. change the default homepage to, say, http://www.google.com 3. click OK. 4. grep prefs.js to observe the [lack of] change.  what's really bizarre was that for a while shrir wasn't able to repro this (same bits, same platform) till he suddenly got a crash opening prefs (see bug 26588). after restarting seamonkey, he can no longer change his homepage.  moreover, this might affect all of prefs, since syd chatted with me recently about similar problems when trying to change IM prefs. syd, could you pls provide further details (which panel, platform, etc)?
my_mothod: this is new, as of using today's comm bits on linux, at least [2000-02-04-08].  to repro: 0. check the initial state of, say, the default homepage by grep'ing your prefs.js. eg, mine said    user_pref("browser.startup.homepage", "http://bugzilla.mozilla.org");  1. open Prefs, go to Navigator panel. 2. change the default homepage to, say, http://www.google.com 3. click OK. 4. grep prefs.js to observe the [lack of] change.  what's really bizarre was that for a while shrir wasn't able to repro this (same bits, same platform) till he suddenly got a crash opening prefs (see bug 26588). after restarting seamonkey, he can no longer change his homepage.  moreover, this might affect all of prefs, since syd chatted with me recently about similar problems when trying to change IM prefs. syd, could you pls provide further details (which panel, platform, etc)? changes in preferences not written to prefs.js blocker Preferences SeaMonkey

description: Saw this on: Mac 2000-02-04-10 M14 Win 2000-02-04-10 M14 Linux 2000-02-04-08 M14  Steps to repro: (Note: I did this after a clean install..removed registry and profiles and  worked with a new profile, though it seems to occur with migrated profiles  also.) 1)Launch Seamonkey. When the Browser comes up, pull down Edit-->Preferences. 2)Go to either "Mail and Newsgroups" or "Instant Messenger" categories. 3)Uncheck any *checkboxes* which are defaulted in these categories. 4)Click on OK to dismiss the Prefs dialog box. 5)Either    a) Pull down Edit-->Preferences again to see if the changes were "kept" in  these categories or     b) Exit Seamonkey, relaunch Seamonkey, and check these prefs in  Edit-->Preferences to see if they have been kept.  Actual results: Check boxes revert back to default settings. Expected results: Check boxes keep changed settings.
my_mothod: Saw this on: Mac 2000-02-04-10 M14 Win 2000-02-04-10 M14 Linux 2000-02-04-08 M14  Steps to repro: (Note: I did this after a clean install..removed registry and profiles and  worked with a new profile, though it seems to occur with migrated profiles  also.) 1)Launch Seamonkey. When the Browser comes up, pull down Edit-->Preferences. 2)Go to either "Mail and Newsgroups" or "Instant Messenger" categories. 3)Uncheck any *checkboxes* which are defaulted in these categories. 4)Click on OK to dismiss the Prefs dialog box. 5)Either    a) Pull down Edit-->Preferences again to see if the changes were "kept" in  these categories or     b) Exit Seamonkey, relaunch Seamonkey, and check these prefs in  Edit-->Preferences to see if they have been kept.  Actual results: Check boxes revert back to default settings. Expected results: Check boxes keep changed settings. [BETA1]Prefs for checkboxes not remembered major Preferences SeaMonkey

description: Using 2000-02-04-10m14 commercial build on Mac OS 9.0   Maybe a side effect of bug #26344, or fix of bug #25103  When you Reply-All to a message which has several addressees, the compose window will open but application is then frozen.  Reply and new message do not exhibit this behavior, nor does reply-all if original message has only a couple addressees.  1.  Open POP or IMAP account. Select a message in a mail folder having several addressees -- 3 or more. 2.  Click Reply-All.  Compose message appears with partial address header list. 3.  Try to click in or close the compose window. Can't. Application is frozen.  Result:  application hangs upon opening reply-all message window having more than a couple addressees.  Note:  NT 4.0 and Linux builds don't have this problem, however they do not show all addressee headers until you click in the address block.
my_mothod: Using 2000-02-04-10m14 commercial build on Mac OS 9.0   Maybe a side effect of bug #26344, or fix of bug #25103  When you Reply-All to a message which has several addressees, the compose window will open but application is then frozen.  Reply and new message do not exhibit this behavior, nor does reply-all if original message has only a couple addressees.  1.  Open POP or IMAP account. Select a message in a mail folder having several addressees -- 3 or more. 2.  Click Reply-All.  Compose message appears with partial address header list. 3.  Try to click in or close the compose window. Can't. Application is frozen.  Result:  application hangs upon opening reply-all message window having more than a couple addressees.  Note:  NT 4.0 and Linux builds don't have this problem, however they do not show all addressee headers until you click in the address block. infinite reflow in addressing widget with more than one recipient blocker Composition MailNews Core

description: found this using the non-comm bit on winNT [2000-02-04-10]. unfortunately, talkback didn't generate a report. :-(  to repro, try to open a file by *either* going to File > Open File, or File > Open Web Location then clicking the Choose File button. this will bring up the native file picker for windows. i try to change the directory location or select a file, and mozilla crashes.
my_mothod: found this using the non-comm bit on winNT [2000-02-04-10]. unfortunately, talkback didn't generate a report. :-(  to repro, try to open a file by *either* going to File > Open File, or File > Open Web Location then clicking the Choose File button. this will bring up the native file picker for windows. i try to change the directory location or select a file, and mozilla crashes. win: Open File crashes mozilla blocker UI Design SeaMonkey

description: sometimes when buglist.cgi is displaying its table, it leaves out a <td> for  the platform field, which throws the whole row off (and probably breaks things  in more anal browsers.) the reason for this is that rep_platform is declared as  possible to be NULL, and if buglist.cgi gets a NULL it just skips the <td>.  instead, it should insert a blank space. to fix this, change  if (!defined $value) {   next; }   to...   if (!defined $value) {   $value = " "; }
my_mothod: sometimes when buglist.cgi is displaying its table, it leaves out a <td> for  the platform field, which throws the whole row off (and probably breaks things  in more anal browsers.) the reason for this is that rep_platform is declared as  possible to be NULL, and if buglist.cgi gets a NULL it just skips the <td>.  instead, it should insert a blank space. to fix this, change  if (!defined $value) {   next; }   to...   if (!defined $value) {   $value = " "; } buglist.cgi can miss a <td> minor Bugzilla-General Bugzilla

description: Version: Apprunner Build: 2000020108 Platforms: All  Expected Results: In a Button element, alignment values should be applied to the  assigned element  What I got: In a Button element, align values such as "center" or "right" which  have been applied to P elements are not functioning.    Steps to reproduce:  1) Open the attached test case in Apprunner.  2) The Button element contains several P elements:   *The first P element has no aligned and is the width is the longest among the P  elements.   * The second P has been assigned "right" align.  * The third P has been assigned "center" align.  3) The second and third elements are not rendering with the assigned alignment.
my_mothod: Version: Apprunner Build: 2000020108 Platforms: All  Expected Results: In a Button element, alignment values should be applied to the  assigned element  What I got: In a Button element, align values such as "center" or "right" which  have been applied to P elements are not functioning.    Steps to reproduce:  1) Open the attached test case in Apprunner.  2) The Button element contains several P elements:   *The first P element has no aligned and is the width is the longest among the P  elements.   * The second P has been assigned "right" align.  * The third P has been assigned "center" align.  3) The second and third elements are not rendering with the assigned alignment. Align attribute not working inside Button element trivial Layout Core

description: [Is this the right category? I am guessing here..]  Under my m12 linux build of mozilla, the status bar's highlighting doesn't work quite as expected. When one puts the mouse over an item in the task bar (The ship's rudder control, the envelope, the rolodex and the pen icon, plus the mozilla and Open Windows drop down controls) or the graphical toolbars minimize and maximize toolbar features (left-hand side of the screen) and then moves the mouse out of the window, the item remains highlighted. The desired action is probably to unhighlight all items when the mouse leaves the window.  Of course this is a very minor cosmetic thing, and it took me until today to notice that behaves funny. So don't bend over backwards to fix it. :)  Thanks!
my_mothod: [Is this the right category? I am guessing here..]  Under my m12 linux build of mozilla, the status bar's highlighting doesn't work quite as expected. When one puts the mouse over an item in the task bar (The ship's rudder control, the envelope, the rolodex and the pen icon, plus the mozilla and Open Windows drop down controls) or the graphical toolbars minimize and maximize toolbar features (left-hand side of the screen) and then moves the mouse out of the window, the item remains highlighted. The desired action is probably to unhighlight all items when the mouse leaves the window.  Of course this is a very minor cosmetic thing, and it took me until today to notice that behaves funny. So don't bend over backwards to fix it. :)  Thanks! Task bar doesn't dehighlight as expected.. trivial UI Design SeaMonkey

description: In the prefs window, mousewheel section, if I drop down the select box and click on a selection, the list doesn't collapse back up like it should.  I can see underneath of it that the radio button selections are changing, so I know the fact I selected the list element is getting registered.  But the dropdown list just stays there.  Furthermore, the widget seems to *think* it's rolled up, because the list is nonfunctional until I "drop it down" again.  This is a major usability problem because it prevents access to anything under the dropdown list.
my_mothod: In the prefs window, mousewheel section, if I drop down the select box and click on a selection, the list doesn't collapse back up like it should.  I can see underneath of it that the radio button selections are changing, so I know the fact I selected the list element is getting registered.  But the dropdown list just stays there.  Furthermore, the widget seems to *think* it's rolled up, because the list is nonfunctional until I "drop it down" again.  This is a major usability problem because it prevents access to anything under the dropdown list. [Inc Reflow]Select widget doesn't collapse blocker XUL Core

description: Commercial builds will take users to Netcenter's ureg server for the initial  registration process. Bug 24681 has more details. For the beta, the url that  Netcenter has provided us is   http://ureg-beta.netscape.com/activation/en/activation.cgi  The above url on loading should get redirected to   http://ureg.netscape.com/iiop/UReg2/reg/register?U2_ENDURL=http://ureg-beta.nets cape.com:80/activation/en/activation.cgi?action=end&U2_EXITURL=http://ureg-beta. netscape.com:80/activation/en/end.html?result=cancel&U2_SOURCE=ACTIVATION&U2_LA= en&U2_CS=ISO-8859-1  Redirect happens fine in 4.x browser.  Using the mozilla the url remains the same instead of the url bar field getting  filled with the redirected url and a blank window shows up.  So, I'm thinking that we have not yet implemented the url redirect. This feature   is needed as early as possible to test the activatiuon service (a beta1  feature). I am making 24681 dependent on this bug.  NOTE : If I supply the browser with the long redirected url (mentioned above) in  the url bar, I see the page getting loaded fine.  Putting BETA1 keyword in the summary.
my_mothod: Commercial builds will take users to Netcenter's ureg server for the initial  registration process. Bug 24681 has more details. For the beta, the url that  Netcenter has provided us is   http://ureg-beta.netscape.com/activation/en/activation.cgi  The above url on loading should get redirected to   http://ureg.netscape.com/iiop/UReg2/reg/register?U2_ENDURL=http://ureg-beta.nets cape.com:80/activation/en/activation.cgi?action=end&U2_EXITURL=http://ureg-beta. netscape.com:80/activation/en/end.html?result=cancel&U2_SOURCE=ACTIVATION&U2_LA= en&U2_CS=ISO-8859-1  Redirect happens fine in 4.x browser.  Using the mozilla the url remains the same instead of the url bar field getting  filled with the redirected url and a blank window shows up.  So, I'm thinking that we have not yet implemented the url redirect. This feature   is needed as early as possible to test the activatiuon service (a beta1  feature). I am making 24681 dependent on this bug.  NOTE : If I supply the browser with the long redirected url (mentioned above) in  the url bar, I see the page getting loaded fine.  Putting BETA1 keyword in the summary. URL redirect implementation needed blocker Networking Core

description: When Ctrl+left mouse click (Cmd for Mac) is used in a table cell, the selection code should find the enclosing cell and emit a notification using the nsISelectionListener object instead of doing the usual text selection.  This will be used by the editor to manage table element selection. We also need methods (in the nsISelection interface?) to set and set  "table selection" mode. Note that this work is already done, correct, Mike?
my_mothod: When Ctrl+left mouse click (Cmd for Mac) is used in a table cell, the selection code should find the enclosing cell and emit a notification using the nsISelectionListener object instead of doing the usual text selection.  This will be used by the editor to manage table element selection. We also need methods (in the nsISelection interface?) to set and set  "table selection" mode. Note that this work is already done, correct, Mike? Implement row and column selection using mouse major DOM: Editor Core

description: this is a strange one --make sure you follow all of the recipe steps. found while using the 2000-02-07-09 comm bits on linux. (not able to repro using the same bits on winNT.)  1. go to a webpage --use the above url at afterstep.org, or http://www.mozillazine.org 2. click on a link to go to another page in the site. eg, at afterstep, i clicked the Installation link. 3. click in the webpage to bring focus (bug 9701), then hit the spacebar several times to attempt to page down. (you'll fail due to bug 23401 anyway.) 4. grab the vertical scrollbar widget to scroll down the page.  result: at some point, usually during step 4 (occaisionally at step 3), seamonkey will crash. if description: The Init() method of nsFirstLetterFrame.cpp involves re-resolving the style context of continuing frames. Once the new style context is known, newSC, the code proceeds as:  138       if (nsnull != newSC) { 139         if (newSC == aContext) { 140           NS_RELEASE(newSC); 141         } 142         else { 143           aContext = newSC; 144         } 145       }  Line 143 suggests that the previous pointer is overwritten, meaning the previous style context is left dangling in the air. Shouldn't this be "NS_RELEASE(aContext); aContext = newSC;" ?
my_mothod: The Init() method of nsFirstLetterFrame.cpp involves re-resolving the style context of continuing frames. Once the new style context is known, newSC, the code proceeds as:  138       if (nsnull != newSC) { 139         if (newSC == aContext) { 140           NS_RELEASE(newSC); 141         } 142         else { 143           aContext = newSC; 144         } 145       }  Line 143 suggests that the previous pointer is overwritten, meaning the previous style context is left dangling in the air. Shouldn't this be "NS_RELEASE(aContext); aContext = newSC;" ? Leak of a style context? major Layout Core

description: Separated from a bug 26734.  The following is from RFC2546 page 5,     [Quoted-Printable] encoding SHOULD NOT be used with Format=Flowed    unless absolutely necessary (for example, non-US-ASCII (8-bit)    characters over a strictly 7-bit transport such as unextended SMTP).    In particular, a message SHOULD NOT be encoded in Quoted-Printable    for the sole purpose of protecting the trailing space on flowed lines    unless the body part is cryptographically signed or encrypted (see    Section 4.6).     The intent of Format=Flowed is to allow user agents to generate    flowed text which is non-obnoxious when viewed as pure, raw    Text/Plain (without any decoding); use of Quoted-Printable hinders    this and may cause Format=Flowed to be rejected by end users.  We are putting Format=Flowed with bodies containing quoted-printable. My proposal for beta1 is to check the strict_mime pref value in addition to  check charset names ("us-ascii" and "ISO-8859-1") to decide whether to generate  format=flowed. Not sure about the case which server converts to QP, need more  info.
my_mothod: Separated from a bug 26734.  The following is from RFC2546 page 5,     [Quoted-Printable] encoding SHOULD NOT be used with Format=Flowed    unless absolutely necessary (for example, non-US-ASCII (8-bit)    characters over a strictly 7-bit transport such as unextended SMTP).    In particular, a message SHOULD NOT be encoded in Quoted-Printable    for the sole purpose of protecting the trailing space on flowed lines    unless the body part is cryptographically signed or encrypted (see    Section 4.6).     The intent of Format=Flowed is to allow user agents to generate    flowed text which is non-obnoxious when viewed as pure, raw    Text/Plain (without any decoding); use of Quoted-Printable hinders    this and may cause Format=Flowed to be rejected by end users.  We are putting Format=Flowed with bodies containing quoted-printable. My proposal for beta1 is to check the strict_mime pref value in addition to  check charset names ("us-ascii" and "ISO-8859-1") to decide whether to generate  format=flowed. Not sure about the case which server converts to QP, need more  info. Format=Flowed is generated for message body with QP minor MIME MailNews Core

description: Build ID: 2000012601 Platform: Mac PowerBook G3/300, 128Mb RAM, VM off.  According to Apple's Human Interface Guidelines,  http://developer.apple.com/techpubs/mac/HIGuidelines/HIGuidelines-121.html#HEADING121-34  If you click-hold in the gray area of a scroll bar, the scroll box should scroll down to the bottom of the page, or the location of the pointer, whichever comes first. Currently, Moz scrolls the scroll box all the way to the bottom of the scroll bar, even if the pointer is only half-way down the scroll bar, which is incorrect.  - Adam
my_mothod: Build ID: 2000012601 Platform: Mac PowerBook G3/300, 128Mb RAM, VM off.  According to Apple's Human Interface Guidelines,  http://developer.apple.com/techpubs/mac/HIGuidelines/HIGuidelines-121.html#HEADING121-34  If you click-hold in the gray area of a scroll bar, the scroll box should scroll down to the bottom of the page, or the location of the pointer, whichever comes first. Currently, Moz scrolls the scroll box all the way to the bottom of the scroll bar, even if the pointer is only half-way down the scroll bar, which is incorrect.  - Adam Scrolling using gray area of scroll bar should move to mouse position trivial XUL Core

According to Apple's Human Interface Guidelines,  http://developer.apple.com/techpubs/mac/HIGuidelines/HIGuidelines-121.html#HEADING121-34  If you click-hold in the gray area of a scroll bar, the scroll box should scroll down to the bottom of the page, or the location of the pointer, whichever comes first. Currently, Moz scrolls the scroll box all the way to the bottom of the scroll bar, even if the pointer is only half-way down the scroll bar, which is incorrect.  - Adam

Actual Result: You see ScanTXT original: 7¸Õ;@¸Õ;@ ScanTXT result:   on the console, immediately followed by a crash.  Expected Result: ScanTXT original: 7% s ScanTXT result:   7% s  Additional Comments: - Appearently correct output in the msg pane (without crash), if DEBUG_BenB is not defined - It's not the nsString.ToNewCString, which crashes - I'm using UW-IMAP - 4.x seems to have no problem - I have no idea, what's going on :-)

description: Used today's commercial build on Liux 2000020808  1. Install and launch the browser 2. Select menu option File->New->Edit Blank Page 3. After a blank page opens,up...type something 4. Select menu option File->Close or the "x" button at top right cornor of     window 5. Observe that a "Save Document As" dialog appears instead of the usual dialog     which asked whether you would like to save this file or not. 6. Compulsarily, you have to save the file because "cancel" button just     closes the Dialog. 7. Pressing OK after entering a file name hangs the browser. 7. Once in a while, the browser closes without bringing up the "Save Doc As"  dialog.

description: Don't confuse this bug with all the other regressions we are having today =). This one started on Monday and plagues the Mac only. Kathy saw it Monday and I saw it that evening on my Mac build.  When you run mail, for your imap account, we are suddenly only showing a single folder in the acct. For me, every time I run it seems to be a different folder.  Your folders don't actually show up until you force folder discovery by clicking on the one folder you are given. if you then quit and restart, we still don't remember your folders. You'll just get one folder again.  I'm not sure how we are losing track of the folder discovery information every time we run. It looks like the .msf files are there, we just aren't properly converting them to folders.  cc'ing the usual suspects.  Again, this problem started monday not tuesday in case that helps narrow things down.
my_mothod: Don't confuse this bug with all the other regressions we are having today =). This one started on Monday and plagues the Mac only. Kathy saw it Monday and I saw it that evening on my Mac build.  When you run mail, for your imap account, we are suddenly only showing a single folder in the acct. For me, every time I run it seems to be a different folder.  Your folders don't actually show up until you force folder discovery by clicking on the one folder you are given. if you then quit and restart, we still don't remember your folders. You'll just get one folder again.  I'm not sure how we are losing track of the folder discovery information every time we run. It looks like the .msf files are there, we just aren't properly converting them to folders.  cc'ing the usual suspects.  Again, this problem started monday not tuesday in case that helps narrow things down. [PP] REGRESSION: Folders aren't showing up on the Mac blocker MailNews: Message Display SeaMonkey

description: The "Before reporting a bug" section contains:  "Use the Bug Helper to report bugs. This form helps you write well written bug reports."  Umm...  * it's actually the Bugzilla Helper.  * the list that this was added to is for things to do before writing a bug. (e.g.  if you're using the Bugzilla Helper, you can't be doing it before reporting a  bug, since you're by definition reporting the bug if you're using it. ;)
my_mothod: The "Before reporting a bug" section contains:  "Use the Bug Helper to report bugs. This form helps you write well written bug reports."  Umm...  * it's actually the Bugzilla Helper.  * the list that this was added to is for things to do before writing a bug. (e.g.  if you're using the Bugzilla Helper, you can't be doing it before reporting a  bug, since you're by definition reporting the bug if you're using it. ;) [nitpick] Naming/logic errors in bugzilla welcome page trivial Bugzilla-General Bugzilla

description: 1) Turn on paint flashing. 2) Load the attached example 3) Now move over the bordered box with the mouse. An animated image will appear. 4) Move the mouse away. You will notice the image will dissappear as it should but the system will continue to draw it indefinitely. This is a big problem for the new progress meter implementation. It uses an animated gif for the barber pole. But it never, ever stops painting it. This is a huge performace problem. ---Example----
my_mothod:
1) Turn on paint flashing. 2) Load the attached example 3) Now move over the bordered box with the mouse. An animated image will appear. 4) Move the mouse away. You will notice the image will dissappear as it should but the system will continue to draw it indefinitely. This is a big problem for the new progress meter implementation. It uses an animated gif for the barber pole. But it never, ever stops painting it. This is a huge performace problem. ---Example----
Animated background images never stop painting blocker CSS Parsing and Computation Core

description:
Since after coming back from weekend away, the new CVS pulls have refused to  compile. Early on in the build process (from directory mozilla/config)  build-scripts report: +++ makecopy: no such file: nsBuildID.h Then a bit later (don't know what directory): +++ makecopy: no such file: nsHTTPCID.h  Bit later in the build, on the first time from a fresh CVS pull, the build  breaks on following errors:  +++ make: install in d:\mozilla
etwerk\mime\src nsMIMEService.cpp d:\mozilla
etwerk\mime\src
sMIMEService.cpp(259) : error C2065: 'TEXT_RDF' :  undeclared identifier d:\mozilla

etwerk\mime\src
sMIMEService.cpp(288) : error C2065: 'IMAGE_ART' :  undeclared identifier d:\mozilla
etwerk\mime\src
sMIMEService.cpp(291) : error C2065: 'IMAGE_TIFF' :  undeclared identifier d:\mozilla
etwerk\mime\src
sMIMEService.cpp(303) : error C2065: 'TEXT_RTF' :  undeclared identifier d:\mozilla
etwerk\mime\src
sMIMEService.cpp(308) : error C2065: 'TEXT_CPP' :  undeclared identifier  Subsequent builds on the same tree break with:  +++ make: Creating EXE: .\WIN32_D.OBJ\viewer.exe    Creating library .\WIN32_D.OBJ\viewer.lib and object .\WIN32_D.OBJ\viewer.exp raptorwidget_s.lib(nsNativeDragTarget.obj) : error LNK2001: unresolved external  symbol _IID_IDropTarget raptorwidget_s.lib(nsNativeDragTarget.obj) : error LNK2001: unresolved external  symbol _IID_IUnknown .\WIN32_D.OBJ\viewer.exe : fatal error LNK1120: 2 unresolved externals  I suspected I was missing something obivious since nobody else seems to be  noticing the same problem, but people on #mozilla didn't seem to know what's the  problem, either.

description: If I include plevent.h in a .cpp file I get the following compilation errors:  d:\program files\microsoft visual studio\vc98\include\winnt.h(3143) : error  C2146: syntax error : missing ';' before identifier 'ContextRecord' d:\program files\microsoft visual studio\vc98\include\winnt.h(3143) : error  C2501: 'PCONTEXT' : missing storage-class or type specifiers d:\program files\microsoft visual studio\vc98\include\winnt.h(3143) : error  C2501: 'ContextRecord' : missing storage-class or type specifiers  This because plevent.h includes winbase.h. I must include windows.h before  plevent.h to get it to compile. Wouldn't it be better to include  windows.h instead of winbase.h in plevent.h?   I actually don't know which version of NSPR I use. It's the one that is included  with SeaMonkeyAll.

description: 1) load the url 2) click on the first text control 3) crash.  what's going on: in PresShell::ScrollFrameIntoView(), this line:   aFrame->GetOffsetFromView(mPresContext, offset, &closestView); is returning an outrageously large value in offset.x.  The method blindly  continues on, and eventually we blow our stack in gfx scroll frame code.  If I add this code just after the call above:   static int xxx_outrageousX = 100000;   static int xxx_outrageousY = 100000;   // if something stupid is going on, just return   if (offset.x > xxx_outrageousX || offset.y > xxx_outrageousY) return NS_OK;     Then the page lays out at a huge width.    There are many errors printed to the console about the block inside a TD  returning outrageous width requests.  But, the initial layout of the table looks  correct.
my_mothod: 1) load the url 2) click on the first text control 3) crash.  what's going on: in PresShell::ScrollFrameIntoView(), this line:   aFrame->GetOffsetFromView(mPresContext, offset, &closestView); is returning an outrageously large value in offset.x.  The method blindly  continues on, and eventually we blow our stack in gfx scroll frame code.  If I add this code just after the call above:   static int xxx_outrageousX = 100000;   static int xxx_outrageousY = 100000;   // if something stupid is going on, just return   if (offset.x > xxx_outrageousX || offset.y > xxx_outrageousY) return NS_OK;     Then the page lays out at a huge width.    There are many errors printed to the console about the block inside a TD  returning outrageous width requests.  But, the initial layout of the table looks  correct. crash clicking on text control at www.netaddress.com blocker Layout Core

description: Using 2000-02-09-08m14 commercial builds on linux rh6.0, NT 4.0 and Mac OS 9.0  When I checkmark "save this value" in a mail account's login dialog, it doesn't hook into the pref "Save password" in the Account Setup/Server panel for that same account.  This makes it confusing to figure out how to turn it on/off.  1.  Launch and go to a mail account (IMAP or POP).  Select Inbox and Get Msg. 2.  When password dialog (the mail server login dialog, not a Master Password oriented dialog) displays, type the account's mail password and click/checkmark the "save this value" checkbox.     Click OK to login --> proceeds to login and get mail. 3.  Edit|Account Setup.     Select the account's Server panel and notice the "save password" field is left unchecked/disabled.  Actual result:  Mail password dialog save password field doesn't tie in to the save password pref for that account in the account manager dialog.  Expected result:  Saving password value through mail password/login dialog should reflect in save password field for account manager dialog.
my_mothod: Using 2000-02-09-08m14 commercial builds on linux rh6.0, NT 4.0 and Mac OS 9.0  When I checkmark "save this value" in a mail account's login dialog, it doesn't hook into the pref "Save password" in the Account Setup/Server panel for that same account.  This makes it confusing to figure out how to turn it on/off.  1.  Launch and go to a mail account (IMAP or POP).  Select Inbox and Get Msg. 2.  When password dialog (the mail server login dialog, not a Master Password oriented dialog) displays, type the account's mail password and click/checkmark the "save this value" checkbox.     Click OK to login --> proceeds to login and get mail. 3.  Edit|Account Setup.     Select the account's Server panel and notice the "save password" field is left unchecked/disabled.  Actual result:  Mail password dialog save password field doesn't tie in to the save password pref for that account in the account manager dialog.  Expected result:  Saving password value through mail password/login dialog should reflect in save password field for account manager dialog. Save this value in passwd dialog doesn't tie to AcctMgr UI. normal MailNews: Account Configuration SeaMonkey

description: When you start Mozilla, the splash screen shows and a application is added to  the task bar. But the application is empty. Please see the attached image. Normally in Windows the application in the taskbar always contains a icon and  the application name. Just for your info: This is only true until either the "Select User Profile"  dialog comes up or until the browser starts.  Expected: When you start Mozilla, and application with icon and name appears in the  taskbar.
my_mothod: When you start Mozilla, the splash screen shows and a application is added to  the task bar. But the application is empty. Please see the attached image. Normally in Windows the application in the taskbar always contains a icon and  the application name. Just for your info: This is only true until either the "Select User Profile"  dialog comes up or until the browser starts.  Expected: When you start Mozilla, and application with icon and name appears in the  taskbar. Blank taskbar entry on Mozilla Splash screen minor UI Design SeaMonkey

description: If we use window.open continously to load new pages in the same child window one after another, then it keeps on opening new window for each window.open call. In our automation testing we open new window for loading every new testcase, and now this is opening new window for each new testcase. Which inturn makes application to crash. We have thousands of testcases. BUILDS: 2000-02-10-09. OS TESTED ON: Win-95, Linux. STEPS TO REPRODUCE: 1] Please visit above URL. 2] You'll see one parent window. This parent window will keep on opening one child window. 3] You'll see one counter on child window. And you'll see totally 5 new windows opened. OR 1] Please copy HTML codes I'm providing for parent window, as well as child window. Save those HTML files. Make chages in variabe 'url' in parent window code, according to new file locations. 2] Open parent file with above specified builds. 3] You'll see one parent window. This parent window will keep on opening one child window. 4] You'll see one counter on child window. And you'll see totally 5 new windows opened. EXPECTED RESULTS: Parent window should open child window 5 times, and keep on loading page in same child window. ACTUAL RESULTS: It opens 5 new windows for each window.open call. TESTCASE CODE FOR PARENT WINDOW START: Continous Window.Open() This is Parent Window which is going to open child window 5 times. TESTCASE CODE FOR PARENT WINDOW END: TESTCASE CODE FOR CHILD WINDOW START: Child window This is child window which is going to get opened by parent window 5 times. TESTCASE CODE FOR CHILD WINDOW END:
my_mothod: If we use window.open continously to load new pages in the same child window one after another, then it keeps on opening new window for each window.open call. In our automation testing we open new window for loading every new testcase, and now this is opening new window for each new testcase. Which inturn makes application to crash. We have thousands of testcases. BUILDS: 2000-02-10-09. OS TESTED ON: Win-95, Linux. STEPS TO REPRODUCE: 1] Please visit above URL. 2] You'll see one parent window. This parent window will keep on opening one child window. 3] You'll see one counter on child window. And you'll see totally 5 new windows opened. OR 1] Please copy HTML codes I'm providing for parent window, as well as child window. Save those HTML files. Make chages in variabe 'url' in parent window code, according to new file locations. 2] Open parent file with above specified builds. 3] You'll see one parent window. This parent window will keep on opening one child window. 4] You'll see one counter on child window. And you'll see totally 5 new windows opened. EXPECTED RESULTS: Parent window should open child window 5 times, and keep on loading page in same child window. ACTUAL RESULTS: It opens 5 new windows for each window.open call. TESTCASE CODE FOR PARENT WINDOW START: Continous Window.Open() This is Parent Window which is going to open child window 5 times. TESTCASE CODE FOR PARENT WINDOW END: TESTCASE CODE FOR CHILD WINDOW START: Child window This is child window which is going to get opened by parent window 5 times. TESTCASE CODE FOR CHILD WINDOW END: Opens new window for each window.open even though we want to use same child window opened previously. blocker DOM: Core & HTML Core

description: Right clicking on the scrollbar displays the last context menu.  Two simple examples:  Load mozilla, open a web page. Before using any context menus right click on the scrollbar. It (presumably) lists every context menu the browser knows about.  Then try right clicking on a link. Now right click on the scrollbar to find that the menu is the same as on the link (with options like "Open in New Window".  Should the scrollbar even *have* a context menu?
my_mothod: Right clicking on the scrollbar displays the last context menu.  Two simple examples:  Load mozilla, open a web page. Before using any context menus right click on the scrollbar. It (presumably) lists every context menu the browser knows about.  Then try right clicking on a link. Now right click on the scrollbar to find that the menu is the same as on the link (with options like "Open in New Window".  Should the scrollbar even *have* a context menu? Right clicking on any part of scrollbar shows context menu minor Themes SeaMonkey

description: 1. When we submit the change columns form after a normal query (i.e. "Run this query"), we see the following behavior in various browsers:       * Internet Explorer on Windows and Lynx on Linux: The back button        works OK, but automatic re-submit does not work. (Use back and        reload the page, or re-submit from the query page.)      * Netscape on Linux: Automatic re-submit works, but clicking the        back button does not work -- you are stuck on the Bug List page.        (Hold down the left mouse button over the back button to get a        list of URLs in your back stack.)      * Netscape on Windows: Everything works OK.  2. After I ran an existing named query, in Netscape, I submitted the "change columns" form.  Bugzilla-2.8 displayed the following message (rather than "Change columns ... Resubmitting ...".  Maybe this is fixed in newer versions of Bugzilla (as I could not reproduce the behavior using bugzilla.mozilla.org), even though I can find no bug report mentioning this.  With lynx, there is no such problem.    OK, you now have a new query named Internal all.   Go back to the query page.   I don't know what of the described behavior is a bug in Bugzilla, versus what is due to browser behavior.  Btw, I did read bug 17570, but I believe this is all different.

description: WinNT 4.0 sp6a, Build: 2000021014  I like my default font to be 10 pt. Tahoma, because it looks so much better than 12 pt. Times.  But with Mozilla 5, you can only choose a serif font for the serif font style.  I think that you should make serif fonts at the top of the list, but still include other fonts on the list for people who want to better customize their look and feel.
my_mothod: WinNT 4.0 sp6a, Build: 2000021014  I like my default font to be 10 pt. Tahoma, because it looks so much better than 12 pt. Times.  But with Mozilla 5, you can only choose a serif font for the serif font style.  I think that you should make serif fonts at the top of the list, but still include other fonts on the list for people who want to better customize their look and feel. Can only choose Serif for Serif style, etc. minor Preferences SeaMonkey

description: When a context menu is displayed, such as right clicking in the browser, the  resulting menu is directly under the mouse.  I would suggest the popup should be  one pixel to the right of the mouse so a right click, followed by a left click should clear the pop up without selecting anything.  At present the mouse appears directly over the top left corner.  This then requires  the user to move the mouse if they inadvertently click the right mouse button.  I know its a minor point but I think its these little details that will start to  matter once the works fully.
my_mothod: When a context menu is displayed, such as right clicking in the browser, the  resulting menu is directly under the mouse.  I would suggest the popup should be  one pixel to the right of the mouse so a right click, followed by a left click should clear the pop up without selecting anything.  At present the mouse appears directly over the top left corner.  This then requires  the user to move the mouse if they inadvertently click the right mouse button.  I know its a minor point but I think its these little details that will start to  matter once the works fully. Context menu should not appear under the mouse cursor trivial General SeaMonkey

description: Continuing issues with old bug 9333  From Bug 9333:  The issue is that the Windows dispatches an event with the VK_ALT in the KeyCode  and the ALT flag set to false. It seems to me that we should be clearing the Key  Code if it is VK_ALT and the ALT flag is false.  I fixed the XULMenuBarListener code to check both the KeyCode and the flag and  it now works.   Frank, what do you think about clearing the KeyCode when we set the ALT flag to  false?
my_mothod: Continuing issues with old bug 9333  From Bug 9333:  The issue is that the Windows dispatches an event with the VK_ALT in the KeyCode  and the ALT flag set to false. It seems to me that we should be clearing the Key  Code if it is VK_ALT and the ALT flag is false.  I fixed the XULMenuBarListener code to check both the KeyCode and the flag and  it now works.   Frank, what do you think about clearing the KeyCode when we set the ALT flag to  false? [HLP]Should AltGR have a KeyCode? major XUL Core

description: Change in SMTP server setting not holding when creating 2nd account  2000-02-10-15-m14 commercial Win32  1) Current account already set up.  Outgoing SMTP server set to nsmail-1, for  example.  2) Edit | Account Manager. 3) Create another account. When you get to the screen for the outgoing SMTP  server, change it to earthlink.mail.net, for example 4) Finish creating the account. 5) Go back into the Account Manager and look at the Outgoing SMTP server  setting.  Actual Results:  setting shows nsmail-1  Expected Results:  setting should show earthlink.mail.net which you just changed  to

description: Using the latest nightly build (Feb 12, 2000 for Linux-RH 6.1 with sawmill WM)  1) goto the above URL. 2) type in a name John (without the @hotmail.com part) 3) Click the Login Button - the page goes to another page that says something about a valid email requiring an @ and at least one . following it.  You are instructed to click back and correct the email-login name 4) click on "back"  actual results - nothing happens.  for some reason the page does not go back. Clicking on back a second time goes back two pages (i.e. i came from the bugzilla main page which is where it returns me to)  expected results - should go back one page the first time the button is clicked.

description: Platform: Win98 (probably happens everywhere)  Steps to reproduce: (1) Load some page to get an URL into the URL bar, e.g., http://www.mozilla.org. (2) Click once at the left hand side of the URL bar to get a blinking caret,  i.e., click just before the "h" in "http". (3) Rapidly double-click in the middle of the URL.  Expected Result: The entire URL should become selected. Actual Result: Only the text from the beginning of the URL to the click point is selected.
my_mothod: Platform: Win98 (probably happens everywhere)  Steps to reproduce: (1) Load some page to get an URL into the URL bar, e.g., http://www.mozilla.org. (2) Click once at the left hand side of the URL bar to get a blinking caret,  i.e., click just before the "h" in "http". (3) Rapidly double-click in the middle of the URL.  Expected Result: The entire URL should become selected. Actual Result: Only the text from the beginning of the URL to the click point is selected. Double-click behavior incorrect in Ender input fields major DOM: Selection Core

description: Edit | Account Settings opens up the account manager on the first account.  It should open with the account selected which was selected in the account pane.  To reproduce: 1. Select an account in account pane 2. Edit | Account Settings  Actual result: Account manager opens, first account is selected Expected result: Account manager opens, account chosen at (1) is selected
my_mothod: Edit | Account Settings opens up the account manager on the first account.  It should open with the account selected which was selected in the account pane.  To reproduce: 1. Select an account in account pane 2. Edit | Account Settings  Actual result: Account manager opens, first account is selected Expected result: Account manager opens, account chosen at (1) is selected UI: Account manager should open on selected account minor MailNews: Account Configuration SeaMonkey
