description: When attempting launch Mozilla.exe in M13 I get several errors. Eventually a  small title bar appears at the top left hand corner of my screen. It has all  three minimize, maxamize and close buttons but when I click maxamize it only  expands the title bar, there is no actual application window. I have searched  for bug reports similar to this. One involving win32 users suggests we remove  the mozprofile.dat file or rename it. I did this but I still encounter the same  problem with the title bar and the same errors appearing during mozilla's  launch.    Steps to recreate:  1) Unzip the win32 M13 file 2) Double click on Mozilla.exe 3) DOS Consol should appear 4) After several seconds the small title bar window should appear in the top  left hand corner of screen but no application window.  These are the error messages I see in the DOS Consol when Launching Mozilla:  ************************************************** nsNativeComponentLoader: SelfRegisterDll(C:\WINDOWS\DESKTOP\BIN\components\xpacc t32.dll) Load FAILED with error: error 0 ************************************************** *** Deferring registration of sample JS components *** Registering sidebar JS components *** Registering sample JS components nNCL: registering deferred (0) nNCL: registering deferred (0) WEBSHELL+ = 1 ************************************************** nsNativeComponentLoader: GetFactory(C:\WINDOWS\DESKTOP\BIN\components\gkhtml.dll ) Load FAILED with error: error 0 ************************************************** ************************************************** nsNativeComponentLoader: GetFactory(C:\WINDOWS\DESKTOP\BIN\components\gkhtml.dll ) Load FAILED with error: error 0 ************************************************** ************************************************** nsNativeComponentLoader: GetFactory(C:\WINDOWS\DESKTOP\BIN\components\gkhtml.dll ) Load FAILED with error: error 0 ************************************************** DocLoaderFactory: Unable to create ContentViewer for command=view, content-type= text/xul **************************************************   I have verified that all the files which are having errors *do* exist so this  isn't a problem of mozilla not having the files.  When I click the close button  on the small title bar I get the following Illegal Operation error:  ********************************************** MOZILLA caused an invalid page fault in module APPSHELL.DLL at 0157:60015d26. Registers: EAX=00000000 CS=0157 EIP=60015d26 EFLGS=00010246 EBX=00c12e20 SS=015f ESP=0063f4c8 EBP=0063f54c ECX=0063f544 DS=015f ESI=80000000 FS=12c7 EDX=0063f544 ES=015f EDI=00000000 GS=0000 Bytes at CS:EIP: 8b 08 ff 51 48 85 c6 75 6c 8d 4d 8c 89 7d e8 e8  Stack dump: 00000000 0063f544 00000000 00c14450 0f0e0d0c 13121110 17161514 1b1a1918  1f1e1d1c 23222120 27262524 2b2a2928 2f2e2d2c 33323130 37363534 3b3a3938  ***********************************************   Microsoft Windows 95 Version 4.00.950.00 B Pentium 200 MHz MMX 64 MB EDO Ram 4.1 GB Hard Drive

description: Build 2000-02-11-08M14: NT4 Build 2000-02-11-11M14: Linux 6.0 Build 2000-02-11-12M14: Mac 8.6.1  Overview: In the Account Setting's Mail Server panel, select the Advanced button  and various problems occur. Will these feature be in for Beta1?  Steps to reproduce 1. In Account Settings select a Mail account 2. Select the mail account's server panel 3. Select the "Advanced" button  Actual Results:  a. In step 3 notice that the "Advanced" button's right border is cut. b. After the "Advanced" button is selected  - NT4: the dialog is missing a title and all the text labels are gone. - Mac: The dialog is completely blank and there is no way to close it. Since  this blank window has focus I can't access any of the other windows. - Linux: the dialog appears comoplete except the title states "mozilla-bin".  Additional Information: - According to bug# 14094 and 14412 this feature was not going to be in PR1.
my_mothod: Build 2000-02-11-08M14: NT4 Build 2000-02-11-11M14: Linux 6.0 Build 2000-02-11-12M14: Mac 8.6.1  Overview: In the Account Setting's Mail Server panel, select the Advanced button  and various problems occur. Will these feature be in for Beta1?  Steps to reproduce 1. In Account Settings select a Mail account 2. Select the mail account's server panel 3. Select the "Advanced" button  Actual Results:  a. In step 3 notice that the "Advanced" button's right border is cut. b. After the "Advanced" button is selected  - NT4: the dialog is missing a title and all the text labels are gone. - Mac: The dialog is completely blank and there is no way to close it. Since  this blank window has focus I can't access any of the other windows. - Linux: the dialog appears comoplete except the title states "mozilla-bin".  Additional Information: - According to bug# 14094 and 14412 this feature was not going to be in PR1. "Advanced" button should only show in the IMAP panel major MailNews: Account Configuration SeaMonkey

description: Build 2000-02-11-08M14: NT4 Build 2000-02-11-11M14: Linux 6.0 Build 2000-02-11-12M14: Mac 8.6.1  Overview: In Account Settings select "Local Folders" and look at the title of  the panel at the top right. The title is in plain text. It should look nicer  like the Mail Identity panel.  Steps to reproduce: 1. In Account Settings select "Local Folders" or and look at the title to the  right. 2. Select a Mail Server's Identity panel and look at the title to the top right.  Actual Results:  a. Notice the title of the panel for "Local Folders" is "Account Settings" and  it's just typed text. b. Notice the title of the panel for a Mail Identity. It also states "Account  Settings" but it appears in White text laying on a teal background.  Expected Results:  - Shouldn't the "Local Folders" title area appear like the Mail Identity panel? - The same is true when the "Outgoing (SMTP) Server" panel is selected except  it's title is "SMTP Server".
my_mothod: Build 2000-02-11-08M14: NT4 Build 2000-02-11-11M14: Linux 6.0 Build 2000-02-11-12M14: Mac 8.6.1  Overview: In Account Settings select "Local Folders" and look at the title of  the panel at the top right. Select a Mail Server's Identity panel and look at the title to the top right.  Actual Results:  a. Notice the title of the panel for "Local Folders" is "Account Settings" and  it's just typed text. b. Notice the title of the panel for a Mail Identity. It also states "Account  Settings" but it appears in White text laying on a teal background.  Expected Results:  - Shouldn't the "Local Folders" title area appear like the Mail Identity panel? - The same is true when the "Outgoing (SMTP) Server" panel is selected except  it's title is "SMTP Server". "Local Folders","Outgoing SMTP Server" titles not pretty normal MailNews: Account Configuration SeaMonkey

description: Using 2000021008 on WinNT 4.0 SP4.   To repro: 1) File-->Open  2) using the dialog, select on disk the image I'll attach to this bug report 3) Seamonkey crashes  Now granted, .bmp is not a supported image file format for Gecko. (See bug  18502.) However, opening a .bmp file (or any file we don't support, for that  matter) should not crash Seamonkey.
my_mothod: Using 2000021008 on WinNT 4.0 SP4.   To repro: 1) File-->Open  2) using the dialog, select on disk the image I'll attach to this bug report 3) Seamonkey crashes  Now granted, .bmp is not a supported image file format for Gecko. (See bug  18502.) However, opening a .bmp file (or any file we don't support, for that  matter) should not crash Seamonkey. attempting to open .bmp image crashes Seamonkey critical Networking Core

description: A dialog created with UniversalDialog can have several elements -- namely a main  message, up to two edit fields, a checkbox, and up to four buttons.  If the dialog does not have any edit fields, the main message wraps if it is  bigger than the dialog box.  If there are edit fields, the main message stays on  one long line, causing the dialog to become extremely wide.
my_mothod: A dialog created with UniversalDialog can have several elements -- namely a main  message, up to two edit fields, a checkbox, and up to four buttons.  If the dialog does not have any edit fields, the main message wraps if it is  bigger than the dialog box.  If there are edit fields, the main message stays on  one long line, causing the dialog to become extremely wide. Main message in dialogs with edit fields don't wrap blocker UI Design SeaMonkey

description: On the Win32 2000021408 daily build  Actual Results: The span:hover is applied when mouse is not over fields probably because the  <span> padding didn't render right. When the span:hover is being used, clicking  on the mouse to select text is also off.  The <DD> or the <DL> tag seems to  make the problem worse.  Expected Results: span:hover should be applied when the mouse is over the span text. Also I think  it should either render the <span> padding, or ignore it on :hover (because  <span> is display:inline).
my_mothod: On the Win32 2000021408 daily build  Actual Results: The span:hover is applied when mouse is not over fields probably because the  <span> padding didn't render right. When the span:hover is being used, clicking  on the mouse to select text is also off.  The <DD> or the <DL> tag seems to  make the problem worse.  Expected Results: span:hover should be applied when the mouse is over the span text. Also I think  it should either render the <span> padding, or ignore it on :hover (because  <span> is display:inline). [EVENTTARG]:hover of inline text with padding has weird effect. minor Layout Core

description: The daily Quick-Vote vote-button on CNN's frontpage launches a new little window with results. Around two/three weeks ago this started to work OK in Mozilla browser, for the first time. Now (build 2000021409) it's broken again and has been so for 5 days. This likely is a redirection or javascript interpretation error - not sure what compontent to file this under. A reassignment is probably in place.
my_mothod: The daily Quick-Vote vote-button on CNN's frontpage launches a new little window with results. Around two/three weeks ago this started to work OK in Mozilla browser, for the first time. Now (build 2000021409) it's broken again and has been so for 5 days. This likely is a redirection or javascript interpretation error - not sure what compontent to file this under. A reassignment is probably in place. doesn't load CNN's quickvote result-window anymore minor DOM: Core & HTML Core

description: From Bug Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 [ja-JP.eucJP] (Linux; I) BuildID:    2000012520 Closing window (any window including Browser, Mail/News, dialogs etc.) takes too much time, say 3 to 4 seconds no matter if I close it by typing <Alt> W or "File/Close". I suppose (and also hope) that this behavior is of 'debug' thing. However such simple operation should be done in a shorter time.   Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Launch Mozilla by "./mozilla<\n>" 2. Open a new window by "File/New Window" or the short-cut <Alt> N. 3. Close the window by "File/Close" or by <Alt> W. 4. You will wait for 3 to 4 seconds until the window actually close.  NOTICE) I am using RedHat-6.1 based Linux run on Pentium II 400MHz box. So the problem is not caused by poor performance of my PC.
my_mothod: From Bug Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 [ja-JP.eucJP] (Linux; I) BuildID:    2000012520 Closing window (any window including Browser, Mail/News, dialogs etc.) takes too much time, say 3 to 4 seconds no matter if I close it by typing <Alt> W or "File/Close". I suppose (and also hope) that this behavior is of 'debug' thing. However such simple operation should be done in a shorter time.   Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Launch Mozilla by "./mozilla<\n>" 2. Open a new window by "File/New Window" or the short-cut <Alt> N. 3. Close the window by "File/Close" or by <Alt> W. 4. You will wait for 3 to 4 seconds until the window actually close.  NOTICE) I am using RedHat-6.1 based Linux run on Pentium II 400MHz box. So the problem is not caused by poor performance of my PC. Closing window is slow but not too slow to wait. trivial General SeaMonkey

description: Due of an JS error in addressingWidgetOverlay.js, the recipients are not anymore pre filled when you do a reply or  reply all. Also, due to the same error, the focus whenyou open a compose window (any type) is alway in the body.  The fix is:  Index: addressingWidgetOverlay.js =================================================================== RCS file: /cvsroot/mozilla/mailnews/compose/resources/content/addressingWidgetOverlay.js,v retrieving revision 1.11 diff -r1.11 addressingWidgetOverlay.js 91,94c91,94 < 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetTo()),  false, "addr_to"); < 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetCc()),  false, "addr_cc"); < 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetBcc()),  false, "addr_bcc"); < 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetReplyTo()),  false, "addr_reply"); --- > 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetTo(), false), "addr_to"); > 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetCc(), false), "addr_cc"); > 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetBcc(), false), "addr_bcc"); > 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetReplyTo(),  false), "addr_reply");
my_mothod: Due of an JS error in addressingWidgetOverlay.js, the recipients are not anymore pre filled when you do a reply or  reply all. Also, due to the same error, the focus whenyou open a compose window (any type) is alway in the body.  The fix is:  Index: addressingWidgetOverlay.js =================================================================== RCS file: /cvsroot/mozilla/mailnews/compose/resources/content/addressingWidgetOverlay.js,v retrieving revision 1.11 diff -r1.11 addressingWidgetOverlay.js 91,94c91,94 < 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetTo()),  false, "addr_to"); < 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetCc()),  false, "addr_cc"); < 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetBcc()),  false, "addr_bcc"); < 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetReplyTo()),  false, "addr_reply"); --- > 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetTo(), false), "addr_to"); > 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetCc(), false), "addr_cc"); > 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetBcc(), false), "addr_bcc"); > 		row = awSetInputAndPopupFromArray(row, msgCompFields.SplitRecipients(msgCompFields.GetReplyTo(),  false), "addr_reply"); Recipient are not set during a reply/reply all and focus goes in wrong place blocker Composition MailNews Core

description: Using win32 build 2000--2-15-10M14 there is a empty dialog box that pops up  after OK'ing the password dialog for mail.  If you close this dialog you will  eventually crash.  Will send in a talkback when I get one.    1. launch messenger 2. Select an Inbox and click Get Msg to bring up the password dialog. 3. Enter the correct password and click OK Note: you will see small blank dialog where the password dialog was. If you ignore it you can use mail for a little while, but if you close it you  will crash soon afterwards.

description: Using feb15 builds on all platforms  After you've entered an incorrect POP password, you get an error dialog, dismiss that and you get a second login dialog which contains text about server response.  The server response text seems to be garbage. Can we do something about this? It looks weird.  1.  Go to mail window. 2.  Select a POP inbox and Get Msg. 3.  Give an incorrect password.     OK the error dialog which appears next. 4.  A second login dialog appears.  Note the text:     "Could not log in to the mail server.  The server responded: + .  Please enter a new password for user: <username>".     I usually see a "+" for the server response text, but using today's mozilla build on linux I see "Fzc3dvcmQ6".     Looks pretty bogus to the user.
my_mothod: Using feb15 builds on all platforms  After you've entered an incorrect POP password, you get an error dialog, dismiss that and you get a second login dialog which contains text about server response. Please enter a new password for user: <username>".     I usually see a "+" for the server response text, but using today's mozilla build on linux I see "Fzc3dvcmQ6". description: From Bug Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/4.7 [en]C-CCK-MCD NSCPCD47  (Win98; I) BuildID:    2000012520 In the Messages window of Preferences - Mail and Newsgroups, clicking on the  text "As attachment" after "By default: forward messages" shifts all the normal  text in the window down when the drop-down menu appears. Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open the browser. 2. Select "Preferences" from the edit menu. 3. Select "Messages" under Mail and Newsgroups. 4. Click the drop-down menu (that says "As Attachment" or "Inline") after the  text "By default, forward messages: ". 5. Note the shift of text. Note also that this shift does *not* happen if you  bring the browser window to the front, then bring the preferences window to the  front again. Actual Results:  Text in the window that should not have moved shifted. Expected Results:  The text should not have shifted.

Note also that this shift does *not* happen if you  bring the browser window to the front, then bring the preferences window to the  front again. description: On the M13 build of Seamonkey, the mouse pointer does not correctly switch over to a simple pointer when moved over the 'customize' button of the 'My Panels' sidebar.  The mouse pointer remains a vertical resize pointer instead.  However, when the pointer is moved over the words 'My Panels', it makes the correct switch from a vertical resize pointer to a simple pointer.  Seems like these two should be switched, for clarity.
my_mothod: On the M13 build of Seamonkey, the mouse pointer does not correctly switch over to a simple pointer when moved over the 'customize' button of the 'My Panels' sidebar.  The mouse pointer remains a vertical resize pointer instead.  However, when the pointer is moved over the words 'My Panels', it makes the correct switch from a vertical resize pointer to a simple pointer.  Seems like these two should be switched, for clarity. description: When compiling M13 using VC6, error C2666 stops the compile midstream:  \mozilla\mailnews\base\src\nsMsgAccountManager.cpp(924) : error C2666: '[]' : 2  overloads have similar conversions  Line 924 in nsMsgAccountManager.cpp:   nsXPIDLCString accountList;   ...   if (NS_FAILED(rv) || !accountList || !accountList[0]) {   ...  I'm guessing that either !accountList or !accountList[0] is causing this  error.  Here's the code I suspect inside of  \mozilla\dist\include\nsXPIDLString.h:      operator const char*() const       {         return get();       }      char     operator*() const       {         return *get();       }      char     operator[]( long index ) const       {         return get()[index];       }  This was compiled on a PII-450 machine with 128MB RAM and 2GB of free space on  the partition being compiled in.  Visual C++ 6.0 was used, and all environment  variables were set properly (i.e. _MSC_VER=1200)

description: Overview Description: When I try to connect to an unreachable site, no popup dialog appears. Nothing happens (the previously loaded page remains unchanged) but the window status line reads a confusing "Document: done (n secs)"  To Reproduce: Try connecting to a machine with a blocking firewall. You can try for instance http://129.104.238.141/  Actual Results: Status line displays "Document: done (n secs)" but the previously loaded page has not changed. An error is issued on stderr though: "Error loading URL http://129.104.238.141/" (not everyone reads stderr all the time ;))  Expected Results: In netscape 4.7, a popup dialog appears that says: "A network error occured: unable to connect to server (TCP: no route to host) The server may be down or unreachable - Try connecting again later" A likewise warning would be cool.  Build date & Platform bug found: M13 FullCircle build for Linux
my_mothod: Overview Description: When I try to connect to an unreachable site, no popup dialog appears. Nothing happens (the previously loaded page remains unchanged) but the window status line reads a confusing "Document: done (n secs)"  To Reproduce: Try connecting to a machine with a blocking firewall. You can try for instance http://129.104.238.141/  Actual Results: Status line displays "Document: done (n secs)" but the previously loaded page has not changed. An error is issued on stderr though: "Error loading URL http://129.104.238.141/" (not everyone reads stderr all the time ;))  Expected Results: In netscape 4.7, a popup dialog appears that says: "A network error occured: unable to connect to server (TCP: no route to host) The server may be down or unreachable - Try connecting again later" A likewise warning would be cool.  Build date & Platform bug found: M13 FullCircle build for Linux When connection fails, a dialog should pop up minor Networking Core

description: From Bug Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/4.6C-NSCP (Macintosh; U; PPC) BuildID:    2000021608     search results in the sidebar should be single click as evidenced in the bug- o-rame and some causal in-house testing. I think this is the more usable bet for  beta1 and likely expected by the majority of the users, based on what we know  now. reasoning: there are no management tasks (ie. selection) required for items in  the list, ie users are not going to re-arrange the results. Therefore double  click is not needed and requiring it to launch a link is making it harder on  users Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.run a search  2.open the sidebar search panel 3.attempt to launch one of the search results Actual Results:  it require double click to launch a result Expected Results:  single click should launch the result link
my_mothod: From Bug Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/4.6C-NSCP (Macintosh; U; PPC) BuildID:    2000021608     search results in the sidebar should be single click as evidenced in the bug- o-rame and some causal in-house testing. I think this is the more usable bet for  beta1 and likely expected by the majority of the users, based on what we know  now. reasoning: there are no management tasks (ie. selection) required for items in  the list, ie users are not going to re-arrange the results. Therefore double  click is not needed and requiring it to launch a link is making it harder on  users Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.run a search  2.open the sidebar search panel 3.attempt to launch one of the search results Actual Results:  it require double click to launch a result Expected Results:  single click should launch the result link [Search UI] Sidebar search panel results should be single click normal Search SeaMonkey

description: In the nsWebShell.cpp, the following function damanage the non ASCII unicode  data. The nsString use PRUnichar as internal buffer, but this function call the  "will-damage-data" nsString::ToCString and operate at char type. Instead, this  function should be rewrite and operate in the PRUnichar type.   In nsWebShell.cpp 1375 kipp     1.82  static void convertFileToURL(const nsString &aIn, nsString  &aOut) 1376 kipp     1.1   { 1377 scullin  1.33    char szFile[1000]; 1378                  aIn.ToCString(szFile, sizeof(szFile)); 1379 valeski  1.380 #ifdef XP_PC 1380                  // Check for \ in the url-string (PC) 1381 scullin  1.33    if (PL_strchr(szFile, '\\')) { 1382 valeski  1.380 #else 1383                #if XP_UNIX 1384                  // Check if it starts with / or \ (UNIX) 1385                  if (*(szFile) == '/' || *(szFile) == '\\') { 1386                #else 1387                  if (0) {   1388                  // Do nothing (All others for now)  1389                #endif 1390                #endif 1391 scullin  1.33      PRInt32 len = strlen(szFile); 1392                    PRInt32 sum = len + sizeof(FILE_PROTOCOL); 1393 michaelp 1.106     char* lpszFileURL = (char *)PR_Malloc(sum + 1); 1394 brendan  1.234  1395 valeski  1.380 #ifdef XP_PC 1396 scullin  1.33      // Translate '\' to '/' 1397                    for (PRInt32 i = 0; i < len; i++) { 1398                      if (szFile[i] == '\\') { 1399                        szFile[i] = '/'; 1400                      } 1401                      if (szFile[i] == ':') { 1402                        szFile[i] = '|'; 1403                      } 1404                    } 1405 valeski  1.380 #endif 1406 brendan  1.234  1407 scullin  1.33      // Build the file URL 1408                    PR_snprintf(lpszFileURL, sum, "%s%s", FILE_PROTOCOL,  szFile); 1409                    aOut = lpszFileURL; 1410 michaelp 1.106     PR_Free((void *)lpszFileURL); 1411 scullin  1.33    } 1412                  else 1413                  { 1414                    aOut = aIn; 1415                  } 1416 kipp     1.1   }
my_mothod: In the nsWebShell.cpp, the following function damanage the non ASCII unicode  data. The nsString use PRUnichar as internal buffer, but this function call the  "will-damage-data" nsString::ToCString and operate at char type. Instead, this  function should be rewrite and operate in the PRUnichar type.   In nsWebShell.cpp 1375 kipp     1.82  static void convertFileToURL(const nsString &aIn, nsString  &aOut) 1376 kipp     1.1   { 1377 scullin  1.33    char szFile[1000]; 1378                  aIn.ToCString(szFile, sizeof(szFile)); 1379 valeski  1.380 #ifdef XP_PC 1380                  // Check for \ in the url-string (PC) 1381 scullin  1.33    if (PL_strchr(szFile, '\\')) { 1382 valeski  1.380 #else 1383                #if XP_UNIX 1384                  // Check if it starts with / or \ (UNIX) 1385                  if (*(szFile) == '/' || *(szFile) == '\\') { 1386                #else 1387                  if (0) {   1388                  // Do nothing (All others for now)  1389                #endif 1390                #endif 1391 scullin  1.33      PRInt32 len = strlen(szFile); 1392                    PRInt32 sum = len + sizeof(FILE_PROTOCOL); 1393 michaelp 1.106     char* lpszFileURL = (char *)PR_Malloc(sum + 1); 1394 brendan  1.234  1395 valeski  1.380 #ifdef XP_PC 1396 scullin  1.33      // Translate '\' to '/' 1397                    for (PRInt32 i = 0; i < len; i++) { 1398                      if (szFile[i] == '\\') { 1399                        szFile[i] = '/'; 1400                      } 1401                      if (szFile[i] == ':') { 1402                        szFile[i] = '|'; 1403                      } 1404                    } 1405 valeski  1.380 #endif 1406 brendan  1.234  1407 scullin  1.33      // Build the file URL 1408                    PR_snprintf(lpszFileURL, sum, "%s%s", FILE_PROTOCOL,  szFile); 1409                    aOut = lpszFileURL; 1410 michaelp 1.106     PR_Free((void *)lpszFileURL); 1411 scullin  1.33    } 1412                  else 1413                  { 1414                    aOut = aIn; 1415                  } 1416 kipp     1.1   } convertFileToURL implementation damage non ASCII data. blocker XPCOM Core

description: I found this problem on a WinNT4SP3 running M13 with fullcircle and ICQ99b.  I have reproduced this on a few machines, all with the same setup.  1) Start mozilla.exe 2) Start ICQ99b 3) Set preferences in ICQ to popup on incoming message. 4) Maximize mozilla browser window (window 1) 5) Open new mozilla browser window (window 2) this one will start with screen  size but not maximized. 6) Have mozilla browser window (window 2) up front. 7) When you recieve an incoming message icq will popup but clicking on the  message will not get ICQ into focus. Only by clicking on the ICQ's window title-bar will make it active.  Anywhere else will put focus  on mozilla browser window (window 2).  This problem will go away if you maximize mozilla browser window (window 2).
my_mothod: I found this problem on a WinNT4SP3 running M13 with fullcircle and ICQ99b.  I have reproduced this on a few machines, all with the same setup.  1) Start mozilla.exe 2) Start ICQ99b 3) Set preferences in ICQ to popup on incoming message. 4) Maximize mozilla browser window (window 1) 5) Open new mozilla browser window (window 2) this one will start with screen  size but not maximized. 6) Have mozilla browser window (window 2) up front. 7) When you recieve an incoming message icq will popup but clicking on the  message will not get ICQ into focus. Only by clicking on the ICQ's window title-bar will make it active.  Anywhere else will put focus  on mozilla browser window (window 2).  This problem will go away if you maximize mozilla browser window (window 2). Window focus interaction w/ICQ minor General SeaMonkey

description: The nsIRegistry API has had wstring methods added to fix PDT+ bug 23859, but  the old methods were not not removed because there were too many clients of the  interface to change this close to shipping a beta.  This bug tracks final clean-up of the API, marking the UTF8 string versions  [noscript], altering registry clients other than the Profile Manager, etc.
my_mothod: The nsIRegistry API has had wstring methods added to fix PDT+ bug 23859, but  the old methods were not not removed because there were too many clients of the  interface to change this close to shipping a beta. description: This is more of a design issue than anything else, but I miss the progress  dialogue that came up in 4.x when you send a message.   With the current mail client, I don't feel very confident that my mail has been  sent successfully. The only feedback I get is the throbber starting and stopping  in the mail window, and you only see that if you that is the window directly  underneath the mail compose window, which is not always the case if you are  switching windows a lot.  I'd also be curious if testing has been done sending very large attachments, and  shutting down all visible windows before the mail is actually fully sent. It  seems it would be weird to have something still going on in the background.  I imagine this should be assigned to a marketing or usability person.

It  seems it would be weird to have something still going on in the background.  I imagine this should be assigned to a marketing or usability person. No progress window when sending mail normal Composition MailNews Core

description: (This was seen on buld number 2000021715 - downloaded 18-Feb-2000)  Open a few large windows (from anything) to clutter up the desktop.  Now launch  Mozilla.  The splash window appears above all the other windows, as it should.  When the splash window is removed, the main browser window appears below the  other desktop windows.  Note that merely raising the window when it is opened may not be the right  thing.  With most Windows apps, the main window will open above other windows if  there is no user interaction after giving the launch command, but will open  under others if the user starts using another application during that time.  I think Windows does this automatically for the first window opened -  unfortunately, that's the splash window in our case, so it may require a little  more code.  Perhaps we can check if the splash window is still above all  non-topmost windows and raise the browser window only if it is.
my_mothod: (This was seen on buld number 2000021715 - downloaded 18-Feb-2000)  Open a few large windows (from anything) to clutter up the desktop.  Now launch  Mozilla.  The splash window appears above all the other windows, as it should.  When the splash window is removed, the main browser window appears below the  other desktop windows.  Note that merely raising the window when it is opened may not be the right  thing.  With most Windows apps, the main window will open above other windows if  there is no user interaction after giving the launch command, but will open  under others if the user starts using another application during that time.  I think Windows does this automatically for the first window opened -  unfortunately, that's the splash window in our case, so it may require a little  more code.  Perhaps we can check if the splash window is still above all  non-topmost windows and raise the browser window only if it is. Main window appears behind other windows trivial UI Design SeaMonkey

ADDITIONAL INFO: Scrolling by clicking the scrollbar is working. Scrolling up using the keyboard "Up Arrow" is working.

description: If you change the font in preferences such that the URL-bar's font changes,  it'll (incorrectly) use the old width of the URL when handling mouse events.  To reproduce:  1. Type in a URL that only goes about half-way across the URL bar. 2. Change the font to something wider (changed from Courier to Lucida Console). 3. Try and select th end part of the URL by dragging on it with the mouse. Only  the portion overlapped by the old URL width can be highlighted.  Another related problem is that initially the text in the URL bar is very small,  but upon changing the font it grows bigger. Even changing it back to what it was  supposedly set to, it still doesn't shrink. The point size seems to be ignored  for the URL bar.
my_mothod: If you change the font in preferences such that the URL-bar's font changes,  it'll (incorrectly) use the old width of the URL when handling mouse events.  To reproduce:  1. Type in a URL that only goes about half-way across the URL bar. 2. Change the font to something wider (changed from Courier to Lucida Console). 3. Try and select th end part of the URL by dragging on it with the mouse. Only  the portion overlapped by the old URL width can be highlighted.  Another related problem is that initially the text in the URL bar is very small,  but upon changing the font it grows bigger. Even changing it back to what it was  supposedly set to, it still doesn't shrink. The point size seems to be ignored  for the URL bar. Changing font in prefs makes selection in URL bar act weird minor DOM: Selection Core

description: Box layout is not providing the combobox with a consistent sizes for  aReflowState.mComputedWidth (or availableWidth). When the mail compose window  displays the last mComputedWidth size as the the "From" Combobox gets layed  out it is "4269", then on a mouse down the mComputedWidth is "5022".  The 5022 is an incremental reflow targeted at the ListControlFrame that is a  child (popup list child so it doesn't get reflowed automatically) of the  ComboboxControlFrame. In normal HTML layout the incoming mComputedWidth and  availableWidth are both UNCONSTRAINED.  Here is my debug output: nsCCF - nsComboboxControlFrame nsLCF - nsListControlFrame ---------------------------------------------------- OnEndDocumentLoad 03C5F98C ** nsCCF::Reflow 15 R: Resize AW: 4329 AH: UNC CW: 4269 CH: 270 NO: 2 *  **Constrained WW: 4029  HH: 240 DW: 345 03C5FA54 ** nsLCF::Reflow 19 R: Resize AW: 345 AH: UNC CW: 345 CH: UNC ** Done nsLCF DW: 345  DH: 540 [[[[ CW: 4269 30 30 ** Done nsCCF DW: 4329  DH: 330 Lost focus. nsWebShellWindow::GOTFOCUS set focus on the recipient WEBSHELL+ = 7 Lost focus. Lost focus. nsWebShellWindow::GOTFOCUS --------------------------- MouseDown ---------------------------- 03C5F98C ** nsCCF::Reflow 16 R: Increm AW: 5082 AH: UNC CW: 5022 CH: 270 NO: 2 *  -----------------Target is Dropdown or it's child------------ 03C5FA54 ** nsLCF::Reflow 20 R: StyleC AW: UNC AH: UNC CW: UNC CH: UNC ** Done nsLCF DW: 3675  DH: 540 |** Done nsCCF DW: 4329  DH: 330 --------------------------- MouseUp ---------------------------- 03C5F98C ** nsCCF::Reflow 17 R: Increm AW: 5082 AH: UNC CW: 5022 CH: 270 NO: 2 *  -----------------Target is Dropdown or it's child------------ 03C5FA54 ** nsLCF::Reflow 21 R: StyleC AW: UNC AH: UNC CW: UNC CH: UNC ** Done nsLCF DW: 3675  DH: 540 |** Done nsCCF DW: 4329  DH: 330 --------------------------- MouseUp ---------------------------- Lost focus.

description: More specifically, if I click on "File" and move the mouse down with X-Mouse enabled, the menu disappears.  To reproduce: 1) Install PowerToys   a) Go to http://www.microsoft.com/Windows95/downloads/contents/WUToys/W95PwrToysSet/Default.asp   b) Click the "Download Now" link and save the file.   c) Go where you saved the file and run W95powertoy.exe   d) Right-click "Install.inf" and click "Install"   e) Close the various dialogs that appear during installation. 2) Open the Control Panel 3) Open the "Tweak UI" Applet. 4) Select the "Mouse" tab and click "Activation follows mouse (X-Mouse) 5) Click OK. 6) Run Mozilla (this has worked for almost every version I've tried;    it's known to work with M13 and the 2000021808 nightly build). 7) Click (click and release) the "File" menu. 8) Move the mouse pointer downward.    The menu will dissappear.  Menus disappearing happens for all pop-up menus: the menu bar at the top and the bookmarks button on the button bar.  Workarounds:  1) Disable X-Mouse.  2) Don't click-and-release the mouse button; instead, click and     hold the mouse when you move the mouse pointer downward.  The     menu will stay up and track the mouse movement correctly.  This is more of an annoyance than a real problem, but it's still annoying.
my_mothod: More specifically, if I click on "File" and move the mouse down with X-Mouse enabled, the menu disappears.  To reproduce: 1) Install PowerToys   a) Go to http://www.microsoft.com/Windows95/downloads/contents/WUToys/W95PwrToysSet/Default.asp   b) Click the "Download Now" link and save the file.   c) Go where you saved the file and run W95powertoy.exe   d) Right-click "Install.inf" and click "Install"   e) Close the various dialogs that appear during installation. 2) Open the Control Panel 3) Open the "Tweak UI" Applet. 4) Select the "Mouse" tab and click "Activation follows mouse (X-Mouse) 5) Click OK. 6) Run Mozilla (this has worked for almost every version I've tried;    it's known to work with M13 and the 2000021808 nightly build). 7) Click (click and release) the "File" menu. 8) Move the mouse pointer downward.    The menu will dissappear.  Menus disappearing happens for all pop-up menus: the menu bar at the top and the bookmarks button on the button bar.  Workarounds:  1) Disable X-Mouse.  2) Don't click-and-release the mouse button; instead, click and     hold the mouse when you move the mouse pointer downward.  The     menu will stay up and track the mouse movement correctly.  This is more of an annoyance than a real problem, but it's still annoying. Menu handling screwy with X-Mouse minor DOM: UI Events & Focus Handling Core

description: From Bug Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 [en-US] (Linux; I) BuildID:    1999122808 When you put your mouse over the first link in the 'library' section of www.securityfocus.com, it changes color normally; when you put your mouse over the title of the second article, the 'library' section turns empty.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open the page 2. Go to the section titled 'library' 3. Make the mouse go over the title of the second article  Actual Results:  The whole 'library' section became empty. Expected Results:  Color the link (like it does in the first article's title) I've seen this bug for some time (and some milestones).  The Build ID is bogus -- it's in fact Debian's M13-4
my_mothod: From Bug Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 [en-US] (Linux; I) BuildID:    1999122808 When you put your mouse over the first link in the 'library' section of www.securityfocus.com, it changes color normally; when you put your mouse over the title of the second article, the 'library' section turns empty.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open the page 2. Go to the section titled 'library' 3. Make the mouse go over the title of the second article  Actual Results:  The whole 'library' section became empty. Expected Results:  Color the link (like it does in the first article's title) I've seen this bug for some time (and some milestones).  The Build ID is bogus -- it's in fact Debian's M13-4 Table disappears when mouse over link (Unnecessary reframing for "special" frames) critical Layout Core

description: Build: 2000021608, MacOS 8.6  To reproduce: * Start the Mozilla installer, and progress to the installation location page. * Observe the button used for selecting the installation location.  What you should see: * `Select Location ...'  What you actually see: * `Select Folder ...'  It should be `Location', rather than `Folder', because a user may wish to install  Mozilla in the base directory of a given disk, and the base directory is not a  folder.
my_mothod: Build: 2000021608, MacOS 8.6  To reproduce: * Start the Mozilla installer, and progress to the installation location page. * Observe the button used for selecting the installation location.  What you should see: * `Select Location ...'  What you actually see: * `Select Folder ...'  It should be `Location', rather than `Folder', because a user may wish to install  Mozilla in the base directory of a given disk, and the base directory is not a  folder. [Mac] `Select Folder ...' should be `Select Location ...' trivial Installer SeaMonkey

description: I usually use the page/down keys to move up/down when viewing a long web page. Sometimes, M13 seems to get stuck so it doesn't scroll when I bring up a page. When I bring up Netscape, I can usually click somewhere on the web page or click on the scroll bar and then the page up/down keys work.  In M13, I get these errors in the debug console even if I click on the scroll bar or web page: "JavaScript Error: TypeError: controller has no properties"
my_mothod: I usually use the page/down keys to move up/down when viewing a long web page. Sometimes, M13 seems to get stuck so it doesn't scroll when I bring up a page. When I bring up Netscape, I can usually click somewhere on the web page or click on the scroll bar and then the page up/down keys work.  In M13, I get these errors in the debug console even if I click on the scroll bar or web page: "JavaScript Error: TypeError: controller has no properties" page up/down key sometimes doesn't work to scroll around on page minor Web Painting Core

description: When running viewer with about:blank, an nsDirectoryService is leaked because it is addref'd in NS_InitXPCOM (where there is a comment that it should stay around for the life of the product).  Does it really need to stay around the life of the application, or can it be released in NS_ShutdownXPCOM so that at least it doesn't show up in the leak stats?  See the refcount balancer log at (when my machine is on): http://dbaron.student.harvard.edu/u/david/leaks/viewer/nsDirectoryService.balance-ib.txt
my_mothod: When running viewer with about:blank, an nsDirectoryService is leaked because it is addref'd in NS_InitXPCOM (where there is a comment that it should stay around for the life of the product).  Does it really need to stay around the life of the application, or can it be released in NS_ShutdownXPCOM so that at least it doesn't show up in the leak stats?  See the refcount balancer log at (when my machine is on): http://dbaron.student.harvard.edu/u/david/leaks/viewer/nsDirectoryService.balance-ib.txt leaking nsDirectoryService in NS_InitXPCOM minor XPCOM Core

description: From either a brower or composer window: Use the menu command File | Open Web Location to bring up a dialog to load remote pages. Enter a valid http: URL (e.g.:  http://blues/users/bijals/publish/composer/composerbor2.htm) and you get an error message. Note that if window with file already exists, it does switch to that window. Or if the URL is first loaded in a browser window, and File | Edit Page is  used, it loads correctly. We are using the exact same code as the browser to call the Open Web Location dialog, by the way. Simon: Feel free to investigate this if you have time! Does anyone feel this is a beta1 issue? I bet the fix is simple.
my_mothod: From either a brower or composer window: Use the menu command File | Open Web Location to bring up a dialog to load remote pages. Enter a valid http: URL (e.g.:  http://blues/users/bijals/publish/composer/composerbor2.htm) and you get an error message. Note that if window with file already exists, it does switch to that window. Or if the URL is first loaded in a browser window, and File | Edit Page is  used, it loads correctly. We are using the exact same code as the browser to call the Open Web Location dialog, by the way. Simon: Feel free to investigate this if you have time! Does anyone feel this is a beta1 issue? I bet the fix is simple. Opening a remote location via Open Location doesn't work if loading into Composer blocker DOM: Editor Core

description: Using the latest cvs available source, I am unable to perform a "make distclean" on the source repository to clean out the created files and return to a pristine tree. The option is in the Makefile, however it errors after deleting some of the files.   I have appended the output from "make distclean" on my system. I have also appended the result of "find ./ -name *.o" in my tree. If "make distclean" worked properly, this find should not return any items. description: When I entered the last bug report, I noticed the line wrap was wrong  Now it is working for me.  Damn.  What it would do is this, if I hit enter, the cursor would show up 2 lines down and not on the next line.  If I then started typing, it was on the next line.  Good luck on squashing this one.  Oh! there!  it just did it!  I changed the focus from this entry window to change severity from normal to minor and now the 2 line advance happened.  Perhaps that is what you need to do.  I'll submit a followup to see.
my_mothod: When I entered the last bug report, I noticed the line wrap was wrong  Now it is working for me.  Damn.  What it would do is this, if I hit enter, the cursor would show up 2 lines down and not on the next line.  If I then started typing, it was on the next line.  Good luck on squashing this one.  Oh! there!  it just did it!  I changed the focus from this entry window to change severity from normal to minor and now the 2 line advance happened.  Perhaps that is what you need to do.  I'll submit a followup to see. This bug form - hard to reproduce minor DOM: Core & HTML Core

description: I ran this on a K6 450 Mhz machine with 96 MB of RAM running Win 98.  I  installed both M13 and build #2000022117.  I ran each upon install, and then did a fresh restart of my machine before starting  each.  Here are the startup times I observed:        M13 -- 13.6 sec       N6 -- 16.7 sec   N6 is now 23% slower ((M13 - N6)/M13) than M13 on a very fast machine.  It would  be interesting to do this test again on our target machine.  I will try to get  this done today.
my_mothod: I ran this on a K6 450 Mhz machine with 96 MB of RAM running Win 98.  I  installed both M13 and build #2000022117.  I ran each upon install, and then did a fresh restart of my machine before starting  each.  Here are the startup times I observed:        M13 -- 13.6 sec       N6 -- 16.7 sec   N6 is now 23% slower ((M13 - N6)/M13) than M13 on a very fast machine.  It would  be interesting to do this test again on our target machine.  I will try to get  this done today. Seamonkey startup time has slowed considerably since M13 major General SeaMonkey

description: I'm using M13 on a RH6.1 Linux system with a 2.2.14 kernel. It installs normally.  I configure the proxy settings with manual, FTP and HTTP proxies at 8080, and then click OK to save/exit the preferences. The browser still cannot view external web sites. I go back in, and the proxy settings are gone. However, clicking the mouse in the text windows makes my proxy settings reappear.  A save again, and the problem repeats.  Now, once I exit Mozilla and go back in, the world is full of splendor and I can get external sites. It just doesn't update the settings on the fly.  Any questions, or if you want me to try something, give me an email. Thanks, it seems good otherwise.  Note: if I left the proxy host unqualified I had problems (non-Mozilla issue with that part), and couldn't save the preferences by hitting OK. All it did then was issue the error (in xterm):  got a request *** PREF_onpageload('pref-proxies'); *** prefindex = 0; prefvalue = 0 *** prefvalue = true *** prefindex = 1; prefvalue = 0 *** prefvalue = false *** prefindex = 2; prefvalue = 0 *** prefvalue = false *** id & value: networkProxyType0 : true *** id & value: networkProxyType1 : false *** id & value: networkProxyFTP :  *** id & value: networkProxyFTP_Port : 0 *** id & value: networkProxyHTTP :  *** id & value: networkProxyHTTP_Port : 0 *** id & value: networkProxyType2 : false *** id & value: networkProxyAutoconfigURL :  WEBSHELL+ = 7 WEBSHELL+ = 8 WEBSHELL+ = 9 WEBSHELL+ = 10 WEBSHELL+ = 11 *** going to set a boolean pref: false *** just set a boolean pref: false JavaScript Error: uncaught exception: [Exception... "Component returned failure  code: 0x8000ffff (NS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED) [nsIPref.SetBoolPref]"   nsresult: "0x8000ffff (NS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED)"  location: "JS frame ::  chrome://pref/content/pref.js :: PREF_ParsePref :: line 135"  data: no]  Just an aside with that part, it's not part of the main bug above.
my_mothod: I'm using M13 on a RH6.1 Linux system with a 2.2.14 kernel. It installs normally.  I configure the proxy settings with manual, FTP and HTTP proxies at 8080, and then click OK to save/exit the preferences. The browser still cannot view external web sites. I go back in, and the proxy settings are gone. However, clicking the mouse in the text windows makes my proxy settings reappear.  A save again, and the problem repeats.  Now, once I exit Mozilla and go back in, the world is full of splendor and I can get external sites. It just doesn't update the settings on the fly.  Any questions, or if you want me to try something, give me an email. Thanks, it seems good otherwise.  Note: if I left the proxy host unqualified I had problems (non-Mozilla issue with that part), and couldn't save the preferences by hitting OK. All it did then was issue the error (in xterm):  got a request *** PREF_onpageload('pref-proxies'); *** prefindex = 0; prefvalue = 0 *** prefvalue = true *** prefindex = 1; prefvalue = 0 *** prefvalue = false *** prefindex = 2; prefvalue = 0 *** prefvalue = false *** id & value: networkProxyType0 : true *** id & value: networkProxyType1 : false *** id & value: networkProxyFTP :  *** id & value: networkProxyFTP_Port : 0 *** id & value: networkProxyHTTP :  *** id & value: networkProxyHTTP_Port : 0 *** id & value: networkProxyType2 : false *** id & value: networkProxyAutoconfigURL :  WEBSHELL+ = 7 WEBSHELL+ = 8 WEBSHELL+ = 9 WEBSHELL+ = 10 WEBSHELL+ = 11 *** going to set a boolean pref: false *** just set a boolean pref: false JavaScript Error: uncaught exception: [Exception... "Component returned failure  code: 0x8000ffff (NS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED) [nsIPref.SetBoolPref]"   nsresult: "0x8000ffff (NS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED)"  location: "JS frame ::  chrome://pref/content/pref.js :: PREF_ParsePref :: line 135"  data: no]  Just an aside with that part, it's not part of the main bug above. description: m13 wouldn't start w/o a crash.  totally unstable, so i downloaded a nightly build of m14 around feb 23, maybe feb 22.  installation is flawless and much more usable than m13 release.  however, when the browser and messenger window open they open up BEHIND existing windows. they are not minimized, they just don't grab the focus.  so, you need to find them on the taskbar and click to get them to the front.  this has never happened in any previous release.  i've been with this since m9 or m10.  now, that said, win nt has problems with focus and this is not the first alpha or beta code i've had that did this.  no production code ever has, however.
my_mothod: m13 wouldn't start w/o a crash.  totally unstable, so i downloaded a nightly build of m14 around feb 23, maybe feb 22.  installation is flawless and much more usable than m13 release.  however, when the browser and messenger window open they open up BEHIND existing windows. they are not minimized, they just don't grab the focus.  so, you need to find them on the taskbar and click to get them to the front.  this has never happened in any previous release.  i've been with this since m9 or m10.  now, that said, win nt has problems with focus and this is not the first alpha or beta code i've had that did this.  no production code ever has, however. Mozilla launches behind console window minor UI Design SeaMonkey

description: Reproduce: Send a HTML mail with a link (a-tag).  Actual result: URLs from href attribute surrounded by quotes *and* angle brackets.  Expected result: URLs from href attribute surrounded only by angle brackets.  Proposed fix: Make sure, the quotes aroung the href in the original HTML are not included.
my_mothod: Reproduce: Send a HTML mail with a link (a-tag).  Actual result: URLs from href attribute surrounded by quotes *and* angle brackets.  Expected result: URLs from href attribute surrounded only by angle brackets.  Proposed fix: Make sure, the quotes aroung the href in the original HTML are not included. [nsHTMLToTXTSinkStream] URLs surrounded by quotes *and* angle brackets minor DOM: Serializers Core

description: The more I see these icons (attachments and add-to-address-book) the less I like them. I think they're not sufficiently visually distinct. The UI design of widgets in the envelope area just isn't holding together, IMO.

description: First, I realize that there is another bug that is very similar to this (  http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2051 ), but this is more specific  and I couldn't get rid of the "Worksforme" status...   When text is inside <label> tags within a table cell, the text breaks out of  the table cell as if the table cell didn't exist.  I have been and am still seeing this in current builds (most recently in Feb  24, 2000 build).  Take a look at my examples here:  This one really shows off the fact that the problem is with the <label> tag: http://206.9.170.23/exp/mozTableTest3.html  (Note: I ripped out the check boxes that the label id points to, but that is  what the <label> tags were used for.  They can be seen in the examples below)   These examples show a simulation closer to what we actually use on a production  site: http://206.9.170.23/exp/mozTableTest.html http://206.9.170.23/exp/mozTableTest2.html  The last two examples were done to replicate the table structure in this site: http://www.agweb.com  If there is a current survey question available there, you will see this  behavior.  Please fix this.  It has been around for a while, I just didn't realize it was  because of <label> tags before.  I finally narrowed it down. I tried a few  other combinations of HTML elements surrounding text in table cells and didn't  see this behavior in those unless the <label> tag was also there.  I didn't do  an exhaustive check, so other people might want to try other elements to try to  reproduce this behavior.  Jake
my_mothod: First, I realize that there is another bug that is very similar to this (  http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2051 ), but this is more specific  and I couldn't get rid of the "Worksforme" status...   When text is inside <label> tags within a table cell, the text breaks out of  the table cell as if the table cell didn't exist.  I have been and am still seeing this in current builds (most recently in Feb  24, 2000 build).  Take a look at my examples here:  This one really shows off the fact that the problem is with the <label> tag: http://206.9.170.23/exp/mozTableTest3.html  (Note: I ripped out the check boxes that the label id points to, but that is  what the <label> tags were used for.  They can be seen in the examples below)   These examples show a simulation closer to what we actually use on a production  site: http://206.9.170.23/exp/mozTableTest.html http://206.9.170.23/exp/mozTableTest2.html  The last two examples were done to replicate the table structure in this site: http://www.agweb.com  If there is a current survey question available there, you will see this  behavior.  Please fix this.  It has been around for a while, I just didn't realize it was  because of <label> tags before.  I finally narrowed it down. I tried a few  other combinations of HTML elements surrounding text in table cells and didn't  see this behavior in those unless the <label> tag was also there.  I didn't do  an exhaustive check, so other people might want to try other elements to try to  reproduce this behavior.  Jake text inside <label> tags within a table cell breaks out of table cell major Layout: Tables Core

description: doing: . scriptfile assumes that the scriptfile is in the path somewhere. Assuming that this is in the current path equates to assuming that the path has the cwd, or `.' in it which is often suggested as a bad security practice.  I'm surprised all the developers of this project have the current working directory in their path. Anyway, the fix is obvious for mozilla/build/autoconf/clean-config.sh, s/^\. all/\. \.\/all/ .. or see the diff above for reference..
my_mothod: doing: . scriptfile assumes that the scriptfile is in the path somewhere. Assuming that this is in the current path equates to assuming that the path has the cwd, or `.' in it which is often suggested as a bad security practice.  I'm surprised all the developers of this project have the current working directory in their path. Anyway, the fix is obvious for mozilla/build/autoconf/clean-config.sh, s/^\. all/\. \.\/all/ .. or see the diff above for reference.. assuming cwd is in the path is a bad security thing trivial Build Config SeaMonkey

Vice versa?).

Vice versa?). Paragraph tags around a table are ignored minor DOM: HTML Parser Core

description: The Tab key works in the wrong direction if used for navigating in the Password  prompt. When the TAB key is pressed on the Name field of the username/password box, the  focus goes to the "Save these Values" checkbox instead of the Password field.  Pressing Shift-Tab brings focus to the Password field. And pressing TAB from  the checkbox is useless. Pressing shift-tab from there brings focus back to the  username field.
my_mothod: The Tab key works in the wrong direction if used for navigating in the Password  prompt. When the TAB key is pressed on the Name field of the username/password box, the  focus goes to the "Save these Values" checkbox instead of the Password field.  Pressing Shift-Tab brings focus to the Password field. And pressing TAB from  the checkbox is useless. Pressing shift-tab from there brings focus back to the  username field. Incorrect action of TAB, in Password prompt minor DOM: UI Events & Focus Handling Core

description: In build 2000-02-26-08 on Win98SE  Steps to reproduce: 1. Click on the View menu and hold down the button. 2. Move down to the "Toolbar" item, but be careful to cause only one "onMove"    event  Actual resaults: The Toolbar item get selected but then deselected  Expected resaults: The Toolbar item should keep selected.  When the next "onMove" event is triggered the item is correctly selected again. This can also be seen as a flicker if you press the mouse on the View menu and  move slowly down.
my_mothod: In build 2000-02-26-08 on Win98SE  Steps to reproduce: 1. Click on the View menu and hold down the button. 2. Move down to the "Toolbar" item, but be careful to cause only one "onMove"    event  Actual resaults: The Toolbar item get selected but then deselected  Expected resaults: The Toolbar item should keep selected.  When the next "onMove" event is triggered the item is correctly selected again. This can also be seen as a flicker if you press the mouse on the View menu and  move slowly down. First item in menu is deselected when holding down mousebutton minor XUL Core

description: I tried typing "now" into from date to get bugzilla to display all the bugs  that were less than a day old, but apache gave me an 500 internal server error.  Same thing happened when I typed "yesterday". (I had selected "bug creation" in  the box next to the date fields; if nothing in this box is selected, I don't  think bugzilla evaluates the dates.)  I don't know what language bugzilla works in, and I definately don't know perl,  but that smells like a data-type error to me. And when users can generate data  type errors, they might be able to do uglier things using the same field.
my_mothod: I tried typing "now" into from date to get bugzilla to display all the bugs  that were less than a day old, but apache gave me an 500 internal server error.  Same thing happened when I typed "yesterday". (I had selected "bug creation" in  the box next to the date fields; if nothing in this box is selected, I don't  think bugzilla evaluates the dates.)  I don't know what language bugzilla works in, and I definately don't know perl,  but that smells like a data-type error to me. And when users can generate data  type errors, they might be able to do uglier things using the same field. "now" as from date in query gives internal server error minor Query/Bug List Bugzilla

description: This is Linux nightly build 2000022609  Attempting to open additional browsing windows through any method (including the New option under the file menu, or clicking on the browser icon at the bottom of the window, does not create a new browser window, instead it causes this javascript error:  In OpenBrowserWindw()... JavaScript Error: TypeError: handler has no properties URL: chrome://global/content/tasksOverlay.js LineNo: 92  I looked at the code, and changed it so it did a getService call in one line. That didn't work either...I got THIS error:  In OpenBrowserWindw()... JavaScript Error: TypeError: Components.classes['component://netscape/appshell/component/browser/cmdhandler'] has no properties URL: chrome://global/content/tasksOverlay.js LineNo: 91  So then I had a long chat with people in #mozilla:  <jband>	Jason: that progid is probably just not registered with the component manager <jband>	lxr search for cmdhandler finds it in only navigator.js and tasksOverlays.js <jband>	but no code that is claiming to implement that component that I can see <jband>	So what *is* cmdhandler?  <jband>	but the problem is that you don't have a handle to a componet instance <JasonCEager>	and why don't I have a handle to a component interface? <jband>	you have a progid that the component manager does not know about <jband>	no on registered that progid  <jband>	Jason: I have an old tree. cmdhandler used to be in nsIBrowserInstance.idl <jband>	It is not there now. try component://netscape/commandlinehander/general-startup-browser it might be the same thing bruce>	that's due to a change yesterday by sspitzer. <jband>	Jason: the -r 1.8 version of nsIBrowserInstance.idl changed this name. bug sspitzer  So I made my final attempt to fix the chrome, and now I get this error:  In OpenBrowserWindw()... JavaScript Error: TypeError: Components.classes['component://netscape/commandlinehandler/general-startup-browser'] has no properties URL: chrome://global/content/tasksOverlay.js LineNo: 91  So someone has changed the name of a component but hasn't changed the name of the component in the chrome, and I have no idea what component needs to be called.  So I'm going to have to drop back to 2000022209 until this gets fixed or someone tells me what the correct component name is.  *sigh* I think this should be part of the smoke test for the build, don't you think? Lots and lots of people depend on multiple browsing windows.  Making as a blocker for M 14..this SHOULD be an easy fix.

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; N; NT4.0; en-US) Mozilla/m13 BuildID:    2000022408  When a link that has an a:visited style is clicked on, a paragraph above it that has clear:left and margin-top:3m loses it's margin-top style and "jumps up" to have a top margin of 1em (default).  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Go to http://beast.res.wpi.net/~testcases/textjump.html 2. Follow the directions on that page    I have a lot of pages with clear:left set on the h1 and h2 tags.  This is a common style to set; it makes sure headings are flush left, not wrapped around some floating image from the previous paragraph.  Because h1 and h2 have top margins (of more than 1em) by default, ANY pages like this will jump around when ANY of their links are clicked on.  This is not just a cosmetic bug, because links that jump out of your way when you click on them cause a serious usability problem.  I set the severity (perhaps controversially) to major because a) the ability to follow hyperlinks quickly is a major    feature (practically *the* most major feature in a web    browser) b) it's broken on any pages with clear:left set on their    h1,h2, or h3 tags
my_mothod: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; N; NT4.0; en-US) Mozilla/m13 BuildID:    2000022408  When a link that has an a:visited style is clicked on, a paragraph above it that has clear:left and margin-top:3m loses it's margin-top style and "jumps up" to have a top margin of 1em (default).  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Go to http://beast.res.wpi.net/~testcases/textjump.html 2. Follow the directions on that page    I have a lot of pages with clear:left set on the h1 and h2 tags.  This is a common style to set; it makes sure headings are flush left, not wrapped around some floating image from the previous paragraph.  Because h1 and h2 have top margins (of more than 1em) by default, ANY pages like this will jump around when ANY of their links are clicked on.  This is not just a cosmetic bug, because links that jump out of your way when you click on them cause a serious usability problem.  I set the severity (perhaps controversially) to major because a) the ability to follow hyperlinks quickly is a major    feature (practically *the* most major feature in a web    browser) b) it's broken on any pages with clear:left set on their    h1,h2, or h3 tags [MARGIN-C]{inc} margins get lost on inc reflow if 'clear' is not none [FLOAT] minor Layout Core

description: There are several problems with the "CVS Contributor Form".  1. Section 5. Cryptography, is completely wrong now that the export regs have changed.  It needs to be fixed.  We cannot checkin any actual crypto code into OpenNSS until this is fixed.  (I just crossed this  section out completely before I signed the form.)  2. Section 1.  There needs to be an alternative to the paragraph that begins "Contributors's Mozilla.org account username..."  The alternative needs to allow a contribution without getting a CVS account at all. It needs to allow the contributor to designate another person who  already has a mozilla CVS account to act as the contributor's agent or proxy, to check-in the contribution on the contributor's behalf.  It needs to draw a clear distinction betweent the "Contributor"  (who is responsible for "Ownership", "Identification" "legal code" etc.) and the agent who merely checks it in.  3. Section 3, identification, needs an added provision that allows the person who checks in code as the agent for another to clearly identify who the "Contributor" is, so that the real Contributor will be responsible for his contribution, and not the agent who does the  checkin.  Until this is fixed, I won't be able to checkin any code for  Paul Kocher or others who've agreed to contribute code, but  who don't want to actively become mozilla CVS users.
my_mothod: There are several problems with the "CVS Contributor Form".  1. Section 5. Cryptography, is completely wrong now that the export regs have changed.  It needs to be fixed.  We cannot checkin any actual crypto code into OpenNSS until this is fixed.  (I just crossed this  section out completely before I signed the form.)  2. Section 1.  There needs to be an alternative to the paragraph that begins "Contributors's Mozilla.org account username..."  The alternative needs to allow a contribution without getting a CVS account at all. It needs to allow the contributor to designate another person who  already has a mozilla CVS account to act as the contributor's agent or proxy, to check-in the contribution on the contributor's behalf.  It needs to draw a clear distinction betweent the "Contributor"  (who is responsible for "Ownership", "Identification" "legal code" etc.) and the agent who merely checks it in.  3. Section 3, identification, needs an added provision that allows the person who checks in code as the agent for another to clearly identify who the "Contributor" is, so that the real Contributor will be responsible for his contribution, and not the agent who does the  checkin.  Until this is fixed, I won't be able to checkin any code for  Paul Kocher or others who've agreed to contribute code, but  who don't want to actively become mozilla CVS users. Mozilla contributor form needs changes to legal wording blocker Miscellaneous mozilla.org

description: From bug 29680: bratell wrote: That reminds me of something. When format=flowed was introduced, the change to  the default pref file were never checked in. Since the code was written to  work without it, I never cared to complain, but it's still in my local tree. If  you want to help me, the patch is below.  Index: mailnews.js =================================================================== RCS file: /cvsroot/mozilla/modules/libpref/src/init/mailnews.js,v retrieving revision 3.44 diff -r3.44 mailnews.js 136a137 > pref("mail.send_plaintext_flowed",          true);  // RFC 2646
my_mothod: From bug 29680: bratell wrote: That reminds me of something. When format=flowed was introduced, the change to  the default pref file were never checked in. Since the code was written to  work without it, I never cared to complain, but it's still in my local tree. If  you want to help me, the patch is below.  Index: mailnews.js =================================================================== RCS file: /cvsroot/mozilla/modules/libpref/src/init/mailnews.js,v retrieving revision 3.44 diff -r3.44 mailnews.js 136a137 > pref("mail.send_plaintext_flowed",          true);  // RFC 2646 There's no default pref for format=flowed trivial Backend MailNews Core

description: For about a week or so, I've had this problem where sometimes Mailnews would go into a state where selecting a message or switching folders doesn't cause the window to be repainted.  In that situation, it looks like UI events have no effect.  E.g., I'd click on a folder in the folder pane, but the thread pane would not refresh.  If I Alt-Tab away and back, the new folder displays in the thread pane.  I don't know how to reproduce it, but it seems like it tends to happen more often after longer use, and with biff on.  morse remarked on a simlar problem in bug 28100 where the save password checkmark wouldn't repaint after being clicked, and suggested it would be a threading problem.  I thought I'd file a bug on it, and add comments as I discover more.  Anyone else seeing this?  Linux build 2000.03.01.08
my_mothod: For about a week or so, I've had this problem where sometimes Mailnews would go into a state where selecting a message or switching folders doesn't cause the window to be repainted.  In that situation, it looks like UI events have no effect.  E.g., I'd click on a folder in the folder pane, but the thread pane would not refresh.  If I Alt-Tab away and back, the new folder displays in the thread pane.  I don't know how to reproduce it, but it seems like it tends to happen more often after longer use, and with biff on.  morse remarked on a simlar problem in bug 28100 where the save password checkmark wouldn't repaint after being clicked, and suggested it would be a threading problem.  I thought I'd file a bug on it, and add comments as I discover more.  Anyone else seeing this?  Linux build 2000.03.01.08 Mailnews/Aim windows sometimes doesn't refresh display blocker XUL Core

description: Regression: In the addressing widget, if you enter more than one recipient email  address, the field for the second and subsequent recipients is positioned  incorrectly - it lays on top of the Compose window toolbar.  Build ID: 2000-02-27-08 commercial (note: I downloaded a build from a directory  labled 2000-03-01; not sure if the directory or the label in the build is  incorrect)  Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Mail (Tasks | Mail) 2. Open a compose window ("New Msg" on mail toolbar) 3. Address message one recipient and hit enter  Expected: Focus moves to second recipient entry field, directly below the first Actual: Focus moves to second recipient entry field, but this field is  positioned on top of the Mail toolbar  Note: This bug was previously fixed, but has reappeared.
my_mothod: Regression: In the addressing widget, if you enter more than one recipient email  address, the field for the second and subsequent recipients is positioned  incorrectly - it lays on top of the Compose window toolbar. description: When you type characters more than one line and use Backspace key to delete whole characters, you will lose the caret  in Composer.  Steps of reproduce 1. Open Composer 2. Type "aaaa" and hit return to go to next line 3. Type "bbbb" 4. Hit Backspace key 9 times to delete whole characters 5. Hit one more Backspace key  You will lose the caret.  You cannot type any characters in Composer anymore until you close Composer and start it again.  Tested 2000030108 Win32, MAC, and 2000030113 Linux build.
my_mothod: When you type characters more than one line and use Backspace key to delete whole characters, you will lose the caret  in Composer.  Steps of reproduce 1. Open Composer 2. Type "aaaa" and hit return to go to next line 3. Type "bbbb" 4. Hit Backspace key 9 times to delete whole characters 5. Hit one more Backspace key  You will lose the caret.  You cannot type any characters in Composer anymore until you close Composer and start it again.  Tested 2000030108 Win32, MAC, and 2000030113 Linux build. nsHTMLEditRules::AfterEdit needs to ensure that the caret is always made visible again major DOM: Editor Core

description: Right-click to open a context menu.  Either left-click or right-click a context menu.  The easiest one to click is a disabled item, such as Copy.  You can click it repeated times without the menu dismissing.  Expected Results: - action (if applicable) is performed - browser window owning context menu retains active state through duration of the click  Actual Results: - action (if applicable) is performed - browser window owning context menu flashes inactive for a split second  This only seems to happen with context menus.  Popup menus off the main menu don't do this and neither do popups off the toolbar (eg. Bookmarks menu).  Note: this is unrelated to the fix for bug 17159 as I could duplicate it with an M14 release, which is before that fix was implemented.  ps. Mike, sorry about giving you another bug.
my_mothod: Right-click to open a context menu.  Either left-click or right-click a context menu.  The easiest one to click is a disabled item, such as Copy.  You can click it repeated times without the menu dismissing.  Expected Results: - action (if applicable) is performed - browser window owning context menu retains active state through duration of the click  Actual Results: - action (if applicable) is performed - browser window owning context menu flashes inactive for a split second  This only seems to happen with context menus.  Popup menus off the main menu don't do this and neither do popups off the toolbar (eg. Bookmarks menu).  Note: this is unrelated to the fix for bug 17159 as I could duplicate it with an M14 release, which is before that fix was implemented.  ps. Mike, sorry about giving you another bug. clicking on an item in a context menu causes the window to de-activate for a split second (title bar) trivial XUL Core

description: I'm a bit confused by why the Search button is top-aligned with the URL bar field, rather than vertically centered across the URL bar:  * The only interface object obviously aligned with the URL bar is the internal proxy icon, which is equidistant from the top and bottom borders of the URL bar.  * The top edge of the Search field/URL bar isn't aligned with any interface objects, so the top-alignment doesn't contribute to any form of grid system that I can see.  Thanks!
my_mothod: I'm a bit confused by why the Search button is top-aligned with the URL bar field, rather than vertically centered across the URL bar:  * The only interface object obviously aligned with the URL bar is the internal proxy icon, which is equidistant from the top and bottom borders of the URL bar.  * The top edge of the Search field/URL bar isn't aligned with any interface objects, so the top-alignment doesn't contribute to any form of grid system that I can see.  Thanks! Search button meant to be top-aligned? trivial General SeaMonkey

description: In the Linux build of Mozilla M14, clicking an expandible item in a menu (ie. a bookmark folder, or the 'Character Encoding' dropdown in the View menu) causes the entire menu to disappear.  It would be preferable to have a click open the item. Failing that, it would be nice to have a user-definable delay parameter for the dropdown - waiting half a second for each of ten folders can mean getting to one of my bookmarks takes five seconds -- I can type a URL faster.
my_mothod: In the Linux build of Mozilla M14, clicking an expandible item in a menu (ie. a bookmark folder, or the 'Character Encoding' dropdown in the View menu) causes the entire menu to disappear.  It would be preferable to have a click open the item. Failing that, it would be nice to have a user-definable delay parameter for the dropdown - waiting half a second for each of ten folders can mean getting to one of my bookmarks takes five seconds -- I can type a URL faster. Clicking expandable item in menu closes menu trivial XUL Core

description: My M14 talkback binary that I downloaded from the release directory identified itself as "Build ID: 2000022916"  I think it should identify itself as "Build ID: M14".  Yes, this is trivial, but it is also ANNOYING for us testers who have 5 or 6 different binary builds on our systems, after running moziila for a while. we forget which version we're running, so when a bug occurs, we're going to say that we're running NIGHTLY BUILD 2000022916, instead of saying that we're running M14. Saying the latter would make it MUCH easier for other people to reproduce the bug.  Besides, SOME kind of graphical distinction should be drawn between NIGHTLY Builds and Milestone builds, since Nightly builds often suffer from one kind of temporal problem or another...a "stupid" bug or breakage that can be fixed within a day or so. Milestone builds shouldn't suffer from those problems, and any bugs detected in those should be analysed more closely, they are indications of the "deeper" bugs.  Finally, it gives novices a clear indication about whether this is a nightly build or a milestone build.
