Saying the latter would make it MUCH easier for other people to reproduce the bug.  Besides, SOME kind of graphical distinction should be drawn between NIGHTLY Builds and Milestone builds, since Nightly builds often suffer from one kind of temporal problem or another...a "stupid" bug or breakage that can be fixed within a day or so. Milestone builds shouldn't suffer from those problems, and any bugs detected in those should be analysed more closely, they are indications of the "deeper" bugs.  Finally, it gives novices a clear indication about whether this is a nightly build or a milestone build. [ANNOYING] M14 build does not identify itself as M14 build. trivial Installer SeaMonkey

description: In the Preferences/Appearance/Fonts dialog, the two options are Serif and Monospace fonts. However, that's not what they mean. They really mean variable-width and fixed-width (a.k.a. monospace) fonts. Most monospace fonts are serifed, and perhaps a user wants a sans-serif font for default variable-width text.
my_mothod: In the Preferences/Appearance/Fonts dialog, the two options are Serif and Monospace fonts. However, that's not what they mean. They really mean variable-width and fixed-width (a.k.a. monospace) fonts. Most monospace fonts are serifed, and perhaps a user wants a sans-serif font for default variable-width text. Serif and monospace are not opposites trivial Preferences SeaMonkey

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/4.72 (Macintosh; U; PPC) BuildID:    200002241  No page downloads in its entirety. Only the first few lines of any given page  will download, and if there is a complete section of displayable HTML, it will  render. The more usual result is a completely blank page, and a 'Document: Done'  message.  Loading pages from local files works as expected; they load and display as  expected.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Load nearly any page. 2. View source to see that only the first few lines are there.  Actual Results:  For example, on the main mozilla.org page, this is the only  section which successfully downloads:   <HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE>mozilla.org</TITLE> </HEAD> <BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" TEXT="#000000" LINK="#0000EE" VLINK="#551A8B" ALINK="#FF0000" MARGINHEIGHT="0" MARGINWIDTH="0"> <MAP NAME="banner"> <AREA SHAPE=RECT COORDS="300,11,558,44" ALT="" HREF="http://www.mozilla.org/"> </MAP>  Nothing after that is downloaded, and nothing is displayed.  Expected Results:  It should have successfully downloaded the HTML source of the  page and displayed it.

description: here's a quick way to lose a few hours of work: open mozilla so the profile manager comes up. decide you don't need multiple profiles any more, so delete one (the profile I'm  deleting had the default mozProfile name, and who knows how long ago it was  created, or even where it was stored) walk away from the PC for a minute come back, notice the delete profile command is still running, and the disk  light is churning think to yourself "I wonder what it's deleting?" after a minute more, kill the process. notice that my ENTIRE mozilla tree is gone. THANKS!!!  No, really, thanks a bunch!  Thank god for backups.
my_mothod: here's a quick way to lose a few hours of work: open mozilla so the profile manager comes up. decide you don't need multiple profiles any more, so delete one (the profile I'm  deleting had the default mozProfile name, and who knows how long ago it was  created, or even where it was stored) walk away from the PC for a minute come back, notice the delete profile command is still running, and the disk  light is churning think to yourself "I wonder what it's deleting?" after a minute more, kill the process. notice that my ENTIRE mozilla tree is gone. THANKS!!!  No, really, thanks a bunch!  Thank god for backups. removing profile deleted my entire mozilla tree! blocker Startup & Profiles SeaMonkey

description: Overview Description:     There's something real evil about the little arrow to the right of the column headers in the manage bookmarks window.  Steps to Reproduce:   1) Open Manage bookmarks. Click the little triangle to the far right of the column headers to drop down a list of the columns.  2) Select (uncheck) a column.  3) Wait patiently -or- click on that arrow again.   Actual Results:   	Upon selecting an item and dismissing that menu, UI becomes sluggish and unresponsive. It you wait patiently you will  crash. If you become impatient you can simply click the arrow again to crash immediately  Expected Results:   	The window should redraw with the column of your choice missing or added as appropriate.  Build Date & Platform Bug Found:   	All platforms with 2000030208 builds.

description: The flashing cursor used to mark text position in string inputs and forms such as this one is dran a pixel or 2 too far to the left. The vertical bar should be psoitioned BETWEEN characters. Instead, it overlaps the leftmost (when between 2 chars), or rightmost (when no charcaters follow it) pixel column of the font, which greatly reduces readability, particularly with smal fonts. To see an easy example, go to any form and type the letter o. To see the way it should look, go to a windows menu such as the "Run Program" selection on the windows start bar and hit a single O as well.  Another cursor-related bug can be found by going to a form such as this one. Type some text. Then, hit the forward arrow. The cursor will disappear.   I also saw some other anonmlous behavior while entering this bug, which resulted in some lines being copied when I hit enter, but I can't figure out exactly what's going on.
my_mothod: The flashing cursor used to mark text position in string inputs and forms such as this one is dran a pixel or 2 too far to the left. The vertical bar should be psoitioned BETWEEN characters. Instead, it overlaps the leftmost (when between 2 chars), or rightmost (when no charcaters follow it) pixel column of the font, which greatly reduces readability, particularly with smal fonts. To see an easy example, go to any form and type the letter o. To see the way it should look, go to a windows menu such as the "Run Program" selection on the windows start bar and hit a single O as well.  Another cursor-related bug can be found by going to a form such as this one. Type some text. Then, hit the forward arrow. The cursor will disappear.   I also saw some other anonmlous behavior while entering this bug, which resulted in some lines being copied when I hit enter, but I can't figure out exactly what's going on. bar text cursor is off by a pixel or two trivial Layout: Form Controls Core

description: The "Search" button on Win32/Linux is now in all-caps.  All upper-case text is harder to read, and more likely to be ignored, than mixed-case text, since it lacks word-shapes that facilitate legibility, as explained in any typography 101 class.  Moreso, the only use of all-caps that I've seen used by trained designers is when it's used sparing to contrast with non-all caps text in a very different typeface. Since we don't use any other typefaces in our UI, this reason shouldn't apply.  If you want the Search button to stand out, may I suggest coming up with a more effective and visually savvy means of expressing it?
my_mothod: The "Search" button on Win32/Linux is now in all-caps.  All upper-case text is harder to read, and more likely to be ignored, than mixed-case text, since it lacks word-shapes that facilitate legibility, as explained in any typography 101 class.  Moreso, the only use of all-caps that I've seen used by trained designers is when it's used sparing to contrast with non-all caps text in a very different typeface. Since we don't use any other typefaces in our UI, this reason shouldn't apply.  If you want the Search button to stand out, may I suggest coming up with a more effective and visually savvy means of expressing it? ALL-UPPERCASE SEARCH BUTTON IS HARD TO READ, LOOKS UGLY (LIKE THIS TEXT) minor Search SeaMonkey

description: Mozilla does not seem to correctly handle a keyword of ROWSPAN="0" in a <td>  tag.  On the page http://members.xoom.com/scrows the top middle cell,  containing the "updates" graphic and the cell to it's left containing the  stylized exclaimation point contain the ROWSPAN="0" keyword in their <td> tags.  I saved this page locally and deleted all the embedded tables leaving only the  outside table(this did not fix the problem).  Then I chaned both of the above  mentioned keywords to ROWSPAN="1" and the table displayed properly.
my_mothod: Mozilla does not seem to correctly handle a keyword of ROWSPAN="0" in a <td>  tag.  On the page http://members.xoom.com/scrows the top middle cell,  containing the "updates" graphic and the cell to it's left containing the  stylized exclaimation point contain the ROWSPAN="0" keyword in their <td> tags.  I saved this page locally and deleted all the embedded tables leaving only the  outside table(this did not fix the problem).  Then I chaned both of the above  mentioned keywords to ROWSPAN="1" and the table displayed properly. ROWSPAN = "0" tretaed differently than NS 4.x minor Layout: Tables Core

description: When 2 or more browser windows are open at once, the "open windows" toobar does not work correctly. When the user clicks on the title of another open window, if the window is minimized, it will be selected in the windows toolbar(where the "start" button is located), but will not restore. I am running Windows NT 4.0 SP6a with Internet Explorer extensions installed.
my_mothod: When 2 or more browser windows are open at once, the "open windows" toobar does not work correctly. When the user clicks on the title of another open window, if the window is minimized, it will be selected in the windows toolbar(where the "start" button is located), but will not restore. I am running Windows NT 4.0 SP6a with Internet Explorer extensions installed. Switching to minimized window doesn't restore it minor XUL Core

description: Try these steps:  1. Go to http://www.freshmeat.net 2. Search for EPSON 3. Select a URL leading you to someone providing epson printer drivers for gimp. 4. Download the printer driver from the page. 5. Go to the homepage of the person providing the epson printer driver. 6. Click on the back button.  Mozilla will attempt to download the file again.
my_mothod: Try these steps:  1. Go to http://www.freshmeat.net 2. Search for EPSON 3. Select a URL leading you to someone providing epson printer drivers for gimp. 4. Download the printer driver from the page. 5. Go to the homepage of the person providing the epson printer driver. 6. Click on the back button.  Mozilla will attempt to download the file again. Clicking Back button attempts download of file... minor General SeaMonkey

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/4.72 [en] (Win98; I) BuildID:    M14  I performed a clean install of Win98 SE on a newly formatted drive, then got the  M14 .zip distribution. I unzipped it, ran mozilla.exe, and saw the splash screen  as expected. About 10 seconds later the splash screen disappears and nothing  ever happens after that. The process stops completely and nothing I try will get  Mozilla to run. The same behavior happens on the nightly builds as well.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Reformat the HD and install Win98 2. Get M14 or the nightly build Win32 .zip distribution 3. Unzip  4. Run mozilla.exe  Actual Results:  The splash screen shows for about 10 seconds, then disappears  and Mozilla never loads.  Expected Results:  Mozilla should have loaded.
my_mothod: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/4.72 [en] (Win98; I) BuildID:    M14  I performed a clean install of Win98 SE on a newly formatted drive, then got the  M14 .zip distribution. I unzipped it, ran mozilla.exe, and saw the splash screen  as expected. About 10 seconds later the splash screen disappears and nothing  ever happens after that. The process stops completely and nothing I try will get  Mozilla to run. The same behavior happens on the nightly builds as well.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Reformat the HD and install Win98 2. Get M14 or the nightly build Win32 .zip distribution 3. Unzip  4. Run mozilla.exe  Actual Results:  The splash screen shows for about 10 seconds, then disappears  and Mozilla never loads.  Expected Results:  Mozilla should have loaded. M14 zip doesn't run on a clean install blocker General SeaMonkey

description: Overview Description: status bar does not clear when exiting the site  Steps to Reproduce: 1)go to a website that sets statusbar text to something other than default 2)go to another where status bar is supposed to be normal 3)status bar retains text  Actual Results: Status bar does not clear when leaving site  Expected Results: status bar will clear  Reproducibility: unknown  Build Date & Platform Bug Found: Win98, BUILDID: 2000022820  Additional Builds and Platforms Tested On: NONE Additional Information: NONE

description: Password manager crashes Mozilla trying when trying to save password.  I pulled the tree the evening of March 5th after the tree went green on Win32. Build ID:  2000022708  After clobbering and building an optimize build, I ran mozilla.  When I tried logging into bugzilla for the first time Autofill asked if I wanted to save the password.  I clicked yes.  Then the dialog box came up asking if I wanted set a master password.  I clicked ok (leaving both passwords blank) and mozilla crashed.  I then tried it again, same results.  I then tried it with a password.  Same results.  Windows 2000.  VC 6 w SP3.  January 2K Platform SDK.
my_mothod: Password manager crashes Mozilla trying when trying to save password.  I pulled the tree the evening of March 5th after the tree went green on Win32. Build ID:  2000022708  After clobbering and building an optimize build, I ran mozilla.  When I tried logging into bugzilla for the first time Autofill asked if I wanted to save the password.  I clicked yes.  Then the dialog box came up asking if I wanted set a master password.  I clicked ok (leaving both passwords blank) and mozilla crashed.  I then tried it again, same results.  I then tried it with a password.  Same results.  Windows 2000.  VC 6 w SP3.  January 2K Platform SDK. Password manager crashes Mozilla trying to save master password. blocker Form Manager Toolkit

description: System: Nightly of 20000305 on WinNT 4 SP 6 a on PII Overview: Changing prefs multiple times crashes mozilla with a stack overflow  in nsTextFormatter::vsprintf_append. Test Case: Open browser. Go to Edit->Preferences->Debug. Disable memory cache  and press OK. Repeat to re-enable memory cache and press OK again. Expected Result: Normal closure of window. Actual Result: Crash (See attached crash log) Other info: Works fine in M14 though the browser window gets minimized every  time after clicking OK.
my_mothod: System: Nightly of 20000305 on WinNT 4 SP 6 a on PII Overview: Changing prefs multiple times crashes mozilla with a stack overflow  in nsTextFormatter::vsprintf_append. Test Case: Open browser. Go to Edit->Preferences->Debug. Disable memory cache  and press OK. Repeat to re-enable memory cache and press OK again. Expected Result: Normal closure of window. Actual Result: Crash (See attached crash log) Other info: Works fine in M14 though the browser window gets minimized every  time after clicking OK. Changing same pref multiple times crashes mozilla major Preferences SeaMonkey

description: Uisng build 2000-03-05-17 on win98, if you give a bad password, you get the  login failed error and then a crash.  Still need to  test on linux and mac.  1. Launch Browser 2. Launch mail using Tasks|Mail   3. If IMAP account is first you will get a password dialog.  Enter the wrong  password Result: Login Failed error comes up and then you crash  Expected: To have the Password dialog come up again for a 2nd try. 4. If POP account is first 5. Click Get Msg, Enter the wrong password. 6. An error message comes up "An error occurred while sending your password to  the server..."  Click OK    Result: Crash Expected:  To have the Password dialog come up again for a 2nd try.
my_mothod: Uisng build 2000-03-05-17 on win98, if you give a bad password, you get the  login failed error and then a crash.  Still need to  test on linux and mac.  1. Launch Browser 2. Launch mail using Tasks|Mail   3. If IMAP account is first you will get a password dialog.  Enter the wrong  password Result: Login Failed error comes up and then you crash  Expected: To have the Password dialog come up again for a 2nd try. 4. If POP account is first 5. Click Get Msg, Enter the wrong password. 6. An error message comes up "An error occurred while sending your password to  the server..."  Click OK    Result: Crash Expected:  To have the Password dialog come up again for a 2nd try. Crash, at Login Failed when you give a bad password blocker Networking MailNews Core

description: Using mar06 builds  When you are creating a new account and choose the "newsgroup account" radio button, the America Online radio button related to mail accounts stays selected in the wizard.  Once the newsgroup account is selected, there should be no other radio button selection.
my_mothod: Using mar06 builds  When you are creating a new account and choose the "newsgroup account" radio button, the America Online radio button related to mail accounts stays selected in the wizard.  Once the newsgroup account is selected, there should be no other radio button selection. Acct Wizard: AOL radio button stays selected when News Account minor MailNews: Account Configuration SeaMonkey

description: I'm filing this since I'm under the impression that Bugzilla is no longer designed to handle open bugs with a resolution.  It seems that mass reassignment of a bug that is RESOLVED-LATER can cause the bug to change to NEW without clearing the resolution.  See diffs below.  (BTW, it would be nice to be able to reassign LATER/REMIND bugs without reopening them.)    http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=10713  *** shadow/10713        Thu Jan 20 14:41:41 2000 --- shadow/10713.tmp.3292       Mon Mar  6 11:50:25 2000 *************** *** 3,14 ****   Version: other   Platform: All   OS/Version: All ! Status: RESOLVED      Resolution: LATER   Severity: normal   Priority: P5   Component: Layout ! AssignedTo: kipp@netscape.com                               ReportedBy: tom@dizoglio.com                  QAContact: vidur@netscape.com   TargetMilestone: M15 --- 3,14 ----   Version: other   Platform: All   OS/Version: All ! Status: NEW      Resolution: LATER   Severity: normal   Priority: P5   Component: Layout ! AssignedTo: buster@netscape.com                               ReportedBy: tom@dizoglio.com                  QAContact: vidur@netscape.com   TargetMilestone: M15 *************** *** 42,44 **** --- 42,47 ----   Migrating from {css2} to css2 keyword. The {css1}, {css2}, {css3} and {css-moz}   radars should now be considered deprecated in favour of keywords.   I am *really* sorry about the spam... +  + ------- Additional Comments From buster@netscape.com  2000-03-06 11:50 -------+ mine now
my_mothod: I'm filing this since I'm under the impression that Bugzilla is no longer designed to handle open bugs with a resolution.  It seems that mass reassignment of a bug that is RESOLVED-LATER can cause the bug to change to NEW without clearing the resolution.  See diffs below.  (BTW, it would be nice to be able to reassign LATER/REMIND bugs without reopening them.)    http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=10713  *** shadow/10713        Thu Jan 20 14:41:41 2000 --- shadow/10713.tmp.3292       Mon Mar  6 11:50:25 2000 *************** *** 3,14 ****   Version: other   Platform: All   OS/Version: All ! Status: RESOLVED      Resolution: LATER   Severity: normal   Priority: P5   Component: Layout ! AssignedTo: kipp@netscape.com                               ReportedBy: tom@dizoglio.com                  QAContact: vidur@netscape.com   TargetMilestone: M15 --- 3,14 ----   Version: other   Platform: All   OS/Version: All ! Status: NEW      Resolution: LATER   Severity: normal   Priority: P5   Component: Layout ! AssignedTo: buster@netscape.com                               ReportedBy: tom@dizoglio.com                  QAContact: vidur@netscape.com   TargetMilestone: M15 *************** *** 42,44 **** --- 42,47 ----   Migrating from {css2} to css2 keyword. The {css1}, {css2}, {css3} and {css-moz}   radars should now be considered deprecated in favour of keywords.   I am *really* sorry about the spam... +  + ------- Additional Comments From buster@netscape.com  2000-03-06 11:50 -------+ mine now status not kept in mass reassignment of resolved bugs critical Creating/Changing Bugs Bugzilla

description: Bah.  Just my luck.  The first time I use Bugzilla advanced querying and I broke it.   SELECT bugs.bug_id, bugs.groupset, date_format(bugs.delta_ts,'Y-m-d'), map_reporter.login_name, substring(bugs.bug_status,1,4), substring(bugs.resolution,1,4), substring(bugs.component, 1, 8), substring(bugs.product, 1, 8), bugs.votes, bugs.target_milestone, substring(bugs.short_desc, 1, 60) FROM bugs, profiles map_assigned_to, profiles map_reporter LEFT JOIN profiles map_qa_contact ON bugs.qa_contact = map_qa_contact.userid WHERE bugs.assigned_to = map_assigned_to.userid AND bugs.reporter = map_reporter.userid AND bugs.groupset & 192 = bugs.groupset AND (INSTR(blocked, '18054')) GROUP BY bugs.bug_id ORDER BY bugs.delta_ts, bugs.priority, bugs.bug_severity: Unknown column 'blocked' in 'where clause' at globals.pl line 135.
my_mothod: Bah.  Just my luck.  The first time I use Bugzilla advanced querying and I broke it.   SELECT bugs.bug_id, bugs.groupset, date_format(bugs.delta_ts,'Y-m-d'), map_reporter.login_name, substring(bugs.bug_status,1,4), substring(bugs.resolution,1,4), substring(bugs.component, 1, 8), substring(bugs.product, 1, 8), bugs.votes, bugs.target_milestone, substring(bugs.short_desc, 1, 60) FROM bugs, profiles map_assigned_to, profiles map_reporter LEFT JOIN profiles map_qa_contact ON bugs.qa_contact = map_qa_contact.userid WHERE bugs.assigned_to = map_assigned_to.userid AND bugs.reporter = map_reporter.userid AND bugs.groupset & 192 = bugs.groupset AND (INSTR(blocked, '18054')) GROUP BY bugs.bug_id ORDER BY bugs.delta_ts, bugs.priority, bugs.bug_severity: Unknown column 'blocked' in 'where clause' at globals.pl line 135. Advanced query conditions on dependencies and CCs are ignored. critical Bugzilla-General Bugzilla

description: During some search for mailnews bottlenecks I happened to end up in GlyphHit in  mozTXTToHTMLConv.cpp. I noticed that the recent optimization of GlyphHit broke  the replacement of several patterns. For instance (r) -> ®  That was because the previous output variable outputHTML was made a local  variable and the value assigned to outputHTML never leaves the function. See:      outputHTML = "©";     glyphTextLen = 3;     MOZ_TIMER_STOP(mGlyphHitTimer);     return PR_TRUE;  Further more. I noticed that the initialization of the (now) local variable  outputHTML consumes more than 50% of the time spent in GlyphHit and it's most  often not used at all. I could open a seperate bug for that if it's wrong.  By the way, how good is it to have a function that's called for every single  character in a text? The overhead must be non-neglectable and I don't think any  compiler would inline it.
my_mothod: During some search for mailnews bottlenecks I happened to end up in GlyphHit in  mozTXTToHTMLConv.cpp. I noticed that the recent optimization of GlyphHit broke  the replacement of several patterns. For instance (r) -> ®  That was because the previous output variable outputHTML was made a local  variable and the value assigned to outputHTML never leaves the function. See:      outputHTML = "©";     glyphTextLen = 3;     MOZ_TIMER_STOP(mGlyphHitTimer);     return PR_TRUE;  Further more. I noticed that the initialization of the (now) local variable  outputHTML consumes more than 50% of the time spent in GlyphHit and it's most  often not used at all. I could open a seperate bug for that if it's wrong.  By the way, how good is it to have a function that's called for every single  character in a text? The overhead must be non-neglectable and I don't think any  compiler would inline it. GlyphHit broken / won't replace (r) ® with and (c) with © minor MIME MailNews Core

description: Overview Description:     Even if you only have one profile, using the arrow key to try and negotiate the profile list (tree) results in an immediate crash on  WinNT.  Steps to Reproduce:   1) Launch mozilla with -ProfileManager unless you have multiple profiles.  2) Click inside the space where the profiles are listed to give it focus (another bug).  3) Hit the down or up arrow a couple times.    Actual Results:   	When you try to use the arrows, seamonkey crashes  Expected Results:   	Ummm, no crash- scroll through my profiles.  Build Date & Platform Bug Found:   	Found with the 2000030709 build on WinNT  Additional Builds and Platforms Tested On:   	I also tested a 2000030508 Mac build and did NOT reproduce. This is either new or Win specific.  Additional Information:  	I would suspect the static XUL tree. There were bugs like this recently where other such trees were used, I believe hyatt fixed  those cases.
my_mothod: Overview Description:     Even if you only have one profile, using the arrow key to try and negotiate the profile list (tree) results in an immediate crash on  WinNT.  Steps to Reproduce:   1) Launch mozilla with -ProfileManager unless you have multiple profiles.  2) Click inside the space where the profiles are listed to give it focus (another bug).  3) Hit the down or up arrow a couple times.    Actual Results:   	When you try to use the arrows, seamonkey crashes  Expected Results:   	Ummm, no crash- scroll through my profiles.  Build Date & Platform Bug Found:   	Found with the 2000030709 build on WinNT  Additional Builds and Platforms Tested On:   	I also tested a 2000030508 Mac build and did NOT reproduce. This is either new or Win specific.  Additional Information:  	I would suspect the static XUL tree. There were bugs like this recently where other such trees were used, I believe hyatt fixed  those cases. using arrow keys on profile tree crashes major Startup & Profiles SeaMonkey

description: If we try to continously open html files in one child window. [Assuming every  html file accesses some functions in predefined JS library], then for second  html file JS library access is denied. Or second html file could not find  functions in JS library.  DESCRIPTION: For example, If we have one Main html file [Call it "main.html"], and it opens three html  files [call these, "test1.html", "test2.html", & "test3.html"] in child window  one by one. All three "test1,2,3.html" files call javascript functions from JS  library. [Call it "donothing.js"]   Now problem is first file test1.html could easily call javascript functions  defined in JS library, but when it comes to second file, it could not find those  functions. [We are calling same functions on both the files and JS library  pathis also set exactly same way.]  BUILDS: 2000-03-07.  STEPS TO REPRODUCE: 1] Please visit above specified URL with above specified builds as well as 4.x. [This opens one child window which loads three files in a row. All these three  files access  javascript function to load next file. At second file you'll see  alert that it could not find function "opennewtest()"] 2] Compare actions on 4.x as well as mozilla.  EXPECTED RESULTS: Child window should load third file too which is "test3.html". and your screen  should show "You are at TEST3.HTML".  ACTUAL RESULTS: After loading test2.html we get alert saying it could not find function  "opennewtest()" to load next file. [Problem is how come it found this function first time at test1.html. and not  second time at test2.html]  You could either visit above URL, or you could set your own testing environment  with files I'm attaching.  MAIN FILE[main.html] START: <HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE>JS Lbrary acess test</TITLE> </HEAD> <BODY> This page opens threetests in same window, one after another. <SCRIPT> var a = new Array() a[0] = 'test1.html'; a[1] = 'test2.html'; a[2] = 'test3.html';  a.sort();  var tcnum=0; var numfiles=a.length;  openTC() function openTC() {   if(tcnum != numfiles)   {     url = 'http://bubblegum/desale/ngdriver/tests/'+a[tcnum];     testWin = window.open(url, 'testWindow');     testWin.opener = self;     testWin.focus();     tcnum++;   } } </SCRIPT> </BODY> </HTML> MAIN FILE[main.html] END: In above file you'll need to change value of variable "url" if you set up your  own testing enviornment.  TEST1 FILE [test1.html] START: <HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE>test1.html</TITLE> <SCRIPT TYPE="text/javascript" SRC="../donothing.js"> </SCRIPT> </HEAD> <BODY bgcolor="#0cafe0" text="#cafe00" onLoad="donothing();"> This is <big>Test: 1</big> <SCRIPT TYPE="text/javascript"> opennewtest(); </SCRIPT> </BODY> </HTML> TEST1 FILE [test1.html] END:  TEST2 FILE [test2.html] START: <HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE>test2.html</TITLE> <SCRIPT TYPE="text/javascript" SRC="../donothing.js"> </SCRIPT> </HEAD> <BODY bgcolor="#0cafe0" text="#cafe00" onLoad="donothing();"> This is <big>Test: 2</big> <SCRIPT TYPE="text/javascript"> opennewtest(); </SCRIPT> </BODY> </HTML> TEST2 FILE [test2.html] END:  TEST3 FILE [test3.html] START: <HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE>test3.html</TITLE> <SCRIPT TYPE="text/javascript" SRC="../donothing.js"> </SCRIPT> </HEAD> <BODY bgcolor="#0cafe0" text="#cafe00" onLoad="donothing();"> <SCRIPT TYPE="text/javascript"> document.write('You are at TEST3.HTML'); </SCRIPT> </BODY> </HTML> TEST3 FILE [test3.html] END:  JS LIBRARY [donothing.js] START: /******************************************************************************  * Function: donothing()  *  * Descript: does Nothig  * Returns: null  *****************************************************************************/  function donothing(){ var x, y = 5; x = y; }  /******************************************************************************  * Function: opennewtest()  *  * Descript: Opens New test file.  * Returns: null  *****************************************************************************/ function opennewtest(){ window.opener.openTC(); } JS LIBRARY [donothing.js] START:  Hope this all informations helps.  If you need any more info, please ask me.

description: Overview Description:     There are 3 scenarios for a URL bar search.  1) the url field is 'dirty' because you've typed something in the field 2) the url field is 'clean' and displays the url you are currently viewing. 3) the url field is still 'clean' but you've deleted the text of the url field.  In each of those cases you can then press the 'SEARCH' button.  Currently only Scenario 1 is working.  Scenario 2 does absolutely nothing. Scenario does an empty search on ' '.  That was windows behavior. Linux seems to always do a search on whatever(if anything) is in the url field whether it was user  inputed or not.  this represents a major regression with the 2000030709 builds
my_mothod: Overview Description:     There are 3 scenarios for a URL bar search.  1) the url field is 'dirty' because you've typed something in the field 2) the url field is 'clean' and displays the url you are currently viewing. 3) the url field is still 'clean' but you've deleted the text of the url field.  In each of those cases you can then press the 'SEARCH' button.  Currently only Scenario 1 is working.  Scenario 2 does absolutely nothing. Scenario does an empty search on ' '.  That was windows behavior. Linux seems to always do a search on whatever(if anything) is in the url field whether it was user  inputed or not.  this represents a major regression with the 2000030709 builds browser search button is broken and/or searching for the wrong things major Search SeaMonkey

description: In older versions of mozilla, pressing tab on the last tabbable page element would bring the focus to the first element on the page.  In build 2000 030516, the focus gets "lost" when I do this (can't tell what has focus, and shift-tab doesn't bring me back).  Very similar problem with shift-tab from the first element on a page.
my_mothod: In older versions of mozilla, pressing tab on the last tabbable page element would bring the focus to the first element on the page.  In build 2000 030516, the focus gets "lost" when I do this (can't tell what has focus, and shift-tab doesn't bring me back).  Very similar problem with shift-tab from the first element on a page. [FOCUS/ACT] can't tab from last to first page element minor DOM: UI Events & Focus Handling Core

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; N; Win98; en-US) Mozilla/m14 BuildID:    2000022820  Using my Logitech wheel mouse under Win98 SE, turning the wheel does not produce a scrolling effect at all.  When the wheel button is pushed, which generally allows scrolling by moving the mouse itself up and down, no effect is produced either (however, a circle with up/down arrows does pop up as if the scrolling is in effect).  In almost all other applications (including non-MS ones), the scrolling feature works properly.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.Connect a Logitech wheel mouse and install drivers 2.Start Mozilla 3.Attempt to use the wheel scrolling feature   Actual Results:  No scrolling effect was produced.  Expected Results:  A scrolling effect should have been produced:  when the wheel was rolled, the text should have scrolled up and down accordingly.  When the wheel was pressed as a button, the text should have scrolled based on moving the mouse up or down.  My computer is a Compaq with Windows 98 SE and a Compaq-branded Logitech mouse connected to the PS/2 mouse port.
my_mothod: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; N; Win98; en-US) Mozilla/m14 BuildID:    2000022820  Using my Logitech wheel mouse under Win98 SE, turning the wheel does not produce a scrolling effect at all.  When the wheel button is pushed, which generally allows scrolling by moving the mouse itself up and down, no effect is produced either (however, a circle with up/down arrows does pop up as if the scrolling is in effect).  In almost all other applications (including non-MS ones), the scrolling feature works properly.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.Connect a Logitech wheel mouse and install drivers 2.Start Mozilla 3.Attempt to use the wheel scrolling feature   Actual Results:  No scrolling effect was produced.  Expected Results:  A scrolling effect should have been produced:  when the wheel was rolled, the text should have scrolled up and down accordingly.  When the wheel was pressed as a button, the text should have scrolled based on moving the mouse up or down.  My computer is a Compaq with Windows 98 SE and a Compaq-branded Logitech mouse connected to the PS/2 mouse port. Mouse wheel doesn't work for Logitech wheel mouse. minor General SeaMonkey

description: If you drop a listbox down from one frame onto a lower frame that hasn't loaded  yet, the listbox won't be erased until the bottom frame starts getting drawn.   This isn't a horrible bug, but it does look a little awkward.  Noticed on http://www.finalfantasy.com/ while the site was slashdotted.  Using  a slow connection might reproduce the effect on the same site.  This might be related to another bug that I can't find now: right-clicking  makes dropdown listbox persist.
my_mothod: If you drop a listbox down from one frame onto a lower frame that hasn't loaded  yet, the listbox won't be erased until the bottom frame starts getting drawn.   This isn't a horrible bug, but it does look a little awkward.  Noticed on http://www.finalfantasy.com/ while the site was slashdotted.  Using  a slow connection might reproduce the effect on the same site.  This might be related to another bug that I can't find now: right-clicking  makes dropdown listbox persist. Background doesn't paint until document loaded minor Layout Core

description: Visibility: collapse is ignored on elements other than tables. This is incorrect  since it should be treated as hidden - see the quote from the specified URL:  collapse       Please consult the section on dynamic row and column effects in tables. If  used on elements other than rows or columns, 'collapse' has the same meaning as  'hidden'.
my_mothod: Visibility: collapse is ignored on elements other than tables. This is incorrect  since it should be treated as hidden - see the quote from the specified URL:  collapse       Please consult the section on dynamic row and column effects in tables. If  used on elements other than rows or columns, 'collapse' has the same meaning as  'hidden'. Visibility: collapse trivial Layout Core

description:
When a table element has a specified width that is wider than that required by the content, and that also overflows the viewport, the table element is clipped to the width of the viewport. For example:
Content
In this case the width would be clipped to that of the viewport; if, however, the content actually required the specified width, it would be correctly rendered.
my_mothod:
When a table element has a specified width that is wider than that required by the content, and that also overflows the viewport, the table element is clipped to the width of the viewport. For example:
Content
In this case the width would be clipped to that of the viewport; if, however, the content actually required the specified width, it would be correctly rendered. Table element widths clipped to max(viewport width, content width) trivial Layout: Tables Core

description: I'm guessing this is a network bug, maybe cache.  dbaron filed a similar bug against DOM0, where JS functions were undefined on reload: bug 31031.  Overview: linked stylesheets which are active on loading a page, become inactive when pressing reload. Also, if several pages on a site share the same stylesheet, only the first page referencing the stylesheet has the styles enabled, subsequent pages do not.  To reproduce: 1. Go to http://www.w3.org/Style/CSS/.  Note beautiful stylesheet effects at work. 2. Hit reload  Actual result: boring plain old HTML styles Expected result: same CSS visual magic as on original load.  This worked on M13, so marking regression. Also marking blocker since I imagine testing CSS layout is hard if you can only look at a style sheet once.  Linux build 2000.03.08.09
my_mothod: I'm guessing this is a network bug, maybe cache.  dbaron filed a similar bug against DOM0, where JS functions were undefined on reload: bug 31031.  Overview: linked stylesheets which are active on loading a page, become inactive when pressing reload. Also, if several pages on a site share the same stylesheet, only the first page referencing the stylesheet has the styles enabled, subsequent pages do not.  To reproduce: 1. Go to http://www.w3.org/Style/CSS/.  Note beautiful stylesheet effects at work. 2. Hit reload  Actual result: boring plain old HTML styles Expected result: same CSS visual magic as on original load.  This worked on M13, so marking regression. Also marking blocker since I imagine testing CSS layout is hard if you can only look at a style sheet once.  Linux build 2000.03.08.09 Linked stylesheets only loaded once blocker Networking Core

description:

description: If you want to copy and paste with the mouse (from the ftp proxy settings to the http proxy settings for example), then you can't copy (selecting with the mouse and the pasting remains the last copy that you paste before you wanted to copy the information in the proxy settings (you know the standard copy and paste : select with the left mouse button, and paste with the middle mouse button).
my_mothod: If you want to copy and paste with the mouse (from the ftp proxy settings to the http proxy settings for example), then you can't copy (selecting with the mouse and the pasting remains the last copy that you paste before you wanted to copy the information in the proxy settings (you know the standard copy and paste : select with the left mouse button, and paste with the middle mouse button). Selection doesn't work in read-only text fields. minor DOM: Selection Core

description: I tried loading http://www.fx.com.  The browser never responded...the throbber kept spinning, the page never loaded.  The message on the status line was "resolving http://www.fx.com" or something to that effect.  I tried loading the page in Nav 4, and immediately got this DNS error page:  Error         The requested item could not be loaded by the proxy.       Netscape Proxy is unable to locate the server: www.fx.com The server does not have a DNS entry. Check the server name in the Location (URL) and      try again.    Proxy server at supernova.netscape.com on port 8080     So I stopped the page load, but I could not load any other network URLs.  I stopped the app and restarted, and I could load URLs fine.  It's seems like: 1) we're not responding to the DNS error 2) once we get a DNS error, we can never resolve another host.
my_mothod: I tried loading http://www.fx.com.  The browser never responded...the throbber kept spinning, the page never loaded.  The message on the status line was "resolving http://www.fx.com" or something to that effect.  I tried loading the page in Nav 4, and immediately got this DNS error page:  Error         The requested item could not be loaded by the proxy.       Netscape Proxy is unable to locate the server: www.fx.com The server does not have a DNS entry. Check the server name in the Location (URL) and      try again.    Proxy server at supernova.netscape.com on port 8080     So I stopped the page load, but I could not load any other network URLs.  I stopped the app and restarted, and I could load URLs fine.  It's seems like: 1) we're not responding to the DNS error 2) once we get a DNS error, we can never resolve another host. Proxy: if you get a DNS error, you can never load a different URL blocker Networking Core

description: At my site all https requests must go through a proxy server, but there's currently no way to set the name of your https proxy server in the UI. If I set the http (no s) proxy server to the correct value (at my site the http  and https proxy servers are the same) and try to  visit any https page, the browser times out after about a minute and doesn't display the https page.
my_mothod: At my site all https requests must go through a proxy server, but there's currently no way to set the name of your https proxy server in the UI. If I set the http (no s) proxy server to the correct value (at my site the http  and https proxy servers are the same) and try to  visit any https page, the browser times out after about a minute and doesn't display the https page. SSL requests not going to proxy critical Networking Core

description: When I try to visit a protected Web page (http://www.blazingcactus.com/common/ for example, Mozilla (M14) throws up a dialog asking for a user name and password. I can enter a user name, but when I try and click on the password, nothing seems to get entered into the box and the authentication subsequently fails. I have tried this several times with the same result.
my_mothod: When I try to visit a protected Web page (http://www.blazingcactus.com/common/ for example, Mozilla (M14) throws up a dialog asking for a user name and password. description: * Overview Description:  Compiling with the --enable-boehm option on gcc 2.95.2 reports 3 seperate  "multiple definition" errors in "gc_cpp.cc".    * Steps to Reproduce:  1) compile with ----enable-boehm on Linux    * Actual Results:  See attached file for a snippet of (g)make's output.  In short, the following  sybols were apparently redefined: GC_push_all_stacks, GC_stop_world, and  GC_start_world.    Expected Results:  A complete build resulting in a browser that never leaks memory and saves the  world.  ;-)    * Reproducibility:  I'm currently only able to test this on my Debian (Potato) GNU/Linux (2.2.13)  machine.    * Build Date & Platform Bug Found:  Mar. 7-9 CVS HEAD    * Additional Information:  The problem seems to be in generic_threads.c vs.  linux_threads.c:  both contain  different definitions of GC_stop_world, GC_start_world etc.
my_mothod: * Overview Description:  Compiling with the --enable-boehm option on gcc 2.95.2 reports 3 seperate  "multiple definition" errors in "gc_cpp.cc".    * Steps to Reproduce:  1) compile with ----enable-boehm on Linux    * Actual Results:  See attached file for a snippet of (g)make's output.  In short, the following  sybols were apparently redefined: GC_push_all_stacks, GC_stop_world, and  GC_start_world.    Expected Results:  A complete build resulting in a browser that never leaks memory and saves the  world.  ;-)    * Reproducibility:  I'm currently only able to test this on my Debian (Potato) GNU/Linux (2.2.13)  machine.    * Build Date & Platform Bug Found:  Mar. 7-9 CVS HEAD    * Additional Information:  The problem seems to be in generic_threads.c vs.  linux_threads.c:  both contain  different definitions of GC_stop_world, GC_start_world etc. Unable to build with --enable-boehm on Linux: mulitple definition errors in gc_cpp.cc minor Build Config SeaMonkey

description: Steps to reproduce: 1. Get a really large favorites list in IE.  I have lots of submenus in my IE  favorites, along with a bunch of unsorted sites in my root favorites directory. 2. Open mozilla browser. 3. Pull down bookmarks menu, hover over "imported IE favorties" for half a  second (long enough to make a submenu come up - use another menu to determine  exactly how long this is). 4. Click in an empty area of the page.  The bookmarks menu doesn't go away  until it would have finished importing the IE favorites, and the browser is  generally unresponsive.  I don't know if this is specific to imported bookmarks, or general to large or  long and unsorted bookmark lists.  This is probably a specific case of bug #30942, mozilla should be more  responsive while doing slow tasks or while stuck in an infinite loop.

I don't know if this is specific to imported bookmarks, or general to large or  long and unsorted bookmark lists.  This is probably a specific case of bug #30942, mozilla should be more  responsive while doing slow tasks or while stuck in an infinite loop. Browser unresponsive while importing IE favorites minor Bookmarks & History SeaMonkey

description: Some bugzilla users attempt to include HTML tags in their posts, for example,  to link to another bug.  They probably do this because they're used to slashdot- style linking, and assume that the automatic "Bug #10000" links in other  people's posts are actually manual links.  The problem isn't that bugzilla  doesn't allow HTML posts, but that it messes up both the manual link and the  automatic link (if the anchor text is like "Bug #10000") in this case so that  other users must type the bug number manually (the horror :)  Bug #31322 shows a few test cases and the results.  Actual results: Bugzilla includes the > in the href and the anchor as part of  the URL.  Expected results: Link URL is underlined correctly (so it's clickable) but all  tags are still shown as typed (so pasted html isn't destroyed).  Anchors that  are bug numbers are also linked to the bug number they refer to.   Related: Bug #31323, bugzilla should warn users not to use html tags to format messages Bug #17452, RFE to allow bugzilla comments to be in html format (which probably  won't be done)
my_mothod: Some bugzilla users attempt to include HTML tags in their posts, for example,  to link to another bug.  They probably do this because they're used to slashdot- style linking, and assume that the automatic "Bug #10000" links in other  people's posts are actually manual links.  The problem isn't that bugzilla  doesn't allow HTML posts, but that it messes up both the manual link and the  automatic link (if the anchor text is like "Bug #10000") in this case so that  other users must type the bug number manually (the horror :)  Bug #31322 shows a few test cases and the results.  Actual results: Bugzilla includes the > in the href and the anchor as part of  the URL.  Expected results: Link URL is underlined correctly (so it's clickable) but all  tags are still shown as typed (so pasted html isn't destroyed).  Anchors that  are bug numbers are also linked to the bug number they refer to.   Related: Bug #31323, bugzilla should warn users not to use html tags to format messages Bug #17452, RFE to allow bugzilla comments to be in html format (which probably  won't be done) Bugzilla displays attempted HTML links incorrectly minor User Interface Bugzilla

description: found while using 2000.03.09.xx opt bits on all three platforms. basically, the text entered in textfields associated with radio buttons that are *deselected* still appear active (not greyed-out).  to repro: 1. open Prefs. 2. go to Advanced > Proxies. 3. select one of the radio buttons that has textfields, eg, "Automatic proxy configuration URL." 4. in the textfield for the item selected in (3), enter some text. 5. select another radio button w/a textfield, eg, "Manual Proxy Configuration." observe: even though the radio button from (3) is deselected, its text appears active. 6. enter some text for (5). observe: both the text in (3) and (5) appear active.  expected: the text in (3) should become greyed-out (inactive).  note: however, as expected, i cannot type in the textfield for the deselected radio button.

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; N; Win98; en-US; m14) BuildID:    2000021115  The index page of http://www.tomshardware.com/, the tables render messed up. The cells with the section names (ie: "Mainboard Guide" "CPU Guide") should be up top next to their relative picture and the text should be below them. Instead, Mozilla likes to put the name where the text should go and moves the text accordingly.  The bottom of the page is another disaster: Mozilla looks like it's trying to wrap the ordered lists to the gray table on the right, and overlaps the text between table cells.   Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.Just visit the page (http://www.tomshardware.com)   Actual Results:  Doesn't apply  Expected Results:  Doesn't apply  This has been going on since i started using Mozilla (M13), and thought i'd let it go thinking the HTML engine still had bugs to work out.

description: Trying to use win32 M14 on W2K  When I execute mozilla.exe for the first time, the splash screen is displayed  and I get the following error message three times:  The procedure entry point ??_U@YAPAXI@Z could not be found in the dynamic link  library MSVCRT.DLL.  If I click on OK each of the three times, than a small window opens in the top  left of the screen that's an empty title bar and the three  minimize/maximize/close window widgets.  Resizing this window only produces a  window display what was originally underneath it.  I erased the mozilla registry, redownloaded the binaries, but nothing helped.   If I run "mozilla -installer" form the command line I get the the three error  messages, than the spash screen won't go away and no little feckless window  appears.  Screenshots available upon request.

description: Steps to reproduce: 1. Click on the textbox on http://slashdot.org/search.pl 2. Click on a blank area on the page (optional) 3. Click drag on a link, right click on a link, or pull down a pulldown menu  Results: textbox flickers.  Another way to reproduce this is to start downloading a nightly build from  http://www.mozilla.org/ and click on one of the read-only textboxes (perhaps  with the intent to copy text from it).  The textbox will flicker each time the  progress bar updates.  If you click on both textboxes, both will flicker.

description: Under M14 build 2000022820 (Win NT Service Pack 5), I entered, by accident, an invalid address in the address bar.  An alert message popped up (normal)... But after clicking on OK, Mozilla does not come back to the navigator instead, it activates (or gives focus to) another window/task active in my task bar.  If the task is miminized it will stay that way except that you can see that mozilla has lost focus (ie gray title bar, above the menu bar). If the task is hidden by mozilla's window (ie task is not minimized) it will appear (get focus).  I was able reproduced this bug any time, by using fake addresses such as wwww.8888.u etc...
my_mothod: Under M14 build 2000022820 (Win NT Service Pack 5), I entered, by accident, an invalid address in the address bar.  An alert message popped up (normal)... But after clicking on OK, Mozilla does not come back to the navigator instead, it activates (or gives focus to) another window/task active in my task bar.  If the task is miminized it will stay that way except that you can see that mozilla has lost focus (ie gray title bar, above the menu bar). If the task is hidden by mozilla's window (ie task is not minimized) it will appear (get focus).  I was able reproduced this bug any time, by using fake addresses such as wwww.8888.u etc... Invalid Task Focus when returning from an invalid address alert minor General SeaMonkey

description: To avoid filing duplicates i searched bugzilla for new, reopened, verified, fixed and unverified bugs. Got around 3600 hits. (Resulting page loaded in 5 minutes) Now: Searching with "find on page" got slower and slower - to find the next occurance of a word mentioned twice in one sentence took around 15 seconds when i was half way down the page. Almost like it searched the whole page from start all over again each time the "find" button was clicked. In effect it's so slow it's useless. I can read the page myself, faster than the searchtool can. Build ID: 2000031318

description:
This is a beta1 regression. The dialog we use in IM to add buddies is no longer displaying the checkbox HTML that we poke into the window from which the user can select the groups to which the buddy is to be added. It is a known problem in both the tip and beta 1 branch of commercial. I have produced a test case that lets you play with this without using IM. The test case is attached. Place these files in dist/bin/res/aim and then load resource:/res/aim/foo.xul from the URL bar in order to activate the test case. Interestingly, poking

Hello World!

works. The html input that we are poking however does not, and that is the case that we need to address. You can experiment with this by changing the onload handler in the XUL file from CreateList() to CreateContent()
my_mothod:

Place these files in dist/bin/res/aim and then load resource:/res/aim/foo.xul from the URL bar in order to activate the test case. Interestingly, poking

works. The html input that we are poking however does not, and that is the case that we need to address. You can experiment with this by changing the onload handler in the XUL file from CreateList() to CreateContent() document.write doesn't work for html input blocker DOM: Core & HTML Core

description: Images in scollbarbuttons are not centered, so if something causes the scroll bar buttons to be bigger than the image they contain, the image will look  off-center. You can see this here:     http://www.bath.ac.uk/%7Epy8ieh/internet/projects/mozilla/widgets/15.html  ...at the moment.  I am no XUL expert, but I think that adding:           <xul:spring flex="1"/>  ...either side of the <xul:image inherits="src"/> line should do the trick. This is what has already been done so that the image on the thumb is  centered correctly. Thus I submit that the following would be a better binding  for "scrollbar" in xulBindings.xml:    <binding name="scrollbar">     <content>       <xul:scrollbarbutton type="decrement">          <xul:spring flex="1"/>          <xul:image inherits="src"/>          <xul:spring flex="1"/>       </xul:scrollbarbutton>       <xul:slider flex="1" inherits="curpos,maxpos,pageincrement,increment">          <xul:thumb inherits="align,src" flex="1"/>       </xul:slider>       <xul:scrollbarbutton type="increment">          <xul:spring flex="1"/>          <xul:image inherits="src"/>          <xul:spring flex="1"/>       </xul:scrollbarbutton>     </content>   </binding>  hyatt: I'm assigning this direct to you since you created that code.
my_mothod: Images in scollbarbuttons are not centered, so if something causes the scroll bar buttons to be bigger than the image they contain, the image will look  off-center. You can see this here:     http://www.bath.ac.uk/%7Epy8ieh/internet/projects/mozilla/widgets/15.html  ...at the moment.  I am no XUL expert, but I think that adding:           <xul:spring flex="1"/>  ...either side of the <xul:image inherits="src"/> line should do the trick. This is what has already been done so that the image on the thumb is  centered correctly. Thus I submit that the following would be a better binding  for "scrollbar" in xulBindings.xml:    <binding name="scrollbar">     <content>       <xul:scrollbarbutton type="decrement">          <xul:spring flex="1"/>          <xul:image inherits="src"/>          <xul:spring flex="1"/>       </xul:scrollbarbutton>       <xul:slider flex="1" inherits="curpos,maxpos,pageincrement,increment">          <xul:thumb inherits="align,src" flex="1"/>       </xul:slider>       <xul:scrollbarbutton type="increment">          <xul:spring flex="1"/>          <xul:image inherits="src"/>          <xul:spring flex="1"/>       </xul:scrollbarbutton>     </content>   </binding>  hyatt: I'm assigning this direct to you since you created that code. images in scrollbarbutton are not centered minor XUL Core

description: BuildID: 2000.03.14.16  As a result of said BrowserAppCore not loading (or the instigator of that problem as the case may be), the browser fails to initialize and go to web pages from typed-in urls.  The only other notable message would be "*** Failed to load overlay chrome://navigator/content/NavSecurityOverlay.xul" but there may be no relation.  Although typing URLs into the url bar may not work, clicking on the "mozilla.org" and other buttons on the web browser do.  Clicking links on these web pages brings up a new web browser window, but their url bar suffers the same unresponsiveness and their links bring up yet more windows (rather than loading in the current one) or crash Mozilla.  Also of note: The "Mozilla" box/logo is slightly out of place/does not refresh properly.  This problem should be easily repeatable.
my_mothod: BuildID: 2000.03.14.16  As a result of said BrowserAppCore not loading (or the instigator of that problem as the case may be), the browser fails to initialize and go to web pages from typed-in urls. Although typing URLs into the url bar may not work, clicking on the "mozilla.org" and other buttons on the web browser do.  Clicking links on these web pages brings up a new web browser window, but their url bar suffers the same unresponsiveness and their links bring up yet more windows (rather than loading in the current one) or crash Mozilla.  Also of note: The "Mozilla" box/logo is slightly out of place/does not refresh properly.  This problem should be easily repeatable. BrowserAppCore does not load blocker General SeaMonkey

description: * TITLE/SUMMARY Drag-selecting can leave selection marks on JumpTravel page  (split out of 13912)  * STEPS TO REPRODUCE 0) Launch Apprunner 1) Resize the height of your window so that you can scroll vertically. 2) Starting your selection at the top of the page, select downwards until you need to scroll. 3) Move your mouse upwards to where you started the selection.  * RESULT  - What happened  A 4 pixel wide selection will be left on the page, one space to the right of one of the headers (e.g. "What's New?", "Travel Time", etc.  (This isn't 100% reproducible, but it's trivial to reproduce within 2 minutes. If you're having any problems, let me know, and I'll show you.)   - What was expected  Unselecting text should completely remove selection marks.  * REGRESSION   - Occurs On         Mac OS, Win32 & Linux (3.15.00 AM optimized commercial beta branch build)		  * CONFIGURATIONS TESTED  - [Mac] Beige Power Mac G3 (266 MHz PowerPC 750), 96 MB RAM (VM on; 1 MB of VM used), 1024x768 (Thousands of Colors), Mac OS 8.6  - [Win32] Vectra VL (233 MHz P2), 96 MB RAM, 800x600 (True Color), NT 4.0 SP5.  - [Linux] Vectra VL (266 MHz P2), 96 MB RAM. Red Hat Linux 6.0 (GNOME).

If you're having any problems, let me know, and I'll show you.)   - What was expected  Unselecting text should completely remove selection marks.  * REGRESSION   - Occurs On         Mac OS, Win32 & Linux (3.15.00 AM optimized commercial beta branch build)		  * CONFIGURATIONS TESTED  - [Mac] Beige Power Mac G3 (266 MHz PowerPC 750), 96 MB RAM (VM on; 1 MB of VM used), 1024x768 (Thousands of Colors), Mac OS 8.6  - [Win32] Vectra VL (233 MHz P2), 96 MB RAM, 800x600 (True Color), NT 4.0 SP5.  - [Linux] Vectra VL (266 MHz P2), 96 MB RAM. Red Hat Linux 6.0 (GNOME). Drag-selecting can leave selection marks on JumpTravel page major DOM: Selection Core

description: Build: 2000031509, MacOS 8.6  To reproduce: * Start the profile manager. * Look at the menu bar.  What you see: * Nothing.  What you should see: * A fully functional Apple menu. * A File menu with functional `Quit' item. * An Edit menu with disabled `Undo' and `Redo' items, followed by a separator,   followed by functional `Cut', `Copy', `Paste', and `Select All' items. * A fully functional Help menu. * The rest of the stuff that normally appears at the right of the menu bar   (clock, application menu, etc).  This could be just a dup of bug 21296; but if it is, then I want to know why the  profile manager is being an app-modal dialog when there aren't any other Mozilla  windows open to be app-modal from.
my_mothod: Build: 2000031509, MacOS 8.6  To reproduce: * Start the profile manager. * Look at the menu bar.  What you see: * Nothing.  What you should see: * A fully functional Apple menu. * A File menu with functional `Quit' item. * An Edit menu with disabled `Undo' and `Redo' items, followed by a separator,   followed by functional `Cut', `Copy', `Paste', and `Select All' items. * A fully functional Help menu. * The rest of the stuff that normally appears at the right of the menu bar   (clock, application menu, etc).  This could be just a dup of bug 21296; but if it is, then I want to know why the  profile manager is being an app-modal dialog when there aren't any other Mozilla  windows open to be app-modal from. MacOS 8/9 - menus not available in profile manager minor Startup & Profiles SeaMonkey

description: Overview Description:  Some text in the "Create Profile" assistant is clipped on the right-hand side.  Steps to Reproduce:  1) Remove the file "Mozilla Registry" from the Preferences folder (out of  interest, is there an easier way to launch "Create Profile"? :-)  2) Start Mozilla.  Expected Results:  "Create Profile" assistant started. All text is clearly visible.  Actual Results:  "Create Profile" assistant started. Some of the text is clipped on the right-hand  side and cannot be read.  Build Date & Platform:  2000031509 on Mac OS 8.6  Addition Builds and Platforms:  Does NOT occur on 2000031516 on Win NT 4.  Additional Information:  I usually have Adobe Type Manager Deluxe 4 running and wondered if this might be  causing the problem. I restarted with it off and the clipping still occurred  although this time the text was oblique!

description: This is about as good a spot as I can find to mention this.. On the second  bullet of the "ways a bug can become confirmed" on the page discussing what the  unconfirmed state is about, it says:  The bug gathers a certain number of votes. Any valid Bugzilla user may vote for  bugs (each user gets a certain number of bugs); any UNCONFIRMED bug which enough  bugs becomes automatically confirmed, and enters the NEW state.  I imagine it should say something to the effect of:  The bug gathers a certain number of votes. Any valid Bugzilla user may vote for  bugs (each user gets a certain number of bugs); any UNCONFIRMED bug which  gets enough votes becomes automatically confirmed, and enters the NEW state.

13207:./mozilla-bin: rld: Warning: Version Search Suppressed in ./mozilla-bin Because Object libgtk-1.2.so in liblist has non-sgi interface version (0.0) 13207:./mozilla-bin: rld: Fatal Error: Cannot description: In talking to people this looks to be a win95 specific bug not win98 or NT...  Mozilla daily builds on 3/15/00 and 3/16/00 won't start.  Splash screen comes up  then disappears.  No error message .... nothing   The 3/14/00 build did not have this problem.   Yes, I deleted the mozilla registry files and the users50 directory.  When running mozilla with -console I get this ====== stdout directed to dynamic console Profile Manager : Profile Wizard and Manager activites : Begin Profile Manager : Command Line Options : Begin Entered MigrateProfileInfo. Profile Manager : Command Line Options : End ************************************************** nsNativeComponentLoader:  GetFactory(D:\NET_TOOLS\MOZILLA\BIN\components\necko.dll) Load FAILED with  error: error 0 ************************************************** ~nsProfile  =============================  Please tell me you are still supporting win95, some in #mozilla said that was  not the case.

description: To reproduce: 1. Go to the page specified by this bug's URL (http://www.spe.sony.com/movies/timecode/trailer.html). 2. Right mouse click on "hi res trailer" link. 3. Choose Save Link As... from the context menu.  Crashes.  This is another flavor of the problem reported in bug 23690.  My fix for that bug filtered the problem-causing context menu choices for javascript URLs but I didn't catch alternative spellings.  Further investigation reveals that a better fail-safe fix is to avoid the crash within the JS protocol handler.  Here's a patch that does that:  Index: nsJSProtocolHandler.cpp =================================================================== RCS file: /cvsroot/mozilla/dom/src/jsurl/nsJSProtocolHandler.cpp,v retrieving revision 1.38 diff -r1.38 nsJSProtocolHandler.cpp 200a201 >     NS_ENSURE_ARG_POINTER(notificationCallbacks);  This problem exists on the tip and the beta1 branch.  I will be applying that fix on the tip.  I'm marking the bug beta1 so we can assess whether it's PDT+ (and should be fixed on the beta1 branch).  Note that the fix is about as low-risk as you can get (simply returns an error when presented a null pointer rather than immediately turn around and try to dereference that pointer).
my_mothod: To reproduce: 1. Go to the page specified by this bug's URL (http://www.spe.sony.com/movies/timecode/trailer.html). 2. Right mouse click on "hi res trailer" link. 3. Choose Save Link As... from the context menu.  Crashes.  This is another flavor of the problem reported in bug 23690.  My fix for that bug filtered the problem-causing context menu choices for javascript URLs but I didn't catch alternative spellings.  Further investigation reveals that a better fail-safe fix is to avoid the crash within the JS protocol handler.  Here's a patch that does that:  Index: nsJSProtocolHandler.cpp =================================================================== RCS file: /cvsroot/mozilla/dom/src/jsurl/nsJSProtocolHandler.cpp,v retrieving revision 1.38 diff -r1.38 nsJSProtocolHandler.cpp 200a201 >     NS_ENSURE_ARG_POINTER(notificationCallbacks);  This problem exists on the tip and the beta1 branch.  I will be applying that fix on the tip.  I'm marking the bug beta1 so we can assess whether it's PDT+ (and should be fixed on the beta1 branch).  Note that the fix is about as low-risk as you can get (simply returns an error when presented a null pointer rather than immediately turn around and try to dereference that pointer). Crash attempting to save Javscript: url critical DOM: Core & HTML Core

description: If you select "Open link in new window" for a mailto link such as  this@fake.email.address.org , a blank mozilla window opens, followed by a  composer (e-mail) window.  This is kinda pointless, so I think the menu item  should be removed.  Other fun items on context menus for mailto links: - "Edit link in composer" opens both editor (blank) and composer. - "Save link as" opens a download window with some information "missing" in a  weird way.  "#1K of #2K bytes..."  See also bug 32356, "copy link location" should be changed for mailto links.

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 4.01; Windows 98) BuildID:    N/A  On US keyboards, the @ sign is Shift+3 if I recall right... now, on German  keyboards, it's ALT+Q, but this shortcut pops up a menu in Mozilla, so German  users can't create the @ sign... easy to fix, but hard to live with, I'd say.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Aim at creating an @ sign. 2. Press ALT+Q 3. Scream as the menu pops up.  Actual Results:  I screamed, hit my monitor with a baseball bat and cursed  about the imperialistic USA.  Expected Results:  Created an @ sign in the text.  Many people here in Austria/Germany/Switzerland are sick of the MS Internet  Exploder, and we all looked forward to get Mozilla.. but this bug makes it  almost impossible to use the browser correctly.. please fix this!

Many people here in Austria/Germany/Switzerland are sick of the MS Internet  Exploder, and we all looked forward to get Mozilla.. but this bug makes it  almost impossible to use the browser correctly.. please fix this! description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/4.7 [en] (Win95; U) BuildID:    2000032011  Currently, the QA | Bug Template menu item points to the old bug template, not  Bugzilla Helper. Bugs submitted using Bugzilla Helper are far, far easier to  deal with than those where people freewheel or use the template. It would be  great to have a "Report A Bug" option at the very top of the QA menu which took  people straight to the Helper.   I'm setting this as Major, because it will be a major improvement in the lives  of the bug pre-screeners if it gets done, and it's a trivial fix :-)  While you are there, can you please change the text "Bug Writing" to "Bug  Writing Guidelines" in the QA menu. You could even add "Report A Bug" to the  default bookmarks...

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; N; Win98; en-US; m14) BuildID:    2000032105  After right-clicking on the URL bar, any further click/drag with the left mouse button has no effect.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Right-click on the URL bar. 2. Left-click on the URL bar. 3. Attempt to reposition the cursor or select text by left-clicking/dragging in the URL bar.   Actual Results:  The cursor disappears, and cannot be repositioned by clicking. Text can also not be selected by dragging. Keyboard input still works, with the actual position of the cursor being the last visible cursor position. Selection, cursor movement, copy and paste work with the keyboard, although the cursor and any highlighting are invisible. After clicking on the page area, URL bar behavior returns to normal. Clicking on other browser widgets does not return URL bar behavior to normal.  Expected Results:  Left-clicking should reposition the cursor. Left-dragging should select text. I have no idea what right clicking should do, but I don't think it should do what it does.
my_mothod: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; N; Win98; en-US; m14) BuildID:    2000032105  After right-clicking on the URL bar, any further click/drag with the left mouse button has no effect. description: Build ID 2000032109 (I've seen this one before also.) After having toggled the location, of bookmarks with "bookmarks" - "edit bookmars", and then closed the bookmark editor, there's a 4 to 5 minute delay, and then the "D&D" animation (sheet of paper, slightly tilted) reappears and animates up and down on the webpage you're on.  TO reproduce: Go to a webpage with good contrast - like todays reported bugs in bugzilla. Open bookmarks editor (Bookmarks/Manage bookmarks) Drag and drop bookmarks around, some 5-10 times to get a nice effect of this. Just shuffle around, up and down, move it.  Then sit back and *wait*. I'm on a P120 and after 4 minutes 45 seconds i get a "replay" of the bookmark animations - silently sailing up and down and dropping into oblivion somewhere in the browser, echoing the movements i did some 5 minutes earlyer. Kinda cute...but quite bug'ish. A timer gone astray?

description: * TITLE/SUMMARY Users can paste a tab character into single-line text fields  (Thanks to Matthew Thomas for noting this on the n.p.m. newsgroups)  * STEPS TO REPRODUCE 0) Launch Seamonkey 1) Launch a text editor, press the tab key, and copy it. 2) Launch Seamonkey, select the URL field, and choose paste the clipboard.  * RESULT  - What happened  The tab is pasted into single-line text field, even though users wouldn't have been allowed to enter a tab character by pressing the tab key.   - What was expected  Matthew suggests that the tab character shouldn't be allowed into a single-line text field by paste if it isn't allowed by actual typing.  I don't feel strongly either way --- we can't enter the tab character because it's used for selecting fields. Unless there are adverse effects to placing a tab character into the URL field, what end-user impact occurs from being able to paste it there?  I don't think we should be stripping tabs out of multi-line pastes --- people may wish to copy tab-formatted text into a multi-line text field, such as this bug report. ;)  So, I defer to y'all to duke it out, and I'll happily verify whatever resolution y'all like.  * REGRESSION   - Occurs On         Mac OS, Win32, Linux Seamonkey (3.22.00 AM beta 1 commercial optimized build)		   - Doesn't Occur On 		Communicator 4.72 RTM (Mac OS)    * CONFIGURATIONS TESTED  - [Mac] Beige Power Mac G3 (266 MHz PowerPC 750), 96 MB RAM (VM on; 1 MB of VM used), 1024x768 (Thousands of Colors), Mac OS 8.6  - [Win32] Vectra VL (233 MHz P2), 96 MB RAM, 800x600 (True Color), NT 4.0 SP5.  - [Linux] Vectra VL (266 MHz P2), 96 MB RAM. Red Hat Linux 6.0 (GNOME).

I don't feel strongly either way --- we can't enter the tab character because it's used for selecting fields. Unless there are adverse effects to placing a tab character into the URL field, what end-user impact occurs from being able to paste it there?  I don't think we should be stripping tabs out of multi-line pastes --- people may wish to copy tab-formatted text into a multi-line text field, such as this bug report. ;)  So, I defer to y'all to duke it out, and I'll happily verify whatever resolution y'all like.  * REGRESSION   - Occurs On         Mac OS, Win32, Linux Seamonkey (3.22.00 AM beta 1 commercial optimized build)		   - Doesn't Occur On 		Communicator 4.72 RTM (Mac OS)    * CONFIGURATIONS TESTED  - [Mac] Beige Power Mac G3 (266 MHz PowerPC 750), 96 MB RAM (VM on; 1 MB of VM used), 1024x768 (Thousands of Colors), Mac OS 8.6  - [Win32] Vectra VL (233 MHz P2), 96 MB RAM, 800x600 (True Color), NT 4.0 SP5.  - [Linux] Vectra VL (266 MHz P2), 96 MB RAM. description: If you click the stop button while loading a page, the stop button stays lit  (like mouseover) when you move the mouse away.  But, if you alt-tab to another  application that covers the stop button and then alt-tab back to mozilla, the  stop button (or even part of the stop button!) is in the expected disabled  state.  Be sure to make this correctly work on all types of URLs (see the reopened bug  29952)  This bug is not the same as bug 12897 :)

description: The gecko icon on Win32 seems to blend in with the background when you use a background setting of no wallpaper and use the default color.  You can duplicate this by doing the following: 1. Create a Mozilla icon on the desktop. 2. Turn off all wallpaper images. 3. Right click on the desktop and choose Properties 4. Choose the Appearance Tab. 5. Choose Desktop under the Items combo box. 6. On the color combo box to the right of the Items combo box, choose the last color on the right of the third row of color boxes. 7. Click OK  All you will see is to pixels (the gecko's eyes) instead of the whole icon. There should be a colored border around the gecko that sets it off from the transparent background.

Click OK  All you will see is to pixels (the gecko's eyes) instead of the whole icon. There should be a colored border around the gecko that sets it off from the transparent background. Win32 Icon blends with background minor UI Design SeaMonkey

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; N; Linux 2.2.12-20 i686; en-US; m14) BuildID:    2000032409  Scrolling down a page with the cursor keys stops if the mouse cursor happens to pass over a textarea form element.  Reproducible: Sometimes Steps to Reproduce: 1. Move the mouse pointer to middle of browser window, so it will pass over a textarea. 2. Using the down-arrow key, scroll down the page as far as possible (i.e. until it enters the textarea). 3. Attempt to scroll up or down.   Actual Results:  As soon as the mouse cursor entered the textarea, scrolling via the keyboard stopped working.  If the mouse is moved away from the textarea, keyboard scrolling works again; if it's placed in the textarea again, scrolling stops.  Expected Results:  Scrolling should continue, ignoring the positions of the mouse pointsr and form elements.  This happens about 90% of the time.  It appears, although I can't confirm this 100%, that if the mouse pointer changes shape at any time before scrolling with the keyboard (e.g. to the I-bar, as it does when selecting text) the problem does not occur.

When $j equals to 25 (at $i=256) then mozilla grows to about 48MB. Increasing $j to ie. 255 causes mozilla to exhaust system memory (if limits are unlimited of course). The same thing is with netscape. I know about this bug from my friend Robert Kurowski. --------------------------------------- #!/usr/bin/perl $j=256; print < JavaScript Test

OK!

END ------------------------------------- Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: Look at description field. Actual Results: Memory system exhausted. Expected Results: Show "OK" string.
