Looks like this is tague's line. Typo in nsLocaleTest.cpp function (SERIVCE -> SERVICE) trivial Localization Core

description: Build ID: 2000062608  In the bookmarks tab of the sidebar, you can click plain white space (without  selecting an item) and drag and a drag session will be initiated.  Similarly,  you can select an item and then just starting from pretty much anywhere else in  the tree and the drag still starts.  The same holds true for the tree in the  Manage Bookmarks window.  We need to ensure that the drag is actually  initiating from the item itself that's being dragged. I don't know if this is  specific to bookmarks, or rather the general tree dragging code that seems to  be reused in various places.
my_mothod: Build ID: 2000062608  In the bookmarks tab of the sidebar, you can click plain white space (without  selecting an item) and drag and a drag session will be initiated.  Similarly,  you can select an item and then just starting from pretty much anywhere else in  the tree and the drag still starts.  The same holds true for the tree in the  Manage Bookmarks window.  We need to ensure that the drag is actually  initiating from the item itself that's being dragged. I don't know if this is  specific to bookmarks, or rather the general tree dragging code that seems to  be reused in various places. Need to check where drag initiates in bookmarks tree minor Bookmarks & History SeaMonkey

description: BuildID:    2000062808  When the style of a dropdown list is changed, the first item in the list is highlighted.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Load the Viewer Demo #16 2. Notice that the bottom left dropdown list has item 3 selected. 3. Change the style using one of the style buttons provided. 4. Drop down the bottom left dropdown list.  Actual Results:  Although item 3 is selected, item 1 is also highlighted.  Expected Results:  Only item 3 should be highlighted.
my_mothod: BuildID:    2000062808  When the style of a dropdown list is changed, the first item in the list is highlighted.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Load the Viewer Demo #16 2. Notice that the bottom left dropdown list has item 3 selected. 3. Change the style using one of the style buttons provided. 4. Drop down the bottom left dropdown list.  Actual Results:  Although item 3 is selected, item 1 is also highlighted.  Expected Results:  Only item 3 should be highlighted. [WFM][CBX]Extra highlight in dropdown box when style changed trivial Layout: Form Controls Core

description: When you try to resolve a bug as a duplicate of a non-existant bug number, you get the error message:  "You must specify a bug number of which this bug is a duplicate.  The bug has not been changed."  This second sentence really applies to any message in a big red box.  I suggest it should be either removed entirely, or placed after every red box error message.  Possibly outside of the red box, since it sounds a little confusing taken together with the error (does "the bug mean the bug number you typed in?")
my_mothod: When you try to resolve a bug as a duplicate of a non-existant bug number, you get the error message:  "You must specify a bug number of which this bug is a duplicate.  The bug has not been changed."  This second sentence really applies to any message in a big red box.  I suggest it should be either removed entirely, or placed after every red box error message.  Possibly outside of the red box, since it sounds a little confusing taken together with the error (does "the bug mean the bug number you typed in?") Sentence appears inconsistently. trivial User Interface Bugzilla

description: All popup windows and many places in menus have square boxes instead of us-ascii letters. url window letters change to square boxes at randome times. My quess is that mozilla selects iso10646 fonts for display that appear first because this is default X sorting order and than fails to properly use them because these are double-byte fonts. my_mothod: All popup windows and many places in menus have square boxes instead of us-ascii letters. url window letters change to square boxes at randome times. My quess is that mozilla selects iso10646 fonts for display that appear first because this is default X sorting order and than fails to properly use them because these are double-byte fonts.  I use XFree 4.01 with xfsft font server. description: Using july31 m17 commercial build  Related bugs:  bug 40380 (Date criteria), bug 40500 (Age in Days)  I'm logging this bug to document this behavior in light of recent decisions to future unimplemented filter criteria and leave them sitting as choices in the criteria dropdown.  Note: we haven't (yet) futured fixing the Date choice, but Age in Days has been futured.   If you've migrated a filter from 4.x which specifies unimplemented/invalid criteria for 6.0, you cannot edit it to use a different criteria. You must create a new filter instead.  If you create a new filter in 6.0 using an unimplemented criteria type, when you  go to edit the filter, the filter rules shows no criteria line at all. You must click More to get the default line.    1.  In 4.x set up a simple one line date filter for POP or IMAP.     Example criteria: date, Is , <choose a date> 2.  Exit 4.x and migrate the profile to 6.0 3.  In 6.0 go to mail window, Edit|Message Filters. Select the migrated date filter and click Edit. 4.  (Note the criteria is messed up in the ui, that was mentioned in bug 40380) 5.  Change the criteria type to Subject or Sender, Contains, <type some text>.     Confirm OK from the filter rules dialog. 6.  Select the filter and click Edit.  Notice the filter ui has returned to its original invalid state:  Date,Contains,<blank>.  Result:  Edit behavior is awful on filters ever having unimplemented/invalid criteria choices.  Changes are not kept, criteria may show a mixed up operators choice list, or edit rules dialog may show no criteria lines at all.   In each case, the effective workaround is to create a brand new filter. This may  Expected:  Even though we don't support certain criteria choices, it should not affect the ui's ability to edit a filter. I should be able to change criteria to valid choices and have the changes saved in ui and to file.  Note: there are many combinations here, many giving different but all weird results.
my_mothod: Using july31 m17 commercial build  Related bugs:  bug 40380 (Date criteria), bug 40500 (Age in Days)  I'm logging this bug to document this behavior in light of recent decisions to future unimplemented filter criteria and leave them sitting as choices in the criteria dropdown.  Note: we haven't (yet) futured fixing the Date choice, but Age in Days has been futured.   If you've migrated a filter from 4.x which specifies unimplemented/invalid criteria for 6.0, you cannot edit it to use a different criteria. You must create a new filter instead.  If you create a new filter in 6.0 using an unimplemented criteria type, when you  go to edit the filter, the filter rules shows no criteria line at all. You must click More to get the default line.    1.  In 4.x set up a simple one line date filter for POP or IMAP.     Example criteria: date, Is , <choose a date> 2.  Exit 4.x and migrate the profile to 6.0 3.  In 6.0 go to mail window, Edit|Message Filters. Select the migrated date filter and click Edit. 4.  (Note the criteria is messed up in the ui, that was mentioned in bug 40380) 5.  Change the criteria type to Subject or Sender, Contains, <type some text>.     Confirm OK from the filter rules dialog. 6.  Select the filter and click Edit.  Notice the filter ui has returned to its original invalid state:  Date,Contains,<blank>.  Result:  Edit behavior is awful on filters ever having unimplemented/invalid criteria choices.  Changes are not kept, criteria may show a mixed up operators choice list, or edit rules dialog may show no criteria lines at all.   In each case, the effective workaround is to create a brand new filter. This may  Expected:  Even though we don't support certain criteria choices, it should not affect the ui's ability to edit a filter. I should be able to change criteria to valid choices and have the changes saved in ui and to file.  Note: there are many combinations here, many giving different but all weird results. Bad behavior editing filters with unimplemented criteria. minor Filters MailNews Core

description: </> can be used to close SGML tags, and according to the W3C, it can be used to  do so in HTML 4.0 too.  (It is, however, ILLEGAL to do so in XML/XHTML.)  In  other words, <font color="red">this text would be rendered in red</> while this  text wouldn't.  Most web pages don't use this construct, so it's really very trivial, but it is  part of the HTML 4.01 standard.  (A list of features not widely supported,  including this one, is given at this  URL: <http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/appendix/notes.html#sgmlfeatures>.)  I haven't  actually tried some of the other "commonly not supported" SGML features, though.   Unfortunately, they seem to have removed the section that actually explains what  the various things do.  (I'm not sure exactly what <> does - but it has meaning  in SGML.)  Keep in mind that XML was a stricter set of rules than HTML, so that </> is NOT  legal in XML.
my_mothod: </> can be used to close SGML tags, and according to the W3C, it can be used to  do so in HTML 4.0 too.  (It is, however, ILLEGAL to do so in XML/XHTML.)  In  other words, <font color="red">this text would be rendered in red</> while this  text wouldn't.  Most web pages don't use this construct, so it's really very trivial, but it is  part of the HTML 4.01 standard.  (A list of features not widely supported,  including this one, is given at this  URL: <http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/appendix/notes.html#sgmlfeatures>.)  I haven't  actually tried some of the other "commonly not supported" SGML features, though.   Unfortunately, they seem to have removed the section that actually explains what  the various things do.  (I'm not sure exactly what <> does - but it has meaning  in SGML.)  Keep in mind that XML was a stricter set of rules than HTML, so that </> is NOT  legal in XML. </>, <> should close/open the most recently opened tag in HTML trivial DOM: HTML Parser Core

description: There is some dead code in the style system that references an ':out-of-date' pseudo-class, but as far as I can tell the only effect this code has is to slow down the pseudo-class matching code.  This code was checked in during May 1998 by Peter Linss. It has not had any major changes since then.  The following files are affected:    /editor/ui/composer/content/EditorOverride.css    /layout/html/document/src/html.css [I am fixing this file]    /layout/html/style/public/nsCSSAtomList.h    /layout/html/style/src/nsCSSParser.cpp    /layout/html/style/src/nsCSSStyleSheet.cpp [1]  In addition, the following files seem to attempt to demo this pseudo-class:    /htmlparser/tests/logparse/test1.bl    /layout/html/tests/printer/general/test1.html    /webshell/tests/viewer/samples/test1.html  [1]: In particular lines 3037 and 2737, which are called for almost every  pseudo-class that we try to match...  Recommend nsbeta3+ as his seems rather low-risk.
my_mothod: There is some dead code in the style system that references an ':out-of-date' pseudo-class, but as far as I can tell the only effect this code has is to slow down the pseudo-class matching code.  This code was checked in during May 1998 by Peter Linss. It has not had any major changes since then.  The following files are affected:    /editor/ui/composer/content/EditorOverride.css    /layout/html/document/src/html.css [I am fixing this file]    /layout/html/style/public/nsCSSAtomList.h    /layout/html/style/src/nsCSSParser.cpp    /layout/html/style/src/nsCSSStyleSheet.cpp [1]  In addition, the following files seem to attempt to demo this pseudo-class:    /htmlparser/tests/logparse/test1.bl    /layout/html/tests/printer/general/test1.html    /webshell/tests/viewer/samples/test1.html  [1]: In particular lines 3037 and 2737, which are called for almost every  pseudo-class that we try to match...  Recommend nsbeta3+ as his seems rather low-risk. remove the outOfDate (:out-of-date) pseudo-class from the build minor CSS Parsing and Computation Core

description: Backward adapter allowing to run older(4x) plugins in new browser explicitly linked with libXt and libxtgtk - it's bad as loading of Sun's Java VM requires  that some symbols to be used from Motif, not libXt. Really  from nsglsrc/nsPluginsDirUNIX.cpp ______________________________________________________________  nsresult nsPluginFile::LoadPlugin(PRLibrary* &outLibrary) {     PRLibSpec libSpec;     PRLibSpec tempSpec;     PRLibrary * handle;      ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////     // Normally, Mozilla isn't linked against libXt and libXext     // since it's a Gtk/Gdk application.  On the other hand,     // legacy plug-ins expect the libXt and libXext symbols     // to already exist in the global name space.  This plug-in     // wrapper is linked against libXt and libXext, but since     // we never call on any of these libraries, plug-ins still     // fail to resolve Xt symbols when trying to do a dlopen     // at runtime.  Explicitly opening Xt/Xext into the global     // namespace before attempting to load the plug-in seems to     // work fine.  __________________________________________________________________  I.e. it's loaded explicitly anyway. So it's possible simply remove  libXt and libxtgtk dependencies from plugin Makefile.  It's blocker for running Sun's JVM in browser address space and  required to be fixed ASAP.
my_mothod: Backward adapter allowing to run older(4x) plugins in new browser explicitly linked with libXt and libxtgtk - it's bad as loading of Sun's Java VM requires  that some symbols to be used from Motif, not libXt. Really  from nsglsrc/nsPluginsDirUNIX.cpp ______________________________________________________________  nsresult nsPluginFile::LoadPlugin(PRLibrary* &outLibrary) {     PRLibSpec libSpec;     PRLibSpec tempSpec;     PRLibrary * handle;      ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////     // Normally, Mozilla isn't linked against libXt and libXext     // since it's a Gtk/Gdk application.  On the other hand,     // legacy plug-ins expect the libXt and libXext symbols     // to already exist in the global name space.  This plug-in     // wrapper is linked against libXt and libXext, but since     // we never call on any of these libraries, plug-ins still     // fail to resolve Xt symbols when trying to do a dlopen     // at runtime.  Explicitly opening Xt/Xext into the global     // namespace before attempting to load the plug-in seems to     // work fine.  __________________________________________________________________  I.e. it's loaded explicitly anyway. So it's possible simply remove  libXt and libxtgtk dependencies from plugin Makefile.  It's blocker for running Sun's JVM in browser address space and  required to be fixed ASAP. Plugin module explicitly depends on libXt - it doesn't allow to run Sun Java VM in Mozilla process. blocker Plug-ins Core

description: The so-called-element <plaintext> that was deprecated in 1994 is not acting as a container, which means we can't style it, which means that ua.css fails in its attempts to give <plaintext> a monospace font.  See the attachement. There should be three green boxes. The two outermost should be like a double outer border, but due to other bugs are not.  The third, innermost, box should start just after the text "This is before" and end _after_ the text "This is inside...". The text that claims to be inside the <plaintext> element should indeed be inside the <plaintext> element.  Fixing that should make the ua.css rule that sets plaintext to a monospace font  actually work.
my_mothod: The so-called-element <plaintext> that was deprecated in 1994 is not acting as a container, which means we can't style it, which means that ua.css fails in its attempts to give <plaintext> a monospace font.  See the attachement. There should be three green boxes. The two outermost should be like a double outer border, but due to other bugs are not.  The third, innermost, box should start just after the text "This is before" and end _after_ the text "This is inside...". The text that claims to be inside the <plaintext> element should indeed be inside the <plaintext> element.  Fixing that should make the ua.css rule that sets plaintext to a monospace font  actually work. <plaintext> is not acting as a container, doesn't get monospace font trivial DOM: HTML Parser Core

description: ALT key will highlight Menu item for keyboard navigation. For example, on Message Compose window,  1) type ALT key File menu will be highlighted.  2) type DOWN key contents of File menu will be shown  However, the highlight isn't cleared by next key event.  1) type ALT key File menu will be highlighted.  2) type 'a' key Mail Composer does not have 'a' menu, so the highlight should be cleared and 'a' needs to be inserted into input field.  Please try the same operations on notepad on Windows. ALT key also will highlight the File menu, but next 'a' will clear the highlight and 'a' will be inserted.  ALT key is used for ALT+HANKAKU/ZENKAKU to enable/disable IME. So I often meet this problem. Menu highlight grabs the key event.
my_mothod: ALT key will highlight Menu item for keyboard navigation. For example, on Message Compose window,  1) type ALT key File menu will be highlighted.  2) type DOWN key contents of File menu will be shown  However, the highlight isn't cleared by next key event.  1) type ALT key File menu will be highlighted.  2) type 'a' key Mail Composer does not have 'a' menu, so the highlight should be cleared and 'a' needs to be inserted into input field.  Please try the same operations on notepad on Windows. ALT key also will highlight the File menu, but next 'a' will clear the highlight and 'a' will be inserted.  ALT key is used for ALT+HANKAKU/ZENKAKU to enable/disable IME. So I often meet this problem. Menu highlight grabs the key event. Menu highlight by ALT key should be cleared by next key event trivial XUL Core

description: Modern theme clips the right hand side of the Proxies settings Preferences screen, including the Port text boxes, the Port text box highlighting, and the box frame drawn around the Proxies settings.  Classic and Blue themes do not cause clipping of the Proxies dialog.  STEPS TO REPRODUCE: 1) Close Mozilla 2) Delete user settings, as you may have inadvertantly widened the Preferences dialog window, and that new width is stored as part of your user settings (e.g. c:\Documents and Settings\%USERNAME%\Application Data\Mozilla). 3) Start Mozilla 4) Apply Modern theme 5) Open Edit->Preferences... 6) Expand Advanced 7) Click Proxies in the Advanced list 8) Notice clipping of the dialog  I noticed this problem months ago, but I had inadvertantly widened the Preferences dialog box, and that new width had been saved, so I thought the problem had been fixed.  Running at 1024x768x16 on Windows 2000.
my_mothod: Modern theme clips the right hand side of the Proxies settings Preferences screen, including the Port text boxes, the Port text box highlighting, and the box frame drawn around the Proxies settings.  Classic and Blue themes do not cause clipping of the Proxies dialog.  STEPS TO REPRODUCE: 1) Close Mozilla 2) Delete user settings, as you may have inadvertantly widened the Preferences dialog window, and that new width is stored as part of your user settings (e.g. c:\Documents and Settings\%USERNAME%\Application Data\Mozilla). 3) Start Mozilla 4) Apply Modern theme 5) Open Edit->Preferences... 6) Expand Advanced 7) Click Proxies in the Advanced list 8) Notice clipping of the dialog  I noticed this problem months ago, but I had inadvertantly widened the Preferences dialog box, and that new width had been saved, so I thought the problem had been fixed.  Running at 1024x768x16 on Windows 2000. Proxies Settings window clipped in Modern theme trivial Themes SeaMonkey

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux 2.2.15 i686; en-US; m18) Gecko/20001024 BuildID:    2000102408  Drop down history/visted pages widget next to location bar duplicate with http:// in front. So will have eg: http://slashdot.org/index.pl 		 slashdot.org/index.pl   Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: Type into your location bar: slashdot.org/index.pl Wait for page to load with http:// in front of what you typed, then simply click in the location bar and press return (essentially reloading it) Check the drop-down.. and the one address appears twice.. once with 'http://' in front. To me this is a bug...  Actual Results:  Duplication  Expected Results:  Smart checking to ignore the http:// in front .. or to include it as default on all entries.. to differentiate between any other protocols...  I think that if Moz is going to list visited pages that one types into the address bar, then it ought to be smart enough to know which addresses duplicate each other... I see this as just an extension of the check it must currently do.. rather than checking for _exact_ match.. just match the current location _minus_ the http:// with all existing entries. Or to include the http:// in the actual recorded information. Theoretically a very simple 'bug' fix. I'm marking this as a trivial bug.. but still if it is very simple to correct I think it is very important it be done.

To me this is a bug... I think that if Moz is going to list visited pages that one types into the address bar, then it ought to be smart enough to know which addresses duplicate each other... I see this as just an extension of the check it must currently do.. rather than checking for _exact_ match.. just match the current location _minus_ the http:// with all existing entries. Or to include the http:// in the actual recorded information. Theoretically a very simple 'bug' fix. I'm marking this as a trivial bug.. but still if it is very simple to correct I think it is very important it be done. duplication in drop-down history: "stuff" and "http://stuff" trivial Location Bar SeaMonkey

description: When scrolling by page with the keyboard, the vert. scrollbar fails to update its position correctly.  It moves for a bit, then freezes until the scrolling stops.  This appears to be merely a cosmetic error as the actual scrolling of the page works just fine.  Though, it would be nice to see where I am in a document when I'm scrolling.  Easiest way to view this bug: open a large text file in Navigator and hold the pgdn key.  I first noticed this while using the pgup and pgdn keys to scroll a rather lengthly list of "additional comments" for Bug #32148. I have also seen this phenomenon in Messenger's message index paine (it doesn't seem to be a problem in the message body paine - though the issue re-appears if you open a long message in a new window and try to scroll there).  I am currently running Build 2000111404 on Win98SE.  I have tried reproducing this with Communicator 4.76, but there were no problems with the scrollbar there.
my_mothod: When scrolling by page with the keyboard, the vert. scrollbar fails to update its position correctly.  It moves for a bit, then freezes until the scrolling stops.  This appears to be merely a cosmetic error as the actual scrolling of the page works just fine.  Though, it would be nice to see where I am in a document when I'm scrolling.  Easiest way to view this bug: open a large text file in Navigator and hold the pgdn key.  I first noticed this while using the pgup and pgdn keys to scroll a rather lengthly list of "additional comments" for Bug #32148. I have also seen this phenomenon in Messenger's message index paine (it doesn't seem to be a problem in the message body paine - though the issue re-appears if you open a long message in a new window and try to scroll there).  I am currently running Build 2000111404 on Win98SE.  I have tried reproducing this with Communicator 4.76, but there were no problems with the scrollbar there. Vert. Scrollbar fails to update when scrolling fast (pgup/pgdn/spacebar) trivial XUL Core

description: Build: 2000112320, Mac OS 9.0, Classic theme  To reproduce: * Scroll any GFX scrollbar thumb all the way to the top or to the bottom of the   scrollbar channel.  What you should see: * A one-pixel black border between the gray of the arrow button and the blue (or   whatever) of the button button.  What you actually see: * A two-pixel black border between the scrollbar thumb and the arrow button --   one pixel from the thumb, and one pixel from the button.  Don't fix this just by hiding the bottom/top border of the scrollbar button, or  the top/bottom border of the scrollbar thumb, whenever the scrollbar thumb  reaches the end of the channel; that would be treating the symptom rather than  the cause, and would still leave Mozilla's scrollbar channels 2px shorter than  native scrollbar channels of the same size. The correct fix is to include the  bottom/top pixel of the arrow button in the area which the scrollbar thumb can  reach.  So to look at this on its side, here's the difference between the Windows and Mac  OS scrollbars channels (where one character is one pixel):    up button          thumb                            down button  ___________  ____________________                    ___________ /  ---====  \/                    \                  /  ====---  \  (Windows)              1234567890123456789012345678901234567890              |<---------- channel area ------------>|    up button          thumb                             down button ,-----------.------'`'`'`'`------.                   ,-----------. |  ---====  |                    |                   |  ====---  |  (Mac OS)             123456789012345678901234567890123456789012             |<----------- channel area ------------->|  CCing lordpixel, as he mentioned this problem in bug 16277.

What you should see: * A one-pixel black border between the gray of the arrow button and the blue (or   whatever) of the button button.  What you actually see: * A two-pixel black border between the scrollbar thumb and the arrow button --   one pixel from the thumb, and one pixel from the button.  Don't fix this just by hiding the bottom/top border of the scrollbar button, or  the top/bottom border of the scrollbar thumb, whenever the scrollbar thumb  reaches the end of the channel; that would be treating the symptom rather than  the cause, and would still leave Mozilla's scrollbar channels 2px shorter than  native scrollbar channels of the same size. The correct fix is to include the  bottom/top pixel of the arrow button in the area which the scrollbar thumb can  reach.  So to look at this on its side, here's the difference between the Windows and Mac  OS scrollbars channels (where one character is one pixel):    up button          thumb                            down button  ___________  ____________________                    ___________ /  ---====  \/                    \                  /  ====---  \  (Windows)              1234567890123456789012345678901234567890              |<---------- channel area ------------>|    up button          thumb                             down button ,-----------.------'`'`'`'`------.                   ,-----------. |  ---====  |                    |                   |  ====---  |  (Mac OS)             123456789012345678901234567890123456789012             |<----------- channel area ------------->|  CCing lordpixel, as he mentioned this problem in bug 16277. [Classic Mac] Scrollbar thumb can be scrolled 1px less than it should be trivial Themes SeaMonkey

description: The HPUX 11.00 aCC 3.25 compiler has an issue with the explicit keyword when it is used for a contructor that has the class as a paramenter type to the class constructor.  The error is: Error 513: "nsProfileAccess.h", line 37 # 'explicit' may be used only for converting constructors.     explicit ProfileStruct(const ProfileStruct& src);              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^  I have traced it to ccarlen's 1.11 revision to this file and have asked him if we could either remove the 'explicit' keyword or add the  following change/hack (till we get the fix for the compiler).  Index: nsProfileAccess.h ========================================= RCVS file: /cvsroot/mozilla/profile/src/nsProfileAccess.h,v retrieving revision 1.11 diff -c -r1.11 nsProfileAccess.h *** nsProfileAccess.h    2000/11/17  15:01:06      1.11 --- nsProfileAccess.h    2000/11/28  19:32:50 *************** *** 34,40 **** --- 34,47 ----   {   public:         explicit ProfileStruct() { } +  #ifdef HPUX +      /* The HP aCC 3.25 compiler has an 'issue' with explicit +       * in this manner, removing until we get a compiler fix. +       */ +      ProfileStruct(const ProfileStruct& src); +  #else        explicit ProfileStruct(const ProfileStruct& src); +  #endif /* HPUX */         ~ProfileStruct() { }
my_mothod: The HPUX 11.00 aCC 3.25 compiler has an issue with the explicit keyword when it is used for a contructor that has the class as a paramenter type to the class constructor.  The error is: Error 513: "nsProfileAccess.h", line 37 # 'explicit' may be used only for converting constructors.     explicit ProfileStruct(const ProfileStruct& src);              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^  I have traced it to ccarlen's 1.11 revision to this file and have asked him if we could either remove the 'explicit' keyword or add the  following change/hack (till we get the fix for the compiler).  Index: nsProfileAccess.h ========================================= RCVS file: /cvsroot/mozilla/profile/src/nsProfileAccess.h,v retrieving revision 1.11 diff -c -r1.11 nsProfileAccess.h *** nsProfileAccess.h    2000/11/17  15:01:06      1.11 --- nsProfileAccess.h    2000/11/28  19:32:50 *************** *** 34,40 **** --- 34,47 ----   {   public:         explicit ProfileStruct() { } +  #ifdef HPUX +      /* The HP aCC 3.25 compiler has an 'issue' with explicit +       * in this manner, removing until we get a compiler fix. +       */ +      ProfileStruct(const ProfileStruct& src); +  #else        explicit ProfileStruct(const ProfileStruct& src); +  #endif /* HPUX */         ~ProfileStruct() { } Trunk Build error in profile/src/nsProfileAccess.h blocker General SeaMonkey

description: bug_email.pl is case sensitive to e-mail addresses, while the rest of Bugzilla is not.  When a user attempts to submit a bug from "user@domain.tld", and their Bugzilla account is "User@domain.tld", they are rejected by the mailinterface. If one attempts to change the username in the Users screen to "user@domain.tld", one is informed that the username already exists.  The User maintenance page is not case-sensitive. bug_email.pl is case-sensitive. The Login screen is not case-sensitive. Reassigning bugs is not case-sensitive.  Workaround: To change "User@domain.tld" to "user@domain.tld", one must first change it to some intermediate name, for instance, "user2@domain.tld", then change it to "user@domain.tld".  This will allow that user to submit bugs via bug_email.pl as well as the web interface.  Two tasks: Fix bug_email.pl to no longer be case-sensitive. Fix editusers.cgi to check for simple case changes.  If you are changing nothing but the case of a username, allow the change.  Alternately, simply always lowercase names, but do not *require* lowercase names from the database.
my_mothod: bug_email.pl is case sensitive to e-mail addresses, while the rest of Bugzilla is not.  When a user attempts to submit a bug from "user@domain.tld", and their Bugzilla account is "User@domain.tld", they are rejected by the mailinterface. If one attempts to change the username in the Users screen to "user@domain.tld", one is informed that the username already exists.  The User maintenance page is not case-sensitive. bug_email.pl is case-sensitive. The Login screen is not case-sensitive. Reassigning bugs is not case-sensitive.  Workaround: To change "User@domain.tld" to "user@domain.tld", one must first change it to some intermediate name, for instance, "user2@domain.tld", then change it to "user@domain.tld".  This will allow that user to submit bugs via bug_email.pl as well as the web interface.  Two tasks: Fix bug_email.pl to no longer be case-sensitive. Fix editusers.cgi to check for simple case changes.  If you are changing nothing but the case of a username, allow the change.  Alternately, simply always lowercase names, but do not *require* lowercase names from the database. bug_email.pl case sensitivity trivial Bugzilla-General Bugzilla

It's only when hovering it over the the start of the end of the textfield. description: If you change the Capitalisation of a compenent name in bugzilla 2.10 running under linux 2.2.14 and MySQL 3.22.32 you get an sql error soemthing along the lines of   SELECT profiles.userid, profiles.groupset, profiles.login_name, profiles.login_name = 'xxxx@yyyy.com' AND profiles.cryptpassword = logincookies.cryptpassword AND logincookies.hostname = '127.0.0.1', profiles.disabledtext FROM profiles, logincookies WHERE logincookies.cookie = '2' AND profiles.userid = logincookies.userid: Table 'profiles' was not locked with LOCK TABLES at globals.pl line 133.   This only occures if all you change is capitalisation, and not if you actualy change the name, the best work arround therefore being, if you want to change AAA to aaa first change to aaaa, then to aaa.

This only occures if all you change is capitalisation, and not if you actualy change the name, the best work arround therefore being, if you want to change AAA to aaa first change to aaaa, then to aaa. Tables unlocked too late when altering case of component name minor Administration Bugzilla

description: With Mozilla 20001231 on Windows 95, the trailing flashing vertical bar "|" is one pixel ahead of the text being typed in the URL location field and in HTML textarea fields. For better viewability, it'b better to have Netscape 4.x-like behaviour with the trailing vertical bar 1 pixel behind the current character/letter (this way, it avoids the last character being in video inverse when the bar is flashing).  I really dislike this behavious especially with the URL Location field, it makes me feel I don't read URLs as well as with Netscape 4.x. I believe this is simple to fix but also hope people prefer this "old" behaviour.  I hope this is the correct component and not a duplicate.
my_mothod: With Mozilla 20001231 on Windows 95, the trailing flashing vertical bar "|" is one pixel ahead of the text being typed in the URL location field and in HTML textarea fields. For better viewability, it'b better to have Netscape 4.x-like behaviour with the trailing vertical bar 1 pixel behind the current character/letter (this way, it avoids the last character being in video inverse when the bar is flashing).  I really dislike this behavious especially with the URL Location field, it makes me feel I don't read URLs as well as with Netscape 4.x. I believe this is simple to fix but also hope people prefer this "old" behaviour.  I hope this is the correct component and not a duplicate. The caret in the Location field is 1 pixel ahead trivial DOM: Editor Core

description: 1. Open a new Address Book Card. Click on the other tab. Click on the notes section. Type a word. Scroll bar immediately appears even though there is enough room to enter more lines.  Expected: Scroll bar should appear only after I enter texts more than the number of intial rows.  Build and pltform: Today's linux build. Windows is OK.  PS: This is a general problem with textfields with multiline. The above description of Address Book is just an example.
my_mothod: 1. Open a new Address Book Card. Click on the other tab. Click on the notes section. Type a word. Scroll bar immediately appears even though there is enough room to enter more lines. description: Just now baulig@suse.de should have got a midair collision on bug #24806 and didn't.  He wanted to add to cc but I beat him to it by adding my name to QA and putting in a comment.  He got an error message saying:  Only the owner or submitter of the bug, or a sufficiently empowered user, may make that change to the qa_contact field.  Assumedly because he was not allowed to change back to blank which it was when he loaded the page.  Is this check occurring before the midair collision check?  Or are we failing the midair collision check?  This all happened around Friday January 12 2001 16:27 UTC if you want to check the logs, about 10 minutes ago.
my_mothod: Just now baulig@suse.de should have got a midair collision on bug #24806 and didn't.  He wanted to add to cc but I beat him to it by adding my name to QA and putting in a comment.  He got an error message saying:  Only the owner or submitter of the bug, or a sufficiently empowered user, may make that change to the qa_contact field.  Assumedly because he was not allowed to change back to blank which it was when he loaded the page.  Is this check occurring before the midair collision check?  Or are we failing the midair collision check?  This all happened around Friday January 12 2001 16:27 UTC if you want to check the logs, about 10 minutes ago. Midair collision didn't happen. minor Creating/Changing Bugs Bugzilla

description: Steps to reproduce:  1. Edit > "Preferences..." 2. Click on "Colors" row under "Appearance".  The groupbox, which title is "Link Colors" should be only "Links". This is because there's a checkbox, "Underline links" which has nothing to do with "Link Colors".  I suggest we just change the groupbox's title to "Links".

description: There are some trivial typos on the page after you add a component, product or user.  What they are:  Back to the query page, edit more products or add components to this new product.. Back to the index, edit more users or add another user.. Back to the query page or edit more keywords or add another keyword. Back to the query page or edit more components or Add another component.  What they should be:  Back to the query page, edit more products or add components to this new product. [ "." not ".." ] Back to the index, edit more users or add another user. [ "." not ".." ] Back to the query page or edit more keywords or add another keyword. [ ", " not " or " ] Back to the query page or edit more components or Add another component. [ ", " not " or " + "add" not "Add" ]
my_mothod: There are some trivial typos on the page after you add a component, product or user.  What they are:  Back to the query page, edit more products or add components to this new product.. Back to the index, edit more users or add another user.. Back to the query page or edit more keywords or add another keyword. Back to the query page or edit more components or Add another component.  What they should be:  Back to the query page, edit more products or add components to this new product. [ "." not ".." ] Back to the index, edit more users or add another user. [ "." not ".." ] Back to the query page or edit more keywords or add another keyword. [ ", " not " or " ] Back to the query page or edit more components or Add another component. description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux 2.2.17-21mdksmp i686; en-US; 0.8) Gecko/20010215 BuildID:    2001021503  On several sites (my.yahoo.com, results of ebay searches, auctions.yahoo.com) text within colored sections are unreadable.  This is caused by new default setting of Preferences->Appearance->Colors Use System Colors.  Using Darkness GTK theme which is causing a pale color to be used inside of light colored "headers".  The rendering of the colors is correct, but maybe this attribute should not default to on.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: Set gtk theme to darkness.  Go to my.yahoo.com or results page of ebay auction.  Actual Results:  colors are washed out.  Expected Results:  Not default to the setting of using system colors.  This attribute did not exist in Milestone 7 and may cause confusion.

description: The file mozilla/xpcom/base/nsGarbageCollector.c is obsolete. There have been a  few patches in other bugs that reference NS_InitGarbageCollector(), which should  no longer be necessary as it is superceded by code in NSPR, so that the  initialization can occur extremely early when NSPR's threading system is  initialized. To use the Boehm GC leak detector reliably, GC_LEAK_DETECTOR must be  defined when compiling NSPR and XPCOM.
my_mothod: The file mozilla/xpcom/base/nsGarbageCollector.c is obsolete. There have been a  few patches in other bugs that reference NS_InitGarbageCollector(), which should  no longer be necessary as it is superceded by code in NSPR, so that the  initialization can occur extremely early when NSPR's threading system is  initialized. To use the Boehm GC leak detector reliably, GC_LEAK_DETECTOR must be  defined when compiling NSPR and XPCOM. [CVS] mozilla/xpcom/base/nsGarbageCollector.c is obsolete and should be cvs removed trivial XPCOM Core

description: Using feb19 commercial trunk, seen with linux and Win98, assume mac, too.  When using the alternate 3-pane layout (am using modern skin) the folder pane header "Mail Folders" disappears and doesn't reappear.   Win98:  Disappears upon login/Get Msg. Linux:  Doesn't appear upon launch, no need to login or Get Msg.  Steps: 1.  Set pref for alternate 3-pane layout: Edit|Prefs|Mail&Newsgroups.  Change layout, which is the first pref on the main mail/news panel. Confirm OK from prefs and Exit. 2.  Launch again, go to mail. 3.  Login to default account.  Result:  no "mail folders" heading at top of folder pane.

description: Sumamry: In the news subscribe dialog on Mac selecting many groups fails.  I am unable to subscribe to netscape.public.mozilla.* newsgroups.  There are exceptions I've found including the .announce .mail-news groups.    Tested with 0302, 0306 and 030708 mozilla builds.  Steps to reproduce 1. create a new profile 2. start mail-news 3. create a news.mozilla.org account 4. open subscribe dialog 5. expand tree and attempt to subscribe to n.p.m.beos 6. hit OK  Results OK button depresses but nothing happens, dialog remains.  Expected Subscribe dialog dismissed and newsgroup added to server in the server/folder pane  Additional information I am able to subscribe to netscape.test and netscape.public.mozilla.announce (& several others)  The OK button dismisses the dialog but the server pane isn't updated with the new groups until I restart Mail. Other   This does not seem to be a problem for me on linux or win32.
my_mothod: Sumamry: In the news subscribe dialog on Mac selecting many groups fails.  I am unable to subscribe to netscape.public.mozilla.* newsgroups.  There are exceptions I've found including the .announce .mail-news groups.    Tested with 0302, 0306 and 030708 mozilla builds.  Steps to reproduce 1. create a new profile 2. start mail-news 3. create a news.mozilla.org account 4. open subscribe dialog 5. expand tree and attempt to subscribe to n.p.m.beos 6. hit OK  Results OK button depresses but nothing happens, dialog remains.  Expected Subscribe dialog dismissed and newsgroup added to server in the server/folder pane  Additional information I am able to subscribe to netscape.test and netscape.public.mozilla.announce (& several others)  The OK button dismisses the dialog but the server pane isn't updated with the new groups until I restart Mail. Other   This does not seem to be a problem for me on linux or win32. subscribe to many groups broken unable to subscribe OK does not work blocker MailNews: Message Display SeaMonkey

description: In html.css, the :table rule sets 'border-spacing' and 'border-collapse'.  It  should inherit both of them.  I would guess we could change the rules like this:  ========================= change this... =========  /* tables */  table, :table {   display: table;   border-spacing: 2px;    border-collapse: separate;   margin-top: 0;   margin-bottom: 0;   -moz-box-sizing: border-box; }  ========================= to this... =============  /* tables */  table {   display: table;   border-spacing: 2px;    border-collapse: separate;   margin-top: 0;   margin-bottom: 0;   -moz-box-sizing: border-box; }  :table {   display: table; }  ==================================================  ...because:    border-spacing is inherited by default   border-collapse is inherited by default   margin-top has '0' as the initial value anyway   margin-bottom has '0' as the initial value anyway  I'm not sure about the -moz-box-sizing declaration, will :table ever be given an explicit width? If not, then the declaration is moot, no?  You can see the effect of this change at:    http://www.hixie.ch/tests/adhoc/css/box/table/001.xml Without the fix, there is lots of red. With the fix, there is only a thin border of red (caused by the bug which is depending on this bug).
my_mothod: In html.css, the :table rule sets 'border-spacing' and 'border-collapse'.  It  should inherit both of them.  I would guess we could change the rules like this:  ========================= change this... =========  /* tables */  table, :table {   display: table;   border-spacing: 2px;    border-collapse: separate;   margin-top: 0;   margin-bottom: 0;   -moz-box-sizing: border-box; }  ========================= to this... =============  /* tables */  table {   display: table;   border-spacing: 2px;    border-collapse: separate;   margin-top: 0;   margin-bottom: 0;   -moz-box-sizing: border-box; }  :table {   display: table; }  ==================================================  ...because:    border-spacing is inherited by default   border-collapse is inherited by default   margin-top has '0' as the initial value anyway   margin-bottom has '0' as the initial value anyway  I'm not sure about the -moz-box-sizing declaration, will :table ever be given an explicit width? If not, then the declaration is moot, no?  You can see the effect of this change at:    http://www.hixie.ch/tests/adhoc/css/box/table/001.xml Without the fix, there is lots of red. With the fix, there is only a thin border of red (caused by the bug which is depending on this bug). :table has border-spacing: 2px minor Layout: Tables Core

description: Here is an interesting ie6 feature that sounds doable and cool:  "Auto Image Resize You no longer need to scroll horizontally or vertically to view large pictures. If pictures are too large to display in the browser window, the new automatic picture resizing feature resizes the pictures automatically so they fit within the dimensions of the browser window. In addition, if you navigate to pictures that fit within the browser window and then you change the window dimensions, Internet Explorer automatically adjusts the pictures to fit the new window size. To prevent image distortion, Internet Explorer adjusts both the picture height and width, even if only a single dimension needs adjusting."  While I doubt a single dimension adjusting would look good, such a feature would be neat.  Perhaps in the context menu (/me ducks) for images that overflow have an "fit to browser screen size" option.  Maybe even like the text size change feature, we could have certain % for that.
my_mothod: Here is an interesting ie6 feature that sounds doable and cool:  "Auto Image Resize You no longer need to scroll horizontally or vertically to view large pictures. If pictures are too large to display in the browser window, the new automatic picture resizing feature resizes the pictures automatically so they fit within the dimensions of the browser window. In addition, if you navigate to pictures that fit within the browser window and then you change the window dimensions, Internet Explorer automatically adjusts the pictures to fit the new window size. To prevent image distortion, Internet Explorer adjusts both the picture height and width, even if only a single dimension needs adjusting."  While I doubt a single dimension adjusting would look good, such a feature would be neat.  Perhaps in the context menu (/me ducks) for images that overflow have an "fit to browser screen size" option.  Maybe even like the text size change feature, we could have certain % for that. Automatic or option-based image resizing (Function to view an image resized to fit the screen) trivial UI Design SeaMonkey

description: Overview Description:     This test case has an absolutely positioned DIV on the left hand side, which contains some colored text and anchors, and an absolutely positioned iframe on the right hand side (pointing to about:blank, but any document will do).    When you load the page, the left hand div (black background) does not paint any of the text contained within it. When you mouse over the div,  there is some odd painting that occurs.     If you scroll down the page and then back up, the text appears.    If you remove either (a) the iframe from the page, or (b) some   that is in the text on the left, then there are no problems with the  test case.     Finally, if I set 'nglayout.debug.enable_scary_view_manager' to false, then the DIV's text is painted correctly.  Steps to Reproduce:  1) Load the attached testcase ..  Reproducibility: 100% win32/linux/mac recent builds
my_mothod: Overview Description:     This test case has an absolutely positioned DIV on the left hand side, which contains some colored text and anchors, and an absolutely positioned iframe on the right hand side (pointing to about:blank, but any document will do).    When you load the page, the left hand div (black background) does not paint any of the text contained within it. When you mouse over the div,  there is some odd painting that occurs.     If you scroll down the page and then back up, the text appears.    If you remove either (a) the iframe from the page, or (b) some   that is in the text on the left, then there are no problems with the  test case.     Finally, if I set 'nglayout.debug.enable_scary_view_manager' to false, then the DIV's text is painted correctly.  Steps to Reproduce:  1) Load the attached testcase ..  Reproducibility: 100% win32/linux/mac recent builds abs. pos. iframe interferes with painting of abs. pos. div content minor Web Painting Core

description: The transformiix source has alot of #includes in header files, and quite alot headers include other files before checking the #ifndef. This causes us grief in compile performance, so clear it up. I'll remove MITREObject in the run, it's just an alias for TxObject,  MITREObjectWrapper is now TxObjectWrapper. Removing the String version history comments as well.  Patch tested on solaris standalone and mozmodule, I'd need some mac and windows love. add the TxObjectWrapper.cpp to source/base.  The releases.txt comment in the string files disappeared, 'cause we don't have  that file.  Axel
my_mothod: The transformiix source has alot of #includes in header files, and quite alot headers include other files before checking the #ifndef. This causes us grief in compile performance, so clear it up. I'll remove MITREObject in the run, it's just an alias for TxObject,  MITREObjectWrapper is now TxObjectWrapper. Removing the String version history comments as well.  Patch tested on solaris standalone and mozmodule, I'd need some mac and windows love. add the TxObjectWrapper.cpp to source/base.  The releases.txt comment in the string files disappeared, 'cause we don't have  that file.  Axel Make transformiix |#include|s better trivial XSLT Core

description: xpfe/components/xfer and xpfe/components/ucth are both doing nsIAppShell component stuff, and they really don't need to be.   Patch forthcoming  the advantages of fixing this: - we can combine these two dlls into the xpfe components dll, reducing the number of DLLs loaded at startup, and total dlls in mozilla - we can reduce the number of components initialized at startup.  cc'ing shaver and ben for super reviews
my_mothod: xpfe/components/xfer and xpfe/components/ucth are both doing nsIAppShell component stuff, and they really don't need to be.   Patch forthcoming  the advantages of fixing this: - we can combine these two dlls into the xpfe components dll, reducing the number of DLLs loaded at startup, and total dlls in mozilla - we can reduce the number of components initialized at startup.  cc'ing shaver and ben for super reviews xfer and ucth do not need to be nsIAppShellComponents blocker UI Design SeaMonkey

description: I thought this was a Build Config bug, but apparently it's an Installer bug.  Build: 2001041004, Mac OS 9.1  To reproduce: *   Download and unStuff MacMozillaFullInstaller.sea.bin. *   Open the `Mozilla Full Installer' folder.  What you see: *   A large window, which (at 800*600 resolution) is half off the screen, and     which is in `View as List' mode even though it only contains three     top-level items.  What you should see: *   A small window near the top left corner of the screen, which is in `View as     Icons' mode with the icon `Mozilla Installer' appearing first.
my_mothod: I thought this was a Build Config bug, but apparently it's an Installer bug.  Build: 2001041004, Mac OS 9.1  To reproduce: *   Download and unStuff MacMozillaFullInstaller.sea.bin. *   Open the `Mozilla Full Installer' folder.  What you see: *   A large window, which (at 800*600 resolution) is half off the screen, and     which is in `View as List' mode even though it only contains three     top-level items.  What you should see: *   A small window near the top left corner of the screen, which is in `View as     Icons' mode with the icon `Mozilla Installer' appearing first. `Mozilla Full Installer' folder window has bad size/position/view minor Build Config SeaMonkey

description: dirver is run as part of the build. In a cross-compile situation it therefore needs to be built for the host system and not for the target system. The way we signify this in other parts of the Mozilla build is to define INTERNAL_TOOLS.  My first M0.9 build on OpenVMS failed because the dirver program did not run correctly and so failed to create dirver.h and sdkver.h.  I will attach a patch next. If someone approves it I'll check it in.
my_mothod: dirver is run as part of the build. In a cross-compile situation it therefore needs to be built for the host system and not for the target system. The way we signify this in other parts of the Mozilla build is to define INTERNAL_TOOLS.  My first M0.9 build on OpenVMS failed because the dirver program did not run correctly and so failed to create dirver.h and sdkver.h.  I will attach a patch next. If someone approves it I'll check it in. ldap build changes for OpenVMS blocker LDAP C SDK Directory

description: Up until yesterday's switch on of PSM2, I was able to pull and compile Mozilla from the tip with PSM1 using the following steps:  make -f client.mk checkout && make -f client.mk checkout BUILD_MODULES=psm make -f client.mk build && make -f client.mk BUILD_MODULES=psm  That worked fine. With the arrival of PSM2 I was told to simply replace 'psm' with 'psm2' in the above. This causes an error because a .a file wasn't found in the obj dir hierarchy.  Using the instructions as posted to the .crypto newsgroup, I had another go with --enable-modules=psm2, and this time it failed to compile. It should be noted that I was advised to rm -rf dist/{bin,lib} prior to starting the build process.  With a simple 'make' the compile error is as follows:  nsNSSComponent.cpp: In method `nsresult CertDownloaderContext::GetInterface(const nsIID &, void **)': nsNSSComponent.cpp:703: template argument 1 is invalid nsNSSComponent.cpp:703: warning: ANSI C++ forbids declaration `wwatch' with no type nsNSSComponent.cpp:703: `const class nsGetServiceByContractID' used where a `int' was expected nsNSSComponent.cpp:705: base operand of `->' is not a pointer nsNSSComponent.cpp:696: warning: `nsresult rv' might be used uninitialized in this function make[3]: *** [nsNSSComponent.o] Error 1 make[3]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/cvs/mozilla/mozilla/security/manager/ssl/src' make[2]: *** [install] Error 2 make[2]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/cvs/mozilla/mozilla/security/manager/ssl' make[1]: *** [install] Error 2 make[1]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/cvs/mozilla/mozilla/security/manager' make: *** [install] Error 2  Here is my .mozconfig (optimised build, relevant lines):  mk_add_options MOZ_OBJDIR=@TOPSRCDIR@/../obj-opt ac_add_options --with-extensions=inspector,wallet,cookie ac_add_options --enable-modules=psm2   It seems to a problem with obj-dir builds since the nightlies are fine, and dbaron reports his build is failing too.  Suggest the PSM/build folks provide the following:  1) CLEAR steps to building PSM2 (right now there is conflicting advice depending    on who you talk to) 2) Fixes to insure the above steps work, assuming the steps above do in fact    work and the rest of us are doing things wrong ;)
my_mothod: Up until yesterday's switch on of PSM2, I was able to pull and compile Mozilla from the tip with PSM1 using the following steps:  make -f client.mk checkout && make -f client.mk checkout BUILD_MODULES=psm make -f client.mk build && make -f client.mk BUILD_MODULES=psm  That worked fine. With the arrival of PSM2 I was told to simply replace 'psm' with 'psm2' in the above. This causes an error because a .a file wasn't found in the obj dir hierarchy.  Using the instructions as posted to the .crypto newsgroup, I had another go with --enable-modules=psm2, and this time it failed to compile. It should be noted that I was advised to rm -rf dist/{bin,lib} prior to starting the build process.  With a simple 'make' the compile error is as follows:  nsNSSComponent.cpp: In method `nsresult CertDownloaderContext::GetInterface(const nsIID &, void **)': nsNSSComponent.cpp:703: template argument 1 is invalid nsNSSComponent.cpp:703: warning: ANSI C++ forbids declaration `wwatch' with no type nsNSSComponent.cpp:703: `const class nsGetServiceByContractID' used where a `int' was expected nsNSSComponent.cpp:705: base operand of `->' is not a pointer nsNSSComponent.cpp:696: warning: `nsresult rv' might be used uninitialized in this function make[3]: *** [nsNSSComponent.o] Error 1 make[3]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/cvs/mozilla/mozilla/security/manager/ssl/src' make[2]: *** [install] Error 2 make[2]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/cvs/mozilla/mozilla/security/manager/ssl' make[1]: *** [install] Error 2 make[1]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/cvs/mozilla/mozilla/security/manager' make: *** [install] Error 2  Here is my .mozconfig (optimised build, relevant lines):  mk_add_options MOZ_OBJDIR=@TOPSRCDIR@/../obj-opt ac_add_options --with-extensions=inspector,wallet,cookie ac_add_options --enable-modules=psm2   It seems to a problem with obj-dir builds since the nightlies are fine, and dbaron reports his build is failing too.  Suggest the PSM/build folks provide the following:  1) CLEAR steps to building PSM2 (right now there is conflicting advice depending    on who you talk to) 2) Fixes to insure the above steps work, assuming the steps above do in fact    work and the rest of us are doing things wrong ;) Unable to build with PSM2 using object dir blocker Build Config SeaMonkey

description: If I try to add or edit a milestone such that the sortkey is not a number, I get an error like:  INSERT INTO milestones ( value, product, sortkey ) VALUES ( 'A','TestProduct', K): Unknown column 'K' in 'field list' at globals.pl line 173.   This should check the sortkey is a number and give a reasonable error message if not.  This might be a security problem but I can't figure out how to might make it one.
my_mothod: If I try to add or edit a milestone such that the sortkey is not a number, I get an error like:  INSERT INTO milestones ( value, product, sortkey ) VALUES ( 'A','TestProduct', K): Unknown column 'K' in 'field list' at globals.pl line 173.   This should check the sortkey is a number and give a reasonable error message if not.  This might be a security problem but I can't figure out how to might make it one. Give proper error message on non-numeric sortkey. minor Administration Bugzilla

description: some time, I have a modal alert in thewhich it's disable that I cannot close. I have to kill the app!  The easy way to reproduce this problem is to turn on the send progres dialog and send a page without entering a  recipient.  1) Set the following pref into your prefs.js (your profile should not be currently in use):      user_pref("mailnews.show_send_progress", true); 2) Start Mozilla (or Netscape 6) 3) Load any page into the browser window 4) Select menu file/Send Page 5) From the message compose window, press the send button (do not enter a recipient) 6) ==> you will have a deactivated Alert on top or behind the progress dialog.  This problem does not affect Mac.
my_mothod: some time, I have a modal alert in thewhich it's disable that I cannot close. I have to kill the app!  The easy way to reproduce this problem is to turn on the send progres dialog and send a page without entering a  recipient.  1) Set the following pref into your prefs.js (your profile should not be currently in use):      user_pref("mailnews.show_send_progress", true); 2) Start Mozilla (or Netscape 6) 3) Load any page into the browser window 4) Select menu file/Send Page 5) From the message compose window, press the send button (do not enter a recipient) 6) ==> you will have a deactivated Alert on top or behind the progress dialog.  This problem does not affect Mac. Modal Alerts not alway activated, impossible to dismiss them blocker UI Design SeaMonkey

description: I commented on the fact that Tara is called the Bugzilla "owner" on the web page and asked just what an owner of a piece of software is meant to be.  I thought it was trying to get at "project leader" but Dave said it was more like "default assignee for the Bugzilla component", which had never occurred to me.  It was not suprising to me therefore that the bug page uses the wording "assignee".  However, inconsistently "owner" appears on editcomponents.cgi on the components table (editcomponents.cgi?product=XXX) and on the specific component form (editcomponents.cgi?product=XXX&component=YYY&action=edit).  I'm not concerned with the schema, and I'm not sure about any other pages.  So basically, we should make this consistent.  I suggest assignee is a better term since it is less ambiguous, at least when used outside the context of Bugzilla like it was on the web page.
my_mothod: I commented on the fact that Tara is called the Bugzilla "owner" on the web page and asked just what an owner of a piece of software is meant to be.  I thought it was trying to get at "project leader" but Dave said it was more like "default assignee for the Bugzilla component", which had never occurred to me.  It was not suprising to me therefore that the bug page uses the wording "assignee".  However, inconsistently "owner" appears on editcomponents.cgi on the components table (editcomponents.cgi?product=XXX) and on the specific component form (editcomponents.cgi?product=XXX&component=YYY&action=edit).  I'm not concerned with the schema, and I'm not sure about any other pages.  So basically, we should make this consistent.  I suggest assignee is a better term since it is less ambiguous, at least when used outside the context of Bugzilla like it was on the web page. Assignee or owner? minor User Interface Bugzilla

description: Using Build ID: 2001041704  Steps to reproduce problem: 1. Start reading news 2. Use space to scroll through message 3. At the end of the message, space will advance to the next unread message 4. At the end of the group, space will advance to the next unread group  Expected results: confirmation that you want to advance to the next unread group  Actual results: release of spacebar dismissis confirmation dialog  Additional information: I have tried setting the autorepeat delay to no avail. I'd better set it back now. Having no autorepeat is annoying :-)  Alternative steps to reproduce problem: 1. Open preferences 2. Hold down space 3. Click and hold Cancel 4. Release space  Expected results: Cancel button still active  Actual results: dialog dismisses when space bar released  An unreleated problem: 1. Open preferences 2. Click and hold Cancel 3. Press and release space  Note that in this case the button had the focus when space was pressed. It's still a bug but I mentioned it because the fix might be the same.
my_mothod: Using Build ID: 2001041704  Steps to reproduce problem: 1. Start reading news 2. Use space to scroll through message 3. At the end of the message, space will advance to the next unread message 4. At the end of the group, space will advance to the next unread group  Expected results: confirmation that you want to advance to the next unread group  Actual results: release of spacebar dismissis confirmation dialog  Additional information: I have tried setting the autorepeat delay to no avail. I'd better set it back now. Having no autorepeat is annoying :-)  Alternative steps to reproduce problem: 1. Open preferences 2. Hold down space 3. Click and hold Cancel 4. Release space  Expected results: Cancel button still active  Actual results: dialog dismisses when space bar released  An unreleated problem: 1. Open preferences 2. Click and hold Cancel 3. Press and release space  Note that in this case the button had the focus when space was pressed. It's still a bug but I mentioned it because the fix might be the same. Spacebar triggers button on release, should require press/release trivial XUL Core

description: Build: 2001041908, Mac OS 9.1  To reproduce: *   Open the Mozilla Installer. *   Look at the `Welcome to the Mozilla installer' text.  What you see: *   Charcoal 18px, bold.  What you should see *   Charcoal 18px, regular.  The general typographical rule is: If you're going to use the same font for a  heading as you do for the body text, you should increase *either* its size *or*  its weight. Avoid increasing both at once, especially if (as in this case) the  difference in weight is not great. (And yes, I know html.css breaks this rule.)  In addition, most of Mac OS's choices for the large system font (especially  Charcoal and Chicago) are quite heavy to begin with, so they react quite badly  to being made bold.
my_mothod: Build: 2001041908, Mac OS 9.1  To reproduce: *   Open the Mozilla Installer. *   Look at the `Welcome to the Mozilla installer' text.  What you see: *   Charcoal 18px, bold.  What you should see *   Charcoal 18px, regular.  The general typographical rule is: If you're going to use the same font for a  heading as you do for the body text, you should increase *either* its size *or*  its weight. Avoid increasing both at once, especially if (as in this case) the  difference in weight is not great. (And yes, I know html.css breaks this rule.)  In addition, most of Mac OS's choices for the large system font (especially  Charcoal and Chicago) are quite heavy to begin with, so they react quite badly  to being made bold. `Welcome to the Mozilla installer' should not be bold trivial Installer SeaMonkey

description: Reproducible: Always Steps to reproduce: 1) Open two browser windows to whatever web pages. 2) Open the sidebar in one of the windows. 3) Use the window whose sidebar is not showing to launch a new window, with Open Link in New Window. Expected Result: The new window's sidebar shouldn't appear, since the launching window's sidebar was closed. Actual Result: The new window's sidebar appears. I can have five windows open; if even one of them has the sidebar displaying, a new window will have it too, no matter from which window it was launched.  The new window should have the same characteristics as the launching window.
my_mothod: Reproducible: Always Steps to reproduce: 1) Open two browser windows to whatever web pages. 2) Open the sidebar in one of the windows. 3) Use the window whose sidebar is not showing to launch a new window, with Open Link in New Window. Expected Result: The new window's sidebar shouldn't appear, since the launching window's sidebar was closed. Actual Result: The new window's sidebar appears. I can have five windows open; if even one of them has the sidebar displaying, a new window will have it too, no matter from which window it was launched.  The new window should have the same characteristics as the launching window. Sidebar expand/collapsed state should be inherited from launching window; not from result of last state change minor Sidebar SeaMonkey

description: bug 76045 was reopened and then confirmed but the Resolution Duplicate was not cleared.  There was an option to "Clear the resolution" in the radio options under the comment box.  I selected this item and hit submit and it did clear the resolution.  I haven't seen this before. Is this some vestigial remains from the early days of Bugzilla when reopening required two steps?  Is it something we still need or want in the code?
my_mothod: bug 76045 was reopened and then confirmed but the Resolution Duplicate was not cleared.  There was an option to "Clear the resolution" in the radio options under the comment box.  I selected this item and hit submit and it did clear the resolution.  I haven't seen this before. Is this some vestigial remains from the early days of Bugzilla when reopening required two steps?  Is it something we still need or want in the code? bug with Status New and Resolution Duplicate trivial Creating/Changing Bugs Bugzilla

description: Procedure: Load a document which specifies a cursor and move your mouse over the affected element.  Expected: Element will load the first possible cursor in a comma-broken list. Hopefully all of the CSS2 elements should be supported, and if reasonably possible, Mozilla should try to fetch a .cur file specified in the URL value and display it (at least on the Windows platform), reasonably possible defined as able to connect and download the uncorrupted file without timing out.  Actual: Mozilla appears to ignore the cursor property entirely if more than one value is specified on the list. Instead the default cursor for that element is used.  Also, Mozilla does not load cursors specified as a URL, even if they are not part of a list.  Proposal: We need this browser to be, at the very least, 99.9% compatible with CSS1 and CSS2 if it's going to live up to its expectations. This should be fixed to behave as documented at the following URL:  http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-CSS2/ui.html#cursor-props  If I have time I will get a test page up this weekend to demonstrate this behavior (unless someone knows of such a test that already exists).  Appears on: Build 20010426 Win98
my_mothod: Procedure: Load a document which specifies a cursor and move your mouse over the affected element.  Expected: Element will load the first possible cursor in a comma-broken list. Hopefully all of the CSS2 elements should be supported, and if reasonably possible, Mozilla should try to fetch a .cur file specified in the URL value and display it (at least on the Windows platform), reasonably possible defined as able to connect and download the uncorrupted file without timing out.  Actual: Mozilla appears to ignore the cursor property entirely if more than one value is specified on the list. Instead the default cursor for that element is used.  Also, Mozilla does not load cursors specified as a URL, even if they are not part of a list.  Proposal: We need this browser to be, at the very least, 99.9% compatible with CSS1 and CSS2 if it's going to live up to its expectations. This should be fixed to behave as documented at the following URL:  http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-CSS2/ui.html#cursor-props  If I have time I will get a test page up this weekend to demonstrate this behavior (unless someone knows of such a test that already exists).  Appears on: Build 20010426 Win98 CSS2 blocker: Alternate cursor should load if URI is broken minor CSS Parsing and Computation Core

description: Build 2001-04-30-04: NT4 Build 2001-05-01-04: Mac 9.04  Overview: If an accelerator consists of "Ctrl" and "Shift" it is usually displayed in the form of "Ctrl+Shift+ and then some letter" (i.e. Ctrl+Shift+T).   Actual: The Format menu has many items which are displaying with "Shift" first then "Ctrl":   - Size|Smaller, Shift+Ctrl+[ - Size|Larger, Shift+Ctrl+] - Discontinue Text Style, Shift+Ctrl+K - Discontinue Link, Shift+Ctrl+L  Expected Results: To be consistent with other menu items, I would expect to see "Ctrl", then "Shift" followed by a letter (i.e. Ctrl+Shift+K instead of Shift+Ctrl+K)
my_mothod: Build 2001-04-30-04: NT4 Build 2001-05-01-04: Mac 9.04  Overview: If an accelerator consists of "Ctrl" and "Shift" it is usually displayed in the form of "Ctrl+Shift+ and then some letter" (i.e. Ctrl+Shift+T). description: <formletter>It has been decreed (or requested at any rate) that our release (read non-debug) builds must not print anything to the console when the app is running.  See bug 76720 for details.  I have done a preliminary tree scouring and created mini-patches for each module that has bare printfs.   These patches are not all inclusive as I didn't even think about xul/js output until post scour so module owners & peers will still need to scour their modules themselves as well as make sure the preliminary patches do not break anything.</formletter>

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux 2.2.19 i686; en-US; rv:0.9+) Gecko/20010503 BuildID:    2001050306  Right-clicking on an empty area of the document doesn't always bring up the context menu.  I'm not sure what makes it work sometimes.  It appears to work for links/images, and then once on an empty part of the document, but not again.  Reproducible: Sometimes Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open any page (like about:blank) 2. Right-click to bring up the context menu. 3. Right-click again somewhere else.  Actual Results:  No menu!  Expected Results:  Expected to see the context menu again.  My last nightly was 20010430??, and it worked fine there, so it was something recent.
my_mothod: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux 2.2.19 i686; en-US; rv:0.9+) Gecko/20010503 BuildID:    2001050306  Right-clicking on an empty area of the document doesn't always bring up the context menu.  I'm not sure what makes it work sometimes.  It appears to work for links/images, and then once on an empty part of the document, but not again.  Reproducible: Sometimes Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open any page (like about:blank) 2. Right-click to bring up the context menu. 3. Right-click again somewhere else.  Actual Results:  No menu!  Expected Results:  Expected to see the context menu again.  My last nightly was 20010430??, and it worked fine there, so it was something recent. Right-click doesn't reliably bring up context menu (first time only?) blocker XUL Core

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Win98; en-US; rv:0.9+) Gecko/20010506 BuildID:    2001050620  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Assume you have autocomplete enabled, "Go" button shown on URL bar. 2. Type some URL on the URL bar. 3. Autocomplete dropdown box appeared.  Actual Results:  To launch the URL that the user has just entered by clicking on the "Go" button, the autocomplete dropdown box is closed.  No URL is launched unless the "Go" button is clicked again.  Expected Results:  The user-entered URL should be launched upon clicking the "Go" button *once*, regardless of the autocomplete dropdown box showing up.
my_mothod: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Win98; en-US; rv:0.9+) Gecko/20010506 BuildID:    2001050620  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Assume you have autocomplete enabled, "Go" button shown on URL bar. 2. Type some URL on the URL bar. 3. Autocomplete dropdown box appeared.  Actual Results:  To launch the URL that the user has just entered by clicking on the "Go" button, the autocomplete dropdown box is closed.  No URL is launched unless the "Go" button is clicked again.  Expected Results:  The user-entered URL should be launched upon clicking the "Go" button *once*, regardless of the autocomplete dropdown box showing up. Can't click "Go" button when autocomplete dropdown is active minor Location Bar SeaMonkey

description: Building mozilla with gcc on IRIX results in missing symbols  nsXPTCStubBase::Stub130 in libxpcom.so  Looking in xpcom/reflect/xptcall/src/md/unix/, nm indicates that the symbols  are missing because they should be nsXPTCStubBase::Stub130(void)   And xpcom/reflect/xptcall/src/xptcall.o seems to be were the incorrectly named  symbols come from.  --- % ./mozilla ... 12643702:./mozilla-bin: rld: Error: unresolvable symbol in ./libxpcom.so:  Stub120__14nsXPTCStubBase 12643702:./mozilla-bin: rld: Error: unresolvable symbol in ./libxpcom.so:  Stub20__14nsXPTCStubBase ... --- % nm xpcom/reflect/xptcall/src/md/unix/libxptcmd.a | grep Stub130 [4]	|      4064|      32|FUNC |GLOB |DEFAULT  |4       |Stub130__14nsXPTCStubBaseGv --- % nm xpcom/build/libxpcom.so | grep Stub130 [509]	|1609924392|      32|FUNC |GLOB |DEFAULT   |MIPS_TEXT|Stub130__14nsXPTCStubBaseGv [902]	|         0|       0|FUNC |GLOB |DEFAULT  |UNDEF   |Stub130__14nsXPTCStubBase --- % nm xpcom/reflect/xptcall/src/xptcall.o | grep Stub130 [15]    |         0|       0|FUNC |GLOB |DEFAULT  |UNDEF   |Stub130__14nsXPTCStubBase
my_mothod: Building mozilla with gcc on IRIX results in missing symbols  nsXPTCStubBase::Stub130 in libxpcom.so  Looking in xpcom/reflect/xptcall/src/md/unix/, nm indicates that the symbols  are missing because they should be nsXPTCStubBase::Stub130(void)   And xpcom/reflect/xptcall/src/xptcall.o seems to be were the incorrectly named  symbols come from.  --- % ./mozilla ... 12643702:./mozilla-bin: rld: Error: unresolvable symbol in ./libxpcom.so:  Stub120__14nsXPTCStubBase 12643702:./mozilla-bin: rld: Error: unresolvable symbol in ./libxpcom.so:  Stub20__14nsXPTCStubBase ... --- % nm xpcom/reflect/xptcall/src/md/unix/libxptcmd.a | grep Stub130 [4]	|      4064|      32|FUNC |GLOB |DEFAULT  |4       |Stub130__14nsXPTCStubBaseGv --- % nm xpcom/build/libxpcom.so | grep Stub130 [509]	|1609924392|      32|FUNC |GLOB |DEFAULT   |MIPS_TEXT|Stub130__14nsXPTCStubBaseGv [902]	|         0|       0|FUNC |GLOB |DEFAULT  |UNDEF   |Stub130__14nsXPTCStubBase --- % nm xpcom/reflect/xptcall/src/xptcall.o | grep Stub130 [15]    |         0|       0|FUNC |GLOB |DEFAULT  |UNDEF   |Stub130__14nsXPTCStubBase Missing symbols in libxpcom.so (IRIX/gcc) blocker XPCOM Core
