description: Steps to reproduce: 1. Load http://www.cs.hmc.edu/~jruderma/s/ 2. Press Alt+3 to focus the Google textbox, but release Alt before releasing 3.  Result: The Google textbox gets focus, but the menu bar is also activated  (focused?) and steals keystrokes until I hit the escape key.  I run into this bug pretty often when using access keys on my start page.
my_mothod: Steps to reproduce: 1. Load http://www.cs.hmc.edu/~jruderma/s/ 2. Press Alt+3 to focus the Google textbox, but release Alt before releasing 3.  Result: The Google textbox gets focus, but the menu bar is also activated  (focused?) and steals keystrokes until I hit the escape key.  I run into this bug pretty often when using access keys on my start page. Alt+key activates menu bar if alt released before key minor XUL Core

description: I noticed a few probable assignment (=) vs. equality (==) typos in the code:  content/base/src/nsGenericElement.cpp:   if (rv = NS_CONTENT_ATTR_NOT_THERE) { content/events/src/nsDOMEvent.cpp:   if (mEvent->eventStructType = NS_MOUSE_EVENT) {   if (mEvent->eventStructType = NS_KEY_EVENT) { extensions/xmlterm/base/mozXMLTermSession.cpp:   if ((styleChanges = 1) && xpcom/base/nsDebugHelpWin32.cpp:   if(gHooks = this) xpcom/reflect/xptcall/src/md/os2/xptcinvoke_icc.cpp:   if( cpcount = 0 ) {   } else if( cpcount = 1 )  I'm mostly positive that the ones in content and xpcom/reflect are typos, and not entirely sure about the ones in extensions/xmlterm and xpcom/base.
my_mothod: I noticed a few probable assignment (=) vs. equality (==) typos in the code:  content/base/src/nsGenericElement.cpp:   if (rv = NS_CONTENT_ATTR_NOT_THERE) { content/events/src/nsDOMEvent.cpp:   if (mEvent->eventStructType = NS_MOUSE_EVENT) {   if (mEvent->eventStructType = NS_KEY_EVENT) { extensions/xmlterm/base/mozXMLTermSession.cpp:   if ((styleChanges = 1) && xpcom/base/nsDebugHelpWin32.cpp:   if(gHooks = this) xpcom/reflect/xptcall/src/md/os2/xptcinvoke_icc.cpp:   if( cpcount = 0 ) {   } else if( cpcount = 1 )  I'm mostly positive that the ones in content and xpcom/reflect are typos, and not entirely sure about the ones in extensions/xmlterm and xpcom/base. assignment vs. equality typos minor General SeaMonkey

description: Build: 2001051504, Mac OS 9.1  To reproduce: *   Open another Navigator window. *   In the first window, click the `Create a new attachment' link in this bug     report. *   Click the `Browse...' button. *   Choose a file (file A) in the filepicker. *   Now, in the second window, choose `File' > `Open ...'. *   Open a file (file B) which is in a different folder from file A. *   Switch back to the first window, and click the `Browse...' button again.  What happens: *   The filepicker opens with file B pre-selected.  What should happen: *   The filepicker opens with file A pre-selected.
my_mothod: Build: 2001051504, Mac OS 9.1  To reproduce: *   Open another Navigator window. *   In the first window, click the `Create a new attachment' link in this bug     report. *   Click the `Browse...' button. *   Choose a file (file A) in the filepicker. *   Now, in the second window, choose `File' > `Open ...'. *   Open a file (file B) which is in a different folder from file A. *   Switch back to the first window, and click the `Browse...' button again.  What happens: *   The filepicker opens with file B pre-selected.  What should happen: *   The filepicker opens with file A pre-selected. `Browse...' filepicker default isn't based on current selection minor Layout: Form Controls Core

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:0.9+) Gecko/20010513 BuildID:    2001051308  When in the Composer, if you add a few &nbsp's to your file using the source view, then switch away from that view to any other (normal, tags or preview) then switch back to source, the &nbsp is gone.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Enter some text into the Normal view 2. Switch to source view and insert a &nbsp somewhere in that line 3. Switch to any other view. Notice that it is "working" 4. Switch back to source view and notice that is gone  Actual Results:  keep the &nbsp's that I added in there  Expected Results:  &nbsp's are gone  The &nbsp will be removed anywhere in the source. Also, after noticing that the nbsps are gone, if you switch back to normal view, it looks "weird". The cursor is not right next to the character it is deleting, like there is a space between the character and the cursor.  Of course, the workaround is do your main editing in the composer, then load the page in notepad and add your &nbsp's.
my_mothod: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:0.9+) Gecko/20010513 BuildID:    2001051308  When in the Composer, if you add a few &nbsp's to your file using the source view, then switch away from that view to any other (normal, tags or preview) then switch back to source, the &nbsp is gone.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Enter some text into the Normal view 2. Switch to source view and insert a &nbsp somewhere in that line 3. Switch to any other view. Notice that it is "working" 4. Switch back to source view and notice that is gone  Actual Results:  keep the &nbsp's that I added in there  Expected Results:  &nbsp's are gone  The &nbsp will be removed anywhere in the source. Also, after noticing that the nbsps are gone, if you switch back to normal view, it looks "weird". The cursor is not right next to the character it is deleting, like there is a space between the character and the cursor.  Of course, the workaround is do your main editing in the composer, then load the page in notepad and add your &nbsp's. &nbsp removed from source when changing views minor DOM: Editor Core

description: quirk.css says:  92 /* Quirk: text input has fixed look in compat mode (b=25580) */  93 input[type="text"] {  94   border: 2px inset ! important;  95   padding: 1px 0 0 0;  96 }  The 'border' line is missing 'ThreeDFace':  !94   border: 2px inset ThreeDFace ! important;  This regressed when Pierre fixed our 'border'/'border-color' handling, because now we correctly reset border-color to the value of 'color', which usually  turns out to be 'black'.  While you're at it, could you fix line 36? s/focused/disabled/. Cheers.
my_mothod: quirk.css says:  92 /* Quirk: text input has fixed look in compat mode (b=25580) */  93 input[type="text"] {  94   border: 2px inset ! important;  95   padding: 1px 0 0 0;  96 }  The 'border' line is missing 'ThreeDFace':  !94   border: 2px inset ThreeDFace ! important;  This regressed when Pierre fixed our 'border'/'border-color' handling, because now we correctly reset border-color to the value of 'color', which usually  turns out to be 'black'.  While you're at it, could you fix line 36? s/focused/disabled/. Cheers. <input type="text"> has darker borders than <input> text field input controls minor Layout: Form Controls Core

description: When modifying all three fields "Login name", "Real name" and "Disable Text" at  the same time, I get this SQL error message:   Updated user    Updated permissions. Updated real name. Content-type: text/html   Software error:  DELETE FROM logincookies WHERE userid=: You have an error in your SQL syntax  near '' at line 2 at globals.pl line 173.   Workaround is to do the required edit in two steps.

Workaround is to do the required edit in two steps. SQL error after editing user entry in editusers.cgi minor Administration Bugzilla

description:
See attached test case, which should force style to be re-resolved on a paragraph, applying the :first-letter pseudo.

The letter `T' should be blue.

Expected: `T' is blue. Actual: nothing happens. N.B. that this works fine: Interesting bug, because fixing it may have an impact on the the proposed fix for bug 79508.
my_mothod:
See attached test case, which should force style to be re-resolved on a paragraph, applying the :first-letter pseudo.

The letter `T' should be blue.

Expected: `T' is blue. Actual: nothing happens. N.B. that this works fine: Interesting bug, because fixing it may have an impact on the the proposed fix for bug 79508. :first-line and :first-letter pseudos not re-resolved on attribute change minor CSS Parsing and Computation Core

description: In the course of fixing bug 71552 it came up that when a Param is removed from defparam.pl it never gets removed from data/params.  While this shouldn't cause an problems, it is extra and unneeded stuff floating around.  There should be a routine in checksetup.pl that can remove those.  Right now the params the need removing are:  * newemailtech  * newemailtechdefault  * changedmail  * prettyasciimail  Attachment 33631 has the routines that would need to be added to checksetup.pl.  There was a question on IRC how requiring defparams.pl would react w/out having globals.pl for the SendSQL routine (even though SendSQL is inside a sub that isn't called by WriteParams).
my_mothod: In the course of fixing bug 71552 it came up that when a Param is removed from defparam.pl it never gets removed from data/params.  While this shouldn't cause an problems, it is extra and unneeded stuff floating around.  There should be a routine in checksetup.pl that can remove those.  Right now the params the need removing are:  * newemailtech  * newemailtechdefault  * changedmail  * prettyasciimail  Attachment 33631 has the routines that would need to be added to checksetup.pl.  There was a question on IRC how requiring defparams.pl would react w/out having globals.pl for the SendSQL routine (even though SendSQL is inside a sub that isn't called by WriteParams). Stranded Params trivial Bugzilla-General Bugzilla

description: I'm not sure if that's legal or not, but I do know that Konqueror can't cope  with it as well as mozilla can. Now I know most folks around here don't care  if another browser can handle the html we use or not, but when mozilla is  falling apart and you're trying to report that fact in bugzilla, you need  another browser to do it. Having line feeds encoded as html entities tends to  make pre blocks an unholy mess, especially if they contain things like stack  traces, or patches.
my_mothod: I'm not sure if that's legal or not, but I do know that Konqueror can't cope  with it as well as mozilla can. Now I know most folks around here don't care  if another browser can handle the html we use or not, but when mozilla is  falling apart and you're trying to report that fact in bugzilla, you need  another browser to do it. Having line feeds encoded as html entities tends to  make pre blocks an unholy mess, especially if they contain things like stack  traces, or patches. bugzilla puts  inside <pre> tags minor User Interface Bugzilla

description: getComputedStyle(node, "").getPropertyValue("visibility") returns an empty string.  Steps to reproduce: 1) Load the test case.  Actual results: The comparison of visibility and an empty string evaluates to true.  Expected results: Expected a string reflecting the actual property to be retuned.  This bug blocks a complete implementation of bug 31961. (A partial implementation that just ignores visibility  is possible, however.)

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux 2.4.5 i686; en-US; rv:0.9+) Gecko/20010529 BuildID:    2001052908  The four options for when to check the page are named:  - Every time I view the page - Automatically - Once per session - Never  However, this is confusing. Once per session is OK, as long as you know what a session is (not luser-friendly but OK anyways, since it's under Advanced). But what's the difference between "Every time I view the page" and "Automatically"? "Every time" is automatic, right? Then, what's the difference? Is "Automatically" whenever it feels a strong energy from the Force telling the page has been updated? Does "Every time I view the page" means if I iconify the window and then restore it, it should check with the server and then reload the page if it's changed? (Yes, that's what I can see people thinking.)  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: Duh, the bug form needs something here. Remind me to avoid using it in the future.  I know a lot of the HTTP/1.0 and HTTP/1.1 specs. This doesn't help a bit. I still can't figure the difference (I could start ethereal to try to figure it out, or use the source, but I shouldn't have to). If even technical users don't know what you are talking about, you have a problem.

(Yes, that's what I can see people thinking.)  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: Duh, the bug form needs something here. Remind me to avoid using it in the future.  I know a lot of the HTTP/1.0 and HTTP/1.1 specs. This doesn't help a bit. I still can't figure the difference (I could start ethereal to try to figure it out, or use the source, but I shouldn't have to). description: The simple sample plugin (libnpsimple.so on linux) should not be exported to the dist directory when building. It should probably be built (to make sure it always works, etc.) but shouldn't be an installed plugin.  The fix for this is likely a line of code in a couple makefiles.
my_mothod: The simple sample plugin (libnpsimple.so on linux) should not be exported to the dist directory when building. It should probably be built (to make sure it always works, etc.) but shouldn't be an installed plugin.  The fix for this is likely a line of code in a couple makefiles. Simple Sample Plugin should not be exported to dist trivial Build Config SeaMonkey

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC; en-US; rv:0.9.1) Gecko/20010607 BuildID:    2001060712  Under MacOS 8.6, 9.0 and 9.1, and Mozilla 0.8, 0.9 and 0.91 there is a problem with how new browser windows tile on systems that use the GoMac status bar utility from PowerOn Software.  GoMac chops off the bottom 20,or so, pixels of the monitor for use as it's status bar. Mozilla does the right thign when you click the expand/zoom button, by not expanding the window below the GoMac status bar, but when you create a new window that tiles over an existing one, it doesn't correctly size the new window to take into account GoMac's status bar size. It's still using the "original" monitor size.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.Install GoMac 2.Open a Mozilla Window that is sized to the height of your window, taking into account GoMac's status bar size. 3. Open a new window to tile on top of the existing window. Notice how the bottom edge of the window is below the GoMac status bar.  Actual Results:  The tiled window(s) all draw their bottom edge's below the GoMac status bar.  Expected Results:  The tiled window(s) should not draw their bottom edges below the GoMac status bar, as correctly happens when you use the expand/zoom button.  Should be a snap to fix, since there's already code that does the "right thing".
my_mothod: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC; en-US; rv:0.9.1) Gecko/20010607 BuildID:    2001060712  Under MacOS 8.6, 9.0 and 9.1, and Mozilla 0.8, 0.9 and 0.91 there is a problem with how new browser windows tile on systems that use the GoMac status bar utility from PowerOn Software.  GoMac chops off the bottom 20,or so, pixels of the monitor for use as it's status bar. Mozilla does the right thign when you click the expand/zoom button, by not expanding the window below the GoMac status bar, but when you create a new window that tiles over an existing one, it doesn't correctly size the new window to take into account GoMac's status bar size. It's still using the "original" monitor size.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.Install GoMac 2.Open a Mozilla Window that is sized to the height of your window, taking into account GoMac's status bar size. 3. Open a new window to tile on top of the existing window. Notice how the bottom edge of the window is below the GoMac status bar.  Actual Results:  The tiled window(s) all draw their bottom edge's below the GoMac status bar.  Expected Results:  The tiled window(s) should not draw their bottom edges below the GoMac status bar, as correctly happens when you use the expand/zoom button.  Should be a snap to fix, since there's already code that does the "right thing". Window tile broken when using GoMac trivial UI Design SeaMonkey

description: I can redefine focus() and several other functions on pages at another domain.   I should only be able to call these functions, not redefine them.  The  redefined function runs with the principal of the attacker, and these functions  aren't called with interesting parameters, so this isn't a huge security hole.  Here's the line form all.js:   pref("capability.policy.default.Window.focus", "allAccess");  I think this should be   pref("capability.policy.default.Window.focus.get", "allAccess"); but I couldn't figure out how to test that change.
my_mothod: I can redefine focus() and several other functions on pages at another domain.   I should only be able to call these functions, not redefine them.  The  redefined function runs with the principal of the attacker, and these functions  aren't called with interesting parameters, so this isn't a huge security hole.  Here's the line form all.js:   pref("capability.policy.default.Window.focus", "allAccess");  I think this should be   pref("capability.policy.default.Window.focus.get", "allAccess"); but I couldn't figure out how to test that change. can redefine focus() and other allAccess functions at another domain minor Security: CAPS Core

description: not critical bug. reproduce procedure 1. open edit:Preference 2. select "Smart Browsing" The first text box said - What's Related My Sidebar Tab - I think the language is a little bit strange.  suggest change to - "What's Related" tab in "My Sidebar" panel - or - "What's Related" tab in My Sidebar - or - "What's Related" tab in "My Sidebar" panel -  Suggest putting " around "What's Related" and "My Sidebar" since they are  special term also, since the tab is "What's Related", we should put after "What's Related"  instead put after "My Sidebar". "What's Related" is a tab "My Sidebar" is a panel.
my_mothod: not critical bug. reproduce procedure 1. open edit:Preference 2. select "Smart Browsing" The first text box said - What's Related My Sidebar Tab - I think the language is a little bit strange.  suggest change to - "What's Related" tab in "My Sidebar" panel - or - "What's Related" tab in My Sidebar - or - "What's Related" tab in "My Sidebar" panel -  Suggest putting " around "What's Related" and "My Sidebar" since they are  special term also, since the tab is "What's Related", we should put after "What's Related"  instead put after "My Sidebar". "What's Related" is a tab "My Sidebar" is a panel. language used in Smart Browsing preference trivial Preferences SeaMonkey

description: Most of the cgis in the product, if you type them in directly with no parameters, would do something reasonable.  However, createattachment will give a software error.  It should work like show_bug.cgi which asks for the bug id.
my_mothod: Most of the cgis in the product, if you type them in directly with no parameters, would do something reasonable.  However, createattachment will give a software error.  It should work like show_bug.cgi which asks for the bug id. attachment.cgi should work with no parameters trivial Attachments & Requests Bugzilla

description: When someone enters an invalid login, they have an option to e-mail themselves a password.  However, if the account does not exist, it is created.  This is undesirable because useless accounts can be created by accident.  I suggest that we say that the account does not exist, and below that message place the normal createaccount.cgi form (with the email address filled in).  As a bonus, the user will be able to enter their real name at account creation time.  This would of course mean that this code should be refactored so it is usable from all cgis that might want a login, as well as createaccount.cgi.
my_mothod: When someone enters an invalid login, they have an option to e-mail themselves a password.  However, if the account does not exist, it is created.  This is undesirable because useless accounts can be created by accident.  I suggest that we say that the account does not exist, and below that message place the normal createaccount.cgi form (with the email address filled in).  As a bonus, the user will be able to enter their real name at account creation time.  This would of course mean that this code should be refactored so it is usable from all cgis that might want a login, as well as createaccount.cgi. Don't automatically create account on login page. minor Bugzilla-General Bugzilla

description: For the case of rename/delete  1) Rename/Delete a folder "A".  2) Recreate the same folder "A" at the same level.  The rdf resource associated with old folder A should have been released and a  new resource should have been created for new folder A but it does not happen.  The following bugs should be fixed once we can figure out this leak.   bug 64463 bug 65303 bug 87872
my_mothod: For the case of rename/delete  1) Rename/Delete a folder "A".  2) Recreate the same folder "A" at the same level.  The rdf resource associated with old folder A should have been released and a  new resource should have been created for new folder A but it does not happen.  The following bugs should be fixed once we can figure out this leak.   bug 64463 bug 65303 bug 87872 MLK of the rdf resource on folder operations rename, delete, move/copy, empty trash. minor Backend MailNews Core

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Win98; en-US; rv:0.9.1+) Gecko/20010629 BuildID:    2001062906  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Load the testcase 2. Scroll te page to the bottom. 3. Click the drop-down list. 4. The drop-down list (drop-*up*, literally) appeared. 5. Hover to the second item of the list.  Actual Results:  The drop-down list has the top border missing.  The content seems to leak out.  Expected Results:  The top border is drawn to bound the list properly (visually).
my_mothod: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Win98; en-US; rv:0.9.1+) Gecko/20010629 BuildID:    2001062906  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Load the testcase 2. Scroll te page to the bottom. 3. Click the drop-down list. 4. The drop-down list (drop-*up*, literally) appeared. 5. Hover to the second item of the list.  Actual Results:  The drop-down list has the top border missing.  The content seems to leak out.  Expected Results:  The top border is drawn to bound the list properly (visually). [FIX]Top border bounding the drop-down list is missing minor Layout: Form Controls Core

description: using 7/5 build of netscape:  1) launch netscape 2) launch composer 3) insert 2 x 2 table 4) populate each cell with text 5) use drag-select to select some cells 6) click on "-a" button on toolbar 7) click on HTML Source button  Notice the <small> and </small> tags are everywhere.  Why do we need two sets of <small> containers within each <td> ?
my_mothod: using 7/5 build of netscape:  1) launch netscape 2) launch composer 3) insert 2 x 2 table 4) populate each cell with text 5) use drag-select to select some cells 6) click on "-a" button on toolbar 7) click on HTML Source button  Notice the <small> and </small> tags are everywhere.  Why do we need two sets of <small> containers within each <td> ? extra <small> tags everywhere when changing font on cells trivial DOM: Editor Core

description: There are a few unusued reflow types which we should probably just toss over the transom. Anyone object?
my_mothod: There are a few unusued reflow types which we should probably just toss over the transom. Anyone object? remove unused nsIReflowCommand::ReflowType values trivial Layout Core

description: The query page only allows a limited range of sorting options.  You can access more sorting options by clicking on column titles on the bug list page.  Then by clicking "Edit Query" you can store a query with a non-standard sort order.  This was useful for my "Voted Bugs" stored queries.  When you edit the query however you get a weird option that is essentially an SQL fragment.  This is confusing to the user and potentially contains duplicates which just looks silly.  It however does work.  It would be nice to be able to back-translate the sort order into something understandable and without duplicates.
my_mothod: The query page only allows a limited range of sorting options.  You can access more sorting options by clicking on column titles on the bug list page.  Then by clicking "Edit Query" you can store a query with a non-standard sort order.  This was useful for my "Voted Bugs" stored queries.  When you edit the query however you get a weird option that is essentially an SQL fragment.  This is confusing to the user and potentially contains duplicates which just looks silly.  It however does work.  It would be nice to be able to back-translate the sort order into something understandable and without duplicates. Editing a query with a non-standard sort order. trivial Query/Bug List Bugzilla

my_mothod: nsIImageFrame appears to have a bunch of unneeded methods; attaching a patch to remove all but the methods that are used outside of layout. remove unncessary methods from nsIImageFrame trivial Layout Core

my_mothod: "To change your votes, type in new numbers (using zero to mean no votes) or  change the checkbox, and then click Submit."  Since we're not using numbers anymore, shouldn't this be fixed? Fix text on votes page trivial Bugzilla-General Bugzilla

description: The problem has  to do with signtool signing  a  directory with hidden files (e.g. .emacs).   These  kind of files  do   not get signed   and included into the final jar file.  It seems that the foreach  function in util.c  ignores any file with a "." prefix. It should have only ignored files that have "." prefix AND have filename size of 1.
my_mothod: The problem has  to do with signtool signing  a  directory with hidden files (e.g. .emacs).   These  kind of files  do   not get signed   and included into the final jar file.  It seems that the foreach  function in util.c  ignores any file with a "." prefix. It should have only ignored files that have "." prefix AND have filename size of 1. Signtool not picking up hidden (dot) files when performing signing blocker Tools NSS

description: If you try to do a bulk change, and the resulting bug list is empty (either because it's a bookmarked change or you can from the query page and the bugs there just disappeared), all the change paraphenalia shouldn't appear.  It should just say there's no bugs.
my_mothod: If you try to do a bulk change, and the resulting bug list is empty (either because it's a bookmarked change or you can from the query page and the bugs there just disappeared), all the change paraphenalia shouldn't appear.  It should just say there's no bugs. Do not display the "change several bugs at once" form if there are no bugs in the buglist trivial Creating/Changing Bugs Bugzilla

description: Very minor but anyways...:  in /profile/defaults/mimeTypes.rdf, line 15  According to http://www.w3.org/MarkUp/ it's called: "HyperText Markup Language" not "Hypertext"  in /xpfe/components/winhooks/nsWindowsHooks.cpp, line 72 we also write: "Hypertext Markup Language Document"  So lets be consistent...
my_mothod: Very minor but anyways...:  in /profile/defaults/mimeTypes.rdf, line 15  According to http://www.w3.org/MarkUp/ it's called: "HyperText Markup Language" not "Hypertext"  in /xpfe/components/winhooks/nsWindowsHooks.cpp, line 72 we also write: "Hypertext Markup Language Document"  So lets be consistent... "Hypertext Document" in mimeTypes.rdf should be "HyperText Markup Language Document" trivial Startup & Profiles SeaMonkey

description: This is a minor issue, since we don't support people playing with debug prefs.  My fix for bug 87047 means that we will send proxy-connection: close to a proxy in that case, but standards conforming proxies which don't understand that will expect connection: close. We should be nice, and send that instead.  Theres no client-side consequence; this is just to play nice.
my_mothod: This is a minor issue, since we don't support people playing with debug prefs.  My fix for bug 87047 means that we will send proxy-connection: close to a proxy in that case, but standards conforming proxies which don't understand that will expect connection: close. We should be nice, and send that instead.  Theres no client-side consequence; this is just to play nice. when keep-alives disabled, need to send connection: close to the proxy as well as proxy-connection: close trivial Networking: HTTP Core

description: What you see now:  Increase indent    Ctrl+] Decrease indent    Ctrl+[  What you should see:  Indent    Tab Outdent   Shift+Tab  FYI, Tab and Shift+Tab already works. my_mothod: What you see now:  Increase indent    Ctrl+] Decrease indent    Ctrl+[  What you should see:  Indent    Tab Outdent   Shift+Tab  FYI, Tab and Shift+Tab already works. So it's redundancy and simplification you're fixing if you fix this bug, and of course, making it easier for newcomers to discover Tab instead of some obscure shortcut like "Ctrl+]"  :) Change indenting menuitems (bad keybindings) trivial Composer SeaMonkey

description: Trying to use an SSL socket before the policy is set causes the first handshake to fail with an SSL_DISABLED error.  Since our products don't need to deal with policy anymore, we should probably be hardcoding this to DOMESTIC. We could set this in CryptoManager.initialize, and then no one else would have to worry about it.  The workaround is just to call the function before using SSL. But this is not obvious from the error code. We could release note it.
my_mothod: Trying to use an SSL socket before the policy is set causes the first handshake to fail with an SSL_DISABLED error.  Since our products don't need to deal with policy anymore, we should probably be hardcoding this to DOMESTIC. We could set this in CryptoManager.initialize, and then no one else would have to worry about it.  The workaround is just to call the function before using SSL. But this is not obvious from the error code. We could release note it. SSLSocket.setCipherPolicy needs to be called before using SSL minor Library JSS

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:0.9.3+) Gecko/20010804 BuildID:    2001080408  When going into the Preferences dialog, in the sub-menu Themes under Appearance, clicking on different themes will change the preview below it instantaneously.  However, using the arrow buttons on the keyboard will cause a .5 - .75 second delay before changing the preview below it.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Go to the Edit menu. 2. Click Preferences. 3. Go to the sub-menu, Themes, under Appearance 4. Click anywhere inside the "Installed Themes" Listbox so that the arrow keys can be used to change the selected theme. 5. Use the up or down arrow keys to change the selected theme.  Actual Results:  An approximate .5 to .75 second delay before changing the preview below the Listbox.  Expected Results:  Instantaneously change the preview below the Listbox, as what happens when using the mouse to change the selected theme.
my_mothod: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:0.9.3+) Gecko/20010804 BuildID:    2001080408  When going into the Preferences dialog, in the sub-menu Themes under Appearance, clicking on different themes will change the preview below it instantaneously.  However, using the arrow buttons on the keyboard will cause a .5 - .75 second delay before changing the preview below it.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Go to the Edit menu. 2. Click Preferences. 3. Go to the sub-menu, Themes, under Appearance 4. Click anywhere inside the "Installed Themes" Listbox so that the arrow keys can be used to change the selected theme. 5. Use the up or down arrow keys to change the selected theme.  Actual Results:  An approximate .5 to .75 second delay before changing the preview below the Listbox.  Expected Results:  Instantaneously change the preview below the Listbox, as what happens when using the mouse to change the selected theme. Delay in previewing selected themes using arrow keys trivial Preferences SeaMonkey

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; WinNT4.0; en-US; rv:0.9.3) Gecko/20010801 BuildID:    2001080110  If I enter text into a single-line text box on a web page, and press the right arrow, the cursor will loop to the beginning of the text box (cursor is left of the first character in the textbox.)  This is not true for all text boxes, just some.  Reproducible: Sometimes Steps to Reproduce: 1. go to http://www.slashdot.org/  Go to search box at the bottom of the page. 2.  type in some text into the search box. 3.  Press the right arrow key.  See the cursor move to the start of the line.  Actual Results:  The cursor moves to the left end of the text box.  Expected Results:  Cursor should remain at the right end of the text box.  Duplicated errors on Linux build 2001080221   Code for a text box that fails (slashdot): <input type=name name=query value="" width=20 size=20 length=20>  Code for another box that fails (fruhead.com): <input type=text size=25 maxlength=160 name=message>  Code for a text box that doesn't fail (google): <input type=text value="" framewidth=4 name=q size=55 maxlength=256>  Code for another text box that doesn't fail: <input type=text size=20 maxlength=160 name=message>

See the cursor move to the start of the line.  Actual Results:  The cursor moves to the left end of the text box.  Expected Results:  Cursor should remain at the right end of the text box.  Duplicated errors on Linux build 2001080221   Code for a text box that fails (slashdot): <input type=name name=query value="" width=20 size=20 length=20>  Code for another box that fails (fruhead.com): <input type=text size=25 maxlength=160 name=message>  Code for a text box that doesn't fail (google): <input type=text value="" framewidth=4 name=q size=55 maxlength=256>  Code for another text box that doesn't fail: <input type=text size=20 maxlength=160 name=message> text caret loops if scrolled to the right trivial DOM: Editor Core

description: the variable _pr_logLock is not destroyed in _PR_LogCleanup(). please add _PR_DESTROY_LOCK_LOG() macro (near line 64 & with all the other *_LOCK_LOG() macros) and a call to it somewhere near the bottom of _PR_LogCleanup().  this is a static leak rather than a per-connection leak.  see also bug 94113.
my_mothod: the variable _pr_logLock is not destroyed in _PR_LogCleanup(). please add _PR_DESTROY_LOCK_LOG() macro (near line 64 & with all the other *_LOCK_LOG() macros) and a call to it somewhere near the bottom of _PR_LogCleanup().  this is a static leak rather than a per-connection leak.  see also bug 94113. memory leak of lock variable in prlog.c minor NSPR NSPR
. Grammatical error in bug_status.html trivial Bugzilla-General Bugzilla

description: Java's UnsatisfiedLinkError says "Unable to load jss library" if there is a problem loading any shared library. So, for example, if NSPR is not in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH, you will get this message.  The message should preferably say which library could not be loaded, or, if this is not possible, the error message should indicate that any of the libraries failed to load.
my_mothod: Java's UnsatisfiedLinkError says "Unable to load jss library" if there is a problem loading any shared library. So, for example, if NSPR is not in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH, you will get this message.  The message should preferably say which library could not be loaded, or, if this is not possible, the error message should indicate that any of the libraries failed to load. UnsatisfiedLinkError gives misleading description minor Library JSS

description: I like the great new 'Site Navigation Bar' - thanks to all involved at Mozilla for that, and also the way that Bugzilla uses it, but I notice that sometimes it (and also the old buglist navigation bar) get confused...  i.e.  If you have a buglist open, but then visit a bug not in the list (e.g. from a bookmark, or by clicking on a link in an email etc.), then the navigation bar and the links in the 'Site Navigation Bar' try and work, and next/prev/first/last links are displayed, but you are not really still in the buglist are you, so I don't think the links should exist, should they?  2 possible solutions are:  1) Add a 'nav-buglist' parameter to all the URLs in a buglist, and to all the URLs in the navigation bars, and only use the buglist navigation bar + site navigation bar if this parameter exists. (And in so doing stop using the buglist cookie, and so maybe allowing multiple buglists to work?)  2) In showbug.cgi, check when generating the buglist navigation bar and the Site Navigation Bar links if the bug being shown is actually part of the list, and don't show or enable the links if it isn't.
my_mothod: I like the great new 'Site Navigation Bar' - thanks to all involved at Mozilla for that, and also the way that Bugzilla uses it, but I notice that sometimes it (and also the old buglist navigation bar) get confused...  i.e.  If you have a buglist open, but then visit a bug not in the list (e.g. from a bookmark, or by clicking on a link in an email etc.), then the navigation bar and the links in the 'Site Navigation Bar' try and work, and next/prev/first/last links are displayed, but you are not really still in the buglist are you, so I don't think the links should exist, should they?  2 possible solutions are:  1) Add a 'nav-buglist' parameter to all the URLs in a buglist, and to all the URLs in the navigation bars, and only use the buglist navigation bar + site navigation bar if this parameter exists. (And in so doing stop using the buglist cookie, and so maybe allowing multiple buglists to work?)  2) In showbug.cgi, check when generating the buglist navigation bar and the Site Navigation Bar links if the bug being shown is actually part of the list, and don't show or enable the links if it isn't. Site Navigation Bar incorrect if viewing a bug not in the list minor Query/Bug List Bugzilla

description: Currently, when adding to CC list, it is possible to be inadvertantly added  twice if the Bugzilla account address and the CC address do not use exactly the  same case.  Perhaps protocols allow for case sensitivity in e-mail addresses - but if not,  then perhaps they could be case-insensitive in Bugzilla.
my_mothod: Currently, when adding to CC list, it is possible to be inadvertantly added  twice if the Bugzilla account address and the CC address do not use exactly the  same case.  Perhaps protocols allow for case sensitivity in e-mail addresses - but if not,  then perhaps they could be case-insensitive in Bugzilla. Suggest e-mail addresses should be case-insensitive. trivial Email Notifications Bugzilla

description: This code at pkcs11.c:656, in pk11_handleCertObject, doesn't properly NULL-terminate the copied nickname string.  cert->nickname = (char *)PORT_ArenaAlloc(cert->arena, PORT_Strlen(label)+1);           if(cert->nickname == NULL) {     return CKR_HOST_MEMORY; } PORT_Memcpy(cert->nickname, label, PORT_Strlen(label));  This doesn't cause any problems in the code path I witnessed, but it did cause some confusion during debugging.
my_mothod: This code at pkcs11.c:656, in pk11_handleCertObject, doesn't properly NULL-terminate the copied nickname string.  cert->nickname = (char *)PORT_ArenaAlloc(cert->arena, PORT_Strlen(label)+1);           if(cert->nickname == NULL) {     return CKR_HOST_MEMORY; } PORT_Memcpy(cert->nickname, label, PORT_Strlen(label));  This doesn't cause any problems in the code path I witnessed, but it did cause some confusion during debugging. nickname is not NULL-terminated minor Libraries NSS

description: This is just a minor problem I noticed while examining our build log on Solaris.  On 32-bit Solaris SPARC Edition, NSS files are compiled with -xarch=v8, with the following exceptions. - One file (freebl/loader.c) is (mistakenly?) compiled with   -xarch=v8 -xchip=ultra2. - libfreebl_hybrid_3.so is compiled with -xarch=v8plus or   -xarch=v8plusa and -xchip=ultra2.  The following makefile fragment from freebl/Makefile is incorrect.  There are three cases when compiling freebl files. 1. Default.  Neither USE_PURE_32 nor USE_HYBRID is    defined.  freebl/loader.c belongs to this case. 2. Pure32.  USE_PURE_32 is defined. 3. Hybrid.  USE_HYBRID is defined.  The makefile in freebl says:  ifndef USE_PURE_32     OS_CFLAGS += -xchip=ultra2 endif  This is why not only the "hybrid" case but also the "default" case (freebl/loader.c) is compiled with -xchip=ultra2.  I think the intention is that only the "hybrid" case should be compiled with -xchip=ultra2. Therefore the above should be changed to:  ifdef USE_HYBRID     OS_CFLAGS += -xchip=ultra2 endif
my_mothod: This is just a minor problem I noticed while examining our build log on Solaris.  On 32-bit Solaris SPARC Edition, NSS files are compiled with -xarch=v8, with the following exceptions. - One file (freebl/loader.c) is (mistakenly?) compiled with   -xarch=v8 -xchip=ultra2. - libfreebl_hybrid_3.so is compiled with -xarch=v8plus or   -xarch=v8plusa and -xchip=ultra2.  The following makefile fragment from freebl/Makefile is incorrect.  There are three cases when compiling freebl files. 1. Default.  Neither USE_PURE_32 nor USE_HYBRID is    defined.  freebl/loader.c belongs to this case. 2. Pure32.  USE_PURE_32 is defined. 3. Hybrid.  USE_HYBRID is defined.  The makefile in freebl says:  ifndef USE_PURE_32     OS_CFLAGS += -xchip=ultra2 endif  This is why not only the "hybrid" case but also the "default" case (freebl/loader.c) is compiled with -xchip=ultra2.  I think the intention is that only the "hybrid" case should be compiled with -xchip=ultra2. Therefore the above should be changed to:  ifdef USE_HYBRID     OS_CFLAGS += -xchip=ultra2 endif freebl/loader.c is compiled with the -xchip=ultra2 flag. minor Build NSS

description: At http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/modules/plugin/base/src/nsPluginHostImpl.h#63 we specify that "name of the directory which will be created temporary files." is "plugtmp".  Hhy not use the already create cache directory? A lot of people have the mozilla cache directory outside the profile directory to minimize network ativity.  Please use the mozilla cache directory instead of creating your own cache directory!
my_mothod: At http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/modules/plugin/base/src/nsPluginHostImpl.h#63 we specify that "name of the directory which will be created temporary files." is "plugtmp".  Hhy not use the already create cache directory? A lot of people have the mozilla cache directory outside the profile directory to minimize network ativity.  Please use the mozilla cache directory instead of creating your own cache directory! temp files should be cached in OS's "temp" directory not "plugtmp" trivial Plug-ins Core

description: Look at bug 11632 - the first five email addresses in the CC: list begins with  A, E, P, S and V! This happens because Bugzilla treats the email addresses as  case sensitive values when sorting them, and some people seem to like putting  capital letters in their email addresses.
my_mothod: Look at bug 11632 - the first five email addresses in the CC: list begins with  A, E, P, S and V! This happens because Bugzilla treats the email addresses as  case sensitive values when sorting them, and some people seem to like putting  capital letters in their email addresses. Email addresses in cc list should be sorted case insensitively trivial User Interface Bugzilla

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:0.9.5+) Gecko/20011019 BuildID:    2001101909  When autocomplete for the MailNews To: field gets activated, it completely hangs Mozilla.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. In MailNews, compose a new message (e.g. with CTRL+M). 2. Start typing in the To: field. 3. After a few chars, stop typing so that autocomplete jumps in.  Actual Results:  Hang with 100% CPU. Mozilla does not respond any more at all.  Expected Results:  An autocomplete result (if available).  This bug happens even after the first char if I pause after typing it.  It doesn't matter whether the typed string would actually lead to a result. (E.g. typing ajasdfhjasdf triggers this bug as well.)  URL bar autocomplete seems to work fine, though.

description: Opening a new bug from Seth's comments in bug 88931. This was one of the bug that he mentions which is still an existing bug.  If you have a message that failed to send followed by other valid messages that needs to be sent in the unsent message folder, we fail to recognize.  Steps: Open mail Compose a few messages and send later Also compose a message to a invalid newsgroup with the above messages Send these messages from the file menu item send unsent messages You will see that all messages get sent and the bogus message to invalid newsgroup fails and remains in the unsent message folder Compose a 2 more new mails and send later(goes to unsent message folder) You will notice that the first message in the unsent message folder is the invalid message followed by two other new messages that you just composed Try to send unsent message again Actual Results: Will try to send the first message in the list which is our bogus message and fails to send. And does not recognize two other valid message that needs to get sent.    Expected results: Should try to send other valid messages in the folder.
my_mothod: Opening a new bug from Seth's comments in bug 88931. This was one of the bug that he mentions which is still an existing bug.  If you have a message that failed to send followed by other valid messages that needs to be sent in the unsent message folder, we fail to recognize.  Steps: Open mail Compose a few messages and send later Also compose a message to a invalid newsgroup with the above messages Send these messages from the file menu item send unsent messages You will see that all messages get sent and the bogus message to invalid newsgroup fails and remains in the unsent message folder Compose a 2 more new mails and send later(goes to unsent message folder) You will notice that the first message in the unsent message folder is the invalid message followed by two other new messages that you just composed Try to send unsent message again Actual Results: Will try to send the first message in the list which is our bogus message and fails to send. And does not recognize two other valid message that needs to get sent.    Expected results: Should try to send other valid messages in the folder. Fail to send unsent, we think there in no msgs even though there is. minor Composition MailNews Core

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Win98; en-US; rv:0.9.5) Gecko/20011011 BuildID:    2001102309 (discrepancy because I run a milestone on one box and a nightly on the other, and I see the bug in both)  The wording in the Preferences dialog's Content Packs pane is unclear as to what should be restarted for a new content pack to take effect.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open Mozilla. 2. Edit > Preferences... 3. Under Appearance, choose Content Packs.  Actual Results:  "You must restart for a new content pack to take effect." Restart what?  Expected Results:  Either "You must restart Mozilla for a new content pack to take effect." or "You must restart {Windows|Mac OS|your X session} for a new content pack to take effect."  I see this in 0.9.5 for Win32 as well as nightly build 2001102309 for Win32.

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; SunOS sun4u; en-US; rv:0.9.5+) Gecko/20011111 BuildID:    2001111122  Added one IMAP account using the New Account wizard. Looks/works fine ( Exchange server )  Added second IMAP account through Mail/News prefs.  Made it use SSL IMAP ( as the server is offsite ). Looks/works find ( U of W IMAP running on Debian GNU/Linux 2.2 )  However, the first IMAP account ( Exchange server ) now has two Inboxes, it's own and the Inbox from the Debian server.  The graphic looks as if I have expanded the Exchange server's Inbox and have another Inbox inside it. Odd.  If I close Mailnews and reopen it, everything looks and acts correctly, the second Inbox on the Exchange server goes away.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.Create IMAP account using Mail/News wizard 2.Create second account manually using Mail/News prefs   Actual Results:  Second Inbox appears on first IMAP account.  Expected Results:  Each account should only have one Inbox attached.  I am marking this as trivial, as it does not do any harm, and goes away as soon as mailnews is closed and opened again. However, maybe it should have the polish keyword, as it looks unprofessional.
my_mothod: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; SunOS sun4u; en-US; rv:0.9.5+) Gecko/20011111 BuildID:    2001111122  Added one IMAP account using the New Account wizard. Looks/works fine ( Exchange server )  Added second IMAP account through Mail/News prefs.  Made it use SSL IMAP ( as the server is offsite ). Looks/works find ( U of W IMAP running on Debian GNU/Linux 2.2 )  However, the first IMAP account ( Exchange server ) now has two Inboxes, it's own and the Inbox from the Debian server.  The graphic looks as if I have expanded the Exchange server's Inbox and have another Inbox inside it. Odd.  If I close Mailnews and reopen it, everything looks and acts correctly, the second Inbox on the Exchange server goes away.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.Create IMAP account using Mail/News wizard 2.Create second account manually using Mail/News prefs   Actual Results:  Second Inbox appears on first IMAP account.  Expected Results:  Each account should only have one Inbox attached.  I am marking this as trivial, as it does not do any harm, and goes away as soon as mailnews is closed and opened again. However, maybe it should have the polish keyword, as it looks unprofessional. inbox shows up twice on first account when adding second IMAP account trivial MailNews: Message Display SeaMonkey

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; WinNT4.0; en-US; rv:0.9.5) Gecko/20011011 BuildID:    2001101117  This is the site of a German computer zine. With this popup window one can mail articles and recommendations to a friend. If you try to enter data into the forms you'll recognize that all input is tranformed to upper case. Especially annoying with the German Umlaut ß (ß) where two s will be echoed. If you send URLs they become invalid, of course.   Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Enter text into the provided forms 2. See the text becoming upper cased 3. This is it.  Expected Results:  ;-) It should echo upper case when SHIFT or CAPSLOCK is pressed only. At least this is what IE does.

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC; en-US; rv:0.9.5+) Gecko/20011116 BuildID:    2001111608  The description for selecting your language says "You must restart for a new language setting to take effect."  It should say "You must restart Mozilla for a new language setting to take effect."  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. open Preferences 2. select Appearance 3. read the text  Actual Results:  User is deluded into thinking the computer must be rebooted, since that's what "you must restart" usually means in other applications.  This is basically the same as Bug 109477.  I found the string here: http://lxr.mozilla.org/seamonkey/source/xpfe/components/prefwindow/resources/locale/en-US/pref-appearance.dtd#34  Just change it to: <!ENTITY languageList.txt.label "Choose a language for &brandShortName;. The setting affects the language for text that appears in dialog boxes, menus, toolbars, and button labels. You must restart &brandShortName; for a new language setting to take effect.">  Unfortunately I am too lazy to learn how to make patches.  Of course the change needs to be localized too...
my_mothod: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC; en-US; rv:0.9.5+) Gecko/20011116 BuildID:    2001111608  The description for selecting your language says "You must restart for a new language setting to take effect."  It should say "You must restart Mozilla for a new language setting to take effect."  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. open Preferences 2. select Appearance 3. read the text  Actual Results:  User is deluded into thinking the computer must be rebooted, since that's what "you must restart" usually means in other applications.  This is basically the same as Bug 109477.  I found the string here: http://lxr.mozilla.org/seamonkey/source/xpfe/components/prefwindow/resources/locale/en-US/pref-appearance.dtd#34  Just change it to: <!ENTITY languageList.txt.label "Choose a language for &brandShortName;. The setting affects the language for text that appears in dialog boxes, menus, toolbars, and button labels. You must restart &brandShortName; for a new language setting to take effect.">  Unfortunately I am too lazy to learn how to make patches.  Of course the change needs to be localized too... Description for changing languages should say "You must restart Mozilla" trivial Preferences SeaMonkey

description: The bugzilla installation at http://bugzilla.lysator.liu.se/ contains several programs.  Three of them are "fsh", "lyskomd" and "kom++".  If I create a remembered query with the programs "fsh" and "kom++" selected (and nothing else selected), and try to "Load the remembered query", I get a software error.  The first part of the query page looks OK, but where the "Program: Version: Component: Target milestone:" header should be, the following text is inserted:      Content-type: text/html       Software error:      Nested quantifiers before HERE mark in regex m/fsh|kom++ << HERE / at CGI.pl     line 564.  No page footer is displayed.  If the query contains only "kom++", or "fsh" and "lyskomd", the query can be loaded.  That is why I suspect that the "+" sign are the cause of the problem. That suspicion may be wrong.  If I run the query and hit the "Edit this query" button I arrive at the URL entered into the URL field of this report.  That page is broken in the same way as described above.
my_mothod: The bugzilla installation at http://bugzilla.lysator.liu.se/ contains several programs.  Three of them are "fsh", "lyskomd" and "kom++".  If I create a remembered query with the programs "fsh" and "kom++" selected (and nothing else selected), and try to "Load the remembered query", I get a software error.  The first part of the query page looks OK, but where the "Program: Version: Component: Target milestone:" header should be, the following text is inserted:      Content-type: text/html       Software error:      Nested quantifiers before HERE mark in regex m/fsh|kom++ << HERE / at CGI.pl     line 564.  No page footer is displayed.  If the query contains only "kom++", or "fsh" and "lyskomd", the query can be loaded.  That is why I suspect that the "+" sign are the cause of the problem. That suspicion may be wrong.  If I run the query and hit the "Edit this query" button I arrive at the URL entered into the URL field of this report.  That page is broken in the same way as described above. Unencoded regexps passed to make_selection_widget. minor Query/Bug List Bugzilla

description: Steps to reproduce:  1)  Open mailnews 2)  Compose a new email 3)  Enter a subject and body text.  Leave the "to" field blank 4)  Hit "send" 5)  A message will popup to tell you that you need to specify recipients 6)  When you hit "ok", the mailnews window will have been moved to the front and the e-mail will be behind it.  Note:  This does not occur when mailnews is open but a browser window is currently behind your e-mail.  In this case, the e-mail stays on top, like it should.
my_mothod: Steps to reproduce:  1)  Open mailnews 2)  Compose a new email 3)  Enter a subject and body text.  Leave the "to" field blank 4)  Hit "send" 5)  A message will popup to tell you that you need to specify recipients 6)  When you hit "ok", the mailnews window will have been moved to the front and the e-mail will be behind it.  Note:  This does not occur when mailnews is open but a browser window is currently behind your e-mail.  In this case, the e-mail stays on top, like it should. mail without any recipients sent behind mailnews window when send is clicked minor Composition MailNews Core

description: I think we should be using -Wno-ctor-dtor-privacy (and maybe -Wno-non-virtual-dtor , but see below) for C++, because I think these warnings are often erroneous, particularly in the context of our codebase, and encourage people to make destructors virtual and public when they should often be non-virtual (yielding a performance benefit) and private (yielding some additional enforcement of XPCOM rules).  This raises one issue -- that we could end up hiding warnings for cases where people really *do* want a virtual destructor.  So perhaps a better solution would be to just disable the ctor-dtor-privacy warnings -- after all, if people weren't able to use their class, they'd probably notice eventually. :-)  This leads to a simple workaround for the non-virtual-dtor warning in the cases where it is appropriate to have a non-virtual dtor -- making the destructor private, which is generally what is meant in that case anyway.  (C++ gurus -- is it still possible to inherit from a class with a private destructor?)  So I think a good solution would be to -Wno-ctor-dtor-privacy (but not -Wno-non-virtual-dtor).  And I might force you to do this reasonably soon anyway, by writing some string code that triggers this warning and is included in over half the files that we build. :-)
my_mothod: I think we should be using -Wno-ctor-dtor-privacy (and maybe -Wno-non-virtual-dtor , but see below) for C++, because I think these warnings are often erroneous, particularly in the context of our codebase, and encourage people to make destructors virtual and public when they should often be non-virtual (yielding a performance benefit) and private (yielding some additional enforcement of XPCOM rules).  This raises one issue -- that we could end up hiding warnings for cases where people really *do* want a virtual destructor.  So perhaps a better solution would be to just disable the ctor-dtor-privacy warnings -- after all, if people weren't able to use their class, they'd probably notice eventually. :-)  This leads to a simple workaround for the non-virtual-dtor warning in the cases where it is appropriate to have a non-virtual dtor -- making the destructor private, which is generally what is meant in that case anyway.  (C++ gurus -- is it still possible to inherit from a class with a private destructor?)  So I think a good solution would be to -Wno-ctor-dtor-privacy (but not -Wno-non-virtual-dtor).  And I might force you to do this reasonably soon anyway, by writing some string code that triggers this warning and is included in over half the files that we build. :-) Should probably -Wno-ctor-dtor-privacy for g++ trivial Build Config SeaMonkey

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:0.9.6+) Gecko/20011212 BuildID:    2001121203  I have had this problem w/ mozilla since the beginning. I always figured someone had reported it & it was just too hard to fix, but its getting close now so it better be fixed. I searched for "text display" "character display" & "text pagedown" & could not find this bug listed, so apologies if its a duplicate.  Basically, when I'm browsing, I will press pagedown to go down a page then the down arrow to line up a paragraph so I can read the whole thing. sometimes I will press the down arrow very soon after pagedown. This results in the bottom line of text being displayed incorrectly. The text will be somewhat readable, but it will either be too dark or be missing the lower portion of the whole line of text.   If you then select this text it will revert to normal.  Reproducible: Sometimes Steps to Reproduce: 1.Open page w/ lots of text 2.Scroll down using pagedown then the down arrow - not simultaneosly, but down arrow VERY soon after. 3.  Actual Results:  Bottom line of text displays incorrectly, either as part of it too bold/dark or part of the whole line missing. if you highlight/select this text by left clicking & selecting it, the text is displayed correctly.  Expected Results:  Text will display correctly the first time.  This is not specific to any page but to Mozilla. It will happen on any page w/ lots of text, actually any page, but it will happen to me more because on a long page I will be scrolling down more. I have never seen this happen in MS IE. This is the one reason why I do not use mozilla full time, because it just irks me when I have to highlight some text to make it more legible.  I would guess its in gecko rendering engine, but then again prolly not, cos the page is already loaded, the text will display fine until you pgdn/down arrow at around the same time.  I can provide screen captures, I will attach one if there is a place to.

description: merging nkcache module with necko module improves startup time  on an optimized linux build, i noticed about a 0.8% startup improvement after merging libnkcache.so with libnecko.so.  there's no real reason to keep the cache in a separate dll.  it was originally intended to be part of the core necko module, and only started out as a separate module to simplify development.
my_mothod: merging nkcache module with necko module improves startup time  on an optimized linux build, i noticed about a 0.8% startup improvement after merging libnkcache.so with libnecko.so.  there's no real reason to keep the cache in a separate dll.  it was originally intended to be part of the core necko module, and only started out as a separate module to simplify development. merging libnkcache.so with libnecko.so improves startup time minor Networking: Cache Core

description:
When a module is installed but the version isn't new enough, checksetup.pl  issues the following warning ( I'll just dump the code ).  if (@missing > 0) {     print "

";     print "You are missing some Perl modules which are required by Bugzilla.
";     print "They can be installed by running (as root) the following:
";     foreach my $module (@missing) {         print "   perl -MCPAN -e 'install "$module"'
";     }     print "
";     exit; }  The message is wrong, and should be changed to something like  "Bugzilla requires some Perl modules which are either missing from your system,  or the version on your system is too old."  This is a good idea in general, but is going to cause less headaches when the  patch for Bug 67663 goes in, and people upgrading won't have a new enough  version of CGI::Carp.
my_mothod:

";     }     print "
";     exit; }  The message is wrong, and should be changed to something like  "Bugzilla requires some Perl modules which are either missing from your system,  or the version on your system is too old."  This is a good idea in general, but is going to cause less headaches when the  patch for Bug 67663 goes in, and people upgrading won't have a new enough  version of CGI::Carp. Incorrect message from checksetup.pl trivial Installation & Upgrading Bugzilla

description: Some people are using the built in "uri" and "html" filters provided by  Template.pm for use in their templates and others are importing the url_quote()  and value_quote() functions in and using those instead. If both accomplish the  same thing I feel we should standardize on using the builtin Template.pm filters to  avoid unnecessary pollution of the namespace. We can always pass in new filters  using the FILTERS option if functionality is lacking that we need. What is the  general opinion about this?
my_mothod: Some people are using the built in "uri" and "html" filters provided by  Template.pm for use in their templates and others are importing the url_quote()  and value_quote() functions in and using those instead. If both accomplish the  same thing I feel we should standardize on using the builtin Template.pm filters to  avoid unnecessary pollution of the namespace. We can always pass in new filters  using the FILTERS option if functionality is lacking that we need. What is the  general opinion about this? Use of Template.pm filters for url and html encoding. minor User Interface Bugzilla

description: The mail composer window statusbar has a "hole" where progress indicator used  to be. The progress indicator seems to have been removed or is not working but  there's now a "missing piece" in the statusbar where the progress indicator  used to be. It's barely visible in Modern, due to the theme, but it's quite  noticable in Classic. If it's meant to be removed, then the text part  (where "Document: done" etc. is) should probably expand all the way to the  right edge of the status bar.
my_mothod: The mail composer window statusbar has a "hole" where progress indicator used  to be. description:
Given a preformatted text (one contained inside 
..
), you can force the css drawn box to be smaller than the text playing with your brosers' window width. The expected behaviour is to have the drawn box at least as wide as the preformatted text, even if the browser's window is not wide enough to show the whole preformatted text. Looks like IE 5.5 get's this right.

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:0.9.8) Gecko/20020205 BuildID:    2002020511  When I tried to add a search engine from mozdev.org it fails to add it because I do not have write permission to the searchplugins folder /usr/lib/searchplugins (mozilla0.9.8 redhat 7 RPMS)  The problem is that no error or anything is displayed. Even confirmation of a (un)successful install would be nice.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Login as non-root/unprivileged user 2. try to add a search engine (javascript:addEngine()) or mycroft.mozdev.org   Actual Results:  If you do not have write permissions to the searchplugins folder then the addition just fails.  Expected Results:  It should display some sort of error message.  When installing search engines, there should be either confirmation of a successful install or some sort of error message.  Personally search engines on a per user basis would also be nice.

Personally search engines on a per user basis would also be nice. Should display an error message when failing to add a search engine minor Search SeaMonkey

description: spamming editor folks becasue there are some issues to discuss....  on 2001-12-04 10:01 TucsonTester1 reported in bug 103213:  Text style does not continue after highlighting text and selecting a text style beyond the first line. Build ID: 2001120303  1.Open a blank page in the editor 2.Enter text then highlight 3.Change the style (Bold/Italic/Underline) 4.Insert cursor directly after that text 5.Enter more text/Verify that the new text retained the style selected 6.Deselect the text style and hit the enter key 7.Enter text then highlight 8.Change the style (Bold/Italic/Underline) 9.Insert cursor directly after that text 10.Enter more text  Actual Results: The text style is discontinued on the second line of text.  Expected Results: I would expect that the text style would be continued just as it did on the first line in the body.  Note: If you do not enter any text on the first line (just hit the enter key) you get the same results - the text style does not continue.
my_mothod: spamming editor folks becasue there are some issues to discuss....  on 2001-12-04 10:01 TucsonTester1 reported in bug 103213:  Text style does not continue after highlighting text and selecting a text style beyond the first line. Build ID: 2001120303  1.Open a blank page in the editor 2.Enter text then highlight 3.Change the style (Bold/Italic/Underline) 4.Insert cursor directly after that text 5.Enter more text/Verify that the new text retained the style selected 6.Deselect the text style and hit the enter key 7.Enter text then highlight 8.Change the style (Bold/Italic/Underline) 9.Insert cursor directly after that text 10.Enter more text  Actual Results: The text style is discontinued on the second line of text.  Expected Results: I would expect that the text style would be continued just as it did on the first line in the body.  Note: If you do not enter any text on the first line (just hit the enter key) you get the same results - the text style does not continue. clicking at end of styled line of text may not get you inside the style minor DOM: Editor Core

description: When using gcc 3.0.3 - with OSF/1 4.0d Compilation fails at  nsprpub/pr/src/md/unix/uxrng.c line 91  use of <c_asm.h> - in a gcc compiler seems to be a problem.  gcc's 'asm'  appears to overide the declared asm in c_asm.h use of <machine/builtins.h> and replacing t = asm("rpcc %v0"); with t = __RPCC();  works fine.    Other fixes probably exist.
my_mothod: When using gcc 3.0.3 - with OSF/1 4.0d Compilation fails at  nsprpub/pr/src/md/unix/uxrng.c line 91  use of <c_asm.h> - in a gcc compiler seems to be a problem.  gcc's 'asm'  appears to overide the declared asm in c_asm.h use of <machine/builtins.h> and replacing t = asm("rpcc %v0"); with t = __RPCC();  works fine.    Other fixes probably exist. unable to compile using gcc on OSF/1 blocker NSPR NSPR

description: CVS snapshot from 20th February, 2002 (09:22 EST) compiling using MSVC (version 6.0) with stlport 4.0.  In prtime.c, the function PR_USPacificTimeParameters uses "std" as an internal variable name. When I try to compile with the stlport include directory in my INCLUDE environment variable, I get a number of compilation errors of the form:  prtime.c(792) : error C2143: syntax error : missing ';' before '.'  These can be eliminated by renaming the internal variable to something other than "std".
my_mothod: CVS snapshot from 20th February, 2002 (09:22 EST) compiling using MSVC (version 6.0) with stlport 4.0.  In prtime.c, the function PR_USPacificTimeParameters uses "std" as an internal variable name. When I try to compile with the stlport include directory in my INCLUDE environment variable, I get a number of compilation errors of the form:  prtime.c(792) : error C2143: syntax error : missing ';' before '.'  These can be eliminated by renaming the internal variable to something other than "std". PR_USPacificTimeParameters uses "std" as internal variable name trivial NSPR NSPR

description: This bug was filed to track the removal of this patch:      http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=71719&action=view  which landed as a fix for bug 127368, and the replacement with the proposed mozilla1.0 patch, also in bug 127368:      http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=71778&action=view  Right now KeyEvents are being run through the ViewManager::HandleEvent() code that dispatches based the coordinates in the event. This is how it was done prior to roc+moz@cs.cmu.edu's ViewManager tree landing.
my_mothod: This bug was filed to track the removal of this patch:      http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=71719&action=view  which landed as a fix for bug 127368, and the replacement with the proposed mozilla1.0 patch, also in bug 127368:      http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=71778&action=view  Right now KeyEvents are being run through the ViewManager::HandleEvent() code that dispatches based the coordinates in the event. This is how it was done prior to roc+moz@cs.cmu.edu's ViewManager tree landing. ViewManager: KeyEvents shouldn't use coordinate-based event dispatching minor Web Painting Core

description: To reproduce the problem:  1) Go to www.aerovironment.com 2) go to page setup and enable printing of background images 3) Print the page.  Expected Results:  The image tiled on the left should print out in a constant, repeating pattern down the left as it appears in the browser, and if the image spans the page, it should be truncated.  Actual results: The image tiles normally, except for the last image tiled on the bottom of the page - it appears to have been compressed to fit in the available space on the page (~1/3 or 1/4).  Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:0.9.8+) Gecko/20020304
my_mothod: To reproduce the problem:  1) Go to www.aerovironment.com 2) go to page setup and enable printing of background images 3) Print the page.  Expected Results:  The image tiled on the left should print out in a constant, repeating pattern down the left as it appears in the browser, and if the image spans the page, it should be truncated.  Actual results: The image tiles normally, except for the last image tiled on the bottom of the page - it appears to have been compressed to fit in the available space on the page (~1/3 or 1/4).  Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:0.9.8+) Gecko/20020304 Printing web page (with backround) compresses last image of tiled image minor Printing: Output Core

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X; en-US; rv:0.9.9) Gecko/20020310 BuildID:    2002031005    Reproducible: Sometimes Steps to Reproduce: 1. Launch Mail & News, connect to IMAP server 2. Select message in thread pane   Actual Results:  Since upgrading to 0.9.9 (today): (1) Some messages display OK. (2) Some display only the first few lines (and nothing in "View Source") (3) Some cause hang (spinning beachball, 80% CPU, have to force quit) (4) Some cause complete crash (see backtrace attached)  Expected Results:  All messages should download and display. (0.9.8 and subsequent nightlies gave me none of those problems, except maybe (2) sometimes.)  If that matters: • The IMAP account is over SSL • I'm using 3-pane view • Backtrace below was when downloading a mulitipart message   (sourceforge mailing list digest), but I also got crashes   on simpler messages.

description: please add support for about:home Internet Explorer 6 has this feature.   This would allow me to easily include a home button where i want in my toolbar without being forced to hack chrome.    FYI IE6 handles the about: protocol by storing the value in this registry key Hkey_Local_Machine/Software/Microsoft/Internet Explorer/AboutURLs  If mozilla had an easy way for users to setup their own about: urls then you would be able to close about 50 bugs (including this one) as being frivilous/bloat/pointless and let the user define it themselves if they really want them.  That said i would quite like this feature.    Pointers on how to implement it myself would be appreciated.
my_mothod: please add support for about:home Internet Explorer 6 has this feature.   This would allow me to easily include a home button where i want in my toolbar without being forced to hack chrome.    FYI IE6 handles the about: protocol by storing the value in this registry key Hkey_Local_Machine/Software/Microsoft/Internet Explorer/AboutURLs  If mozilla had an easy way for users to setup their own about: urls then you would be able to close about 50 bugs (including this one) as being frivilous/bloat/pointless and let the user define it themselves if they really want them.  That said i would quite like this feature.    Pointers on how to implement it myself would be appreciated. about:home  as seen in IE6 trivial Networking Core

Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. enter http://www.w3.org/Style/CSS/ 2. shrink your browser window 3. if the problem doesn't appear try to shrink the browser window more  Actual Results:  the format model of boxes on that page goes wrong  Expected Results:  keep the format model

description: The definition of NSC_GenerateKeyPair is:  3005 CK_RV NSC_GenerateKeyPair (CK_SESSION_HANDLE hSession, 3006 CK_MECHANISM_PTR pMechanism, CK_ATTRIBUTE_PTR pPublicKeyTemplate, 3007 CK_ULONG ulPublicKeyAttributeCount, CK_ATTRIBUTE_PTR pPrivateKeyTemplate, 3008 CK_ULONG ulPrivateKeyAttributeCount, CK_OBJECT_HANDLE_PTR phPrivateKey, 3009 CK_OBJECT_HANDLE_PTR phPublicKey)  According to PKCS#11, the last two arguments should be switched.  The public key goes before the private key in the definition of C_GenerateKeyPair.
my_mothod: The definition of NSC_GenerateKeyPair is:  3005 CK_RV NSC_GenerateKeyPair (CK_SESSION_HANDLE hSession, 3006 CK_MECHANISM_PTR pMechanism, CK_ATTRIBUTE_PTR pPublicKeyTemplate, 3007 CK_ULONG ulPublicKeyAttributeCount, CK_ATTRIBUTE_PTR pPrivateKeyTemplate, 3008 CK_ULONG ulPrivateKeyAttributeCount, CK_OBJECT_HANDLE_PTR phPrivateKey, 3009 CK_OBJECT_HANDLE_PTR phPublicKey)  According to PKCS#11, the last two arguments should be switched.  The public key goes before the private key in the definition of C_GenerateKeyPair. NSC_GenerateKeyPair is not defined as in PKCS#11 spec minor Libraries NSS

description: From Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:0.9.9+) Gecko/20020325 BuildID:    2002032508  The mouse pointer is an "x" instead of the usual arrow when selecting items in Personal Toolbar dropdown menus (nested folders.)  Reproducible: Sometimes Steps to Reproduce: 1. Set up a bookmark folder in the Personal Toolbar 2. Mouse over, but do not click on, a link in the folder  Actual Results:  You see an "x" where an arrow should be.  This is not consistent; sometimes it's OK but most of the time it isn't.  Expected Results:  You should see an arrow not an "x".
