description: Examples: http://tinderbox.mozilla.org/showlog.cgi?log=Firefox/1303493909.1303502325.7070.gz&fulltext=1 WINNT 5.2 mozilla-central build on 2011/04/22 10:38:29 {   WIN32_REDIST_DIR=d:/msvs8/VC/redist/x86/Microsoft.VC80.CRT } http://tinderbox.mozilla.org/showlog.cgi?log=Firefox/1303493910.1303500915.774.gz&fulltext=1 WINNT 5.2 mozilla-central leak test build on 2011/04/22 10:38:30 {   WIN32_REDIST_DIR=d:/msvs8/VC/redist/x86/Microsoft.VC80.CRT }  Bug 565774 comment 7: { Serge Gautherie (:sgautherie)      2011-02-16 05:42:38 PST  Ben, could you tell us where the Firefox WIN32_REDIST_DIR setting comes from? (Afaics, not from build nor mozilla-central repositories...) }  On debug builds, this has never been useful (and has been misused until bug 650699).  On optimized builds, this is useless on all builds with jemalloc enabled, which is the case since mozilla-1.9.1 (Firefox 3.5), except for valgrind builds [I don't know much about these...]. http://mxr.mozilla.org/build/search?string=able-jemalloc&case=1
my_mothod: Examples: http://tinderbox.mozilla.org/showlog.cgi?log=Firefox/1303493909.1303502325.7070.gz&fulltext=1 WINNT 5.2 mozilla-central build on 2011/04/22 10:38:29 {   WIN32_REDIST_DIR=d:/msvs8/VC/redist/x86/Microsoft.VC80.CRT } http://tinderbox.mozilla.org/showlog.cgi?log=Firefox/1303493910.1303500915.774.gz&fulltext=1 WINNT 5.2 mozilla-central leak test build on 2011/04/22 10:38:30 {   WIN32_REDIST_DIR=d:/msvs8/VC/redist/x86/Microsoft.VC80.CRT }  Bug 565774 comment 7: { Serge Gautherie (:sgautherie)      2011-02-16 05:42:38 PST  Ben, could you tell us where the Firefox WIN32_REDIST_DIR setting comes from? (Afaics, not from build nor mozilla-central repositories...) }  On debug builds, this has never been useful (and has been misused until bug 650699).  On optimized builds, this is useless on all builds with jemalloc enabled, which is the case since mozilla-1.9.1 (Firefox 3.5), except for valgrind builds [I don't know much about these...]. http://mxr.mozilla.org/build/search?string=able-jemalloc&case=1 [Firefox] Remove now useless WIN32_REDIST_DIR env var trivial General Release Engineering

description: ../../../../../security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp: In member function 'virtual nsresult nsSecureBrowserUIImpl::OnStateChange(nsIWebProgress*, nsIRequest*, PRUint32, nsresult)': ../../../../../security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp:1071:13: warning: 'saveSubHigh' may be used uninitialized in this function ../../../../../security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp:1071:13: note: 'saveSubHigh' was declared here ../../../../../security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp:1072:13: warning: 'saveSubLow' may be used uninitialized in this function ../../../../../security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp:1072:13: note: 'saveSubLow' was declared here ../../../../../security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp:1073:13: warning: 'saveSubBroken' may be used uninitialized in this function ../../../../../security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp:1073:13: note: 'saveSubBroken' was declared here ../../../../../security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp:1074:13: warning: 'saveSubNo' may be used uninitialized in this function ../../../../../security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp:1074:13: note: 'saveSubNo' was declared here  It seems like the warnings are bogus. The compiler cannot tell that prevContentSecurity will only be non-null when the block that initializes these variables is executed.  We should clean this up so that we don't have to keep seeing them in build logs.  Assigning to Kai based on CVS blame: http://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsblame.cgi?file=mozilla/security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp#989

The compiler cannot tell that prevContentSecurity will only be non-null when the block that initializes these variables is executed.  We should clean this up so that we don't have to keep seeing them in build logs.  Assigning to Kai based on CVS blame: http://bonsai.mozilla.org/cvsblame.cgi?file=mozilla/security/manager/boot/src/nsSecureBrowserUIImpl.cpp#989 Warnings about usage of uninitialized variables in nsSecureBrowserUIImpl::OnStateChange: saveSubBroken, saveSubNo trivial Security: PSM Core

description: When users configure their program, they always look in the preference panel (and surely on mac, as this is the only place all the prefs can be changed) So it is not more than logically the account settings for Thunderbird are also integrated in the preferences panel, instead of being a separate item.  This bug has not a high priority, but would reduce complexity and overall consistency.
my_mothod: When users configure their program, they always look in the preference panel (and surely on mac, as this is the only place all the prefs can be changed) So it is not more than logically the account settings for Thunderbird are also integrated in the preferences panel, instead of being a separate item.  This bug has not a high priority, but would reduce complexity and overall consistency. Move account settings into preferences trivial Preferences Thunderbird

description: In peptest, we currently have prod_config.py (linux+mac), w764_config.py, win7_config.py, and xp_config.py.  I had to separate win7_config.py and xp_config.py in staging due to a differing virtualenv.  However, this difference didn't exist in production, so I ended up making the win7_config.py the same.  w764_config.py came about because of the windows logic in mozilla-tests/config.py was breaking on w764:  http://hg.mozilla.org/build/buildbot-configs/file/2bdb451619d9/mozilla-tests/config.py#l1228  Now we have 3 config files that are exactly the same, with logic on how to call them separately.  We should consolidate the config files to one windows_config.py and call that for all 3 platforms.
my_mothod: In peptest, we currently have prod_config.py (linux+mac), w764_config.py, win7_config.py, and xp_config.py.  I had to separate win7_config.py and xp_config.py in staging due to a differing virtualenv.  However, this difference didn't exist in production, so I ended up making the win7_config.py the same.  w764_config.py came about because of the windows logic in mozilla-tests/config.py was breaking on w764:  http://hg.mozilla.org/build/buildbot-configs/file/2bdb451619d9/mozilla-tests/config.py#l1228  Now we have 3 config files that are exactly the same, with logic on how to call them separately.  We should consolidate the config files to one windows_config.py and call that for all 3 platforms. consolidate windows peptest config files trivial General Release Engineering
